story:
Le Fonds Sophie Berriault 

Un fonds pour financer la recherche en sclérose en plaques (SP)  et la création de services pour les jeunes adultes atteints de sclérose en plaques! 

 

SALUT LA GANG!

L'année dernière, la Société canadienne de la sclérose en plaques a mis sur pied le Fonds Sophie Berriault! Je me suis donc engagée à amasser 20 000 $ par année pour les trois prochaines années ! L'argent qui sera amassé avec cette campagne va servir à financer la recherche et à créer des services pour les jeunes adultes atteints de SP! Bon, je dis jeunes adultes, mais les moins jeunes aussi vont pouvoir profiter de tout ça! ;) 

En décembre 2015, j'ai reçu un diagnostic de sclérose en plaques. Une maladie auto-immune dégénérative qui attaque le système nerveux central. Si je résume : je peux donc perdre, du jour au lendemain, n'importe laquelle de mes fonctions physiques ou cognitives. On va se le dire, c'est n'est pas cool. MAIS, la bonne nouvelle c'est que grâce à l'argent qui a été amassé au cours des 30 dernières années, il y a maintenant des médicaments hyper efficaces qui permettent aux personnes atteintes de sclérose en plaques de mieux vivre avec cette maladie. Il faut par contre continuer à faire avancer la recherche. Pour qu'un jour, nous puissions vivre dans UN MONDE SANS SP! 

Je ne le cacherai pas, j'ai eu une période très noire après avoir reçu mon diagnostic. Une fois que la lumière est apparue au bout du tunnel, j'ai décidé de me remonter les manches et de mettre à profit mon expérience et mes contacts au profit de ma cause, celle de la sclérose en plaques. Après m'être rendu compte qu'il y avait très peu de plateformes adaptées aux jeunes qui sont aux prises avec la maladie, j'ai décidé de mettre sur pied PS j'ai la SP sur Facebook, Instagram et YouTube. Une plateforme où je partage de l'information ''mind, body and soul'' pour aider les jeunes adultes atteints de SP à mieux vivre avec leur maladie. J'y donne des trucs et astuces pour agir sur les éléments sur lesquels  nous avons le contrôle.  Par la suite, je me suis dit : ON VA FAIRE UN SHOW ! Un spectacle au visage des jeunes adultes atteints de SP et qui, du même coup, visait à sensibiliser la population à l'importance des dons pour que la recherche en SP puisse continuer d'avancer. La recherche est notre seul espoir. La première édition du SP Show a eu un succès MONSTRE ! Merci, merci, merci à tous ceux et celles qui étaient présents! Grâce à vous, nous avons amassé un peu plus de 25 000 $ qui ont été remis à  la Société canadienne de la sclérose en plaques. 

Les projets qui seront financés par le Fonds Sophie Berriault 

  • LE SP SHOW !! Gang, on refait le SP Show ! Le tout se tiendra le 30 mai 2020. Le mois de mai étant le mois de la sensibilisation à la sclérose en plaques, on va finir ce mois en beauté avec un SHOW DE FEU !!! 
  • LA WEBSÉRIE ! Ok ! Je capoooote sur ce projet ! La websérie "Souper Party" met en vedette 5 jeunes adultes atteints de SP qui, assis autour d'une table, discutent de ce que ça signifie pour eux de vivre avec la maladie. C'est du ''feel good moment'' à la tonne, je te le promets ! L'objectif avec ce projet est de faire en sorte que les gens atteints de SP se sentent moins seuls. C'est un outil qui pourra les aider à partager leur réalité avec leurs proches. Vous allez TROP aimer cette websérie, gang ! 
  • PS j'ai la SP ! Vous êtes plusieurs à me suivre sur Facebook et Instagram. Merci!!! Vous me remerciez souvent pour ce que je fais avec la plateforme, mais sachez que je suis tout aussi reconnaissante. Vous me donnez le courage de continuer à me battre contre la SP. Grâce à vous, moi aussi, je me sens moins seule! DONC!!! Au cours des prochaines années, je veux améliorer PS j'ai la SP en vous offrant de l'information concise et pertinente! En vous présentant ENFIN des collaborateurs. Vont se joindre à moi une sexologue, un pharmacien, un professeur de yoga, une vulgarisatrice scientifique, ma MÈRE (hihi!) avec qui je discuterai de spiritualité et PLEIN d'autres belles personnes qui veulent vous aider à mieux vivre avec votre maladie. PS j'ai la SP est là pour vous soutenir et pour vous accompagner dans votre aventure avec la SP ! MUCHO LOVE Y'ALL! 
  • LA PARTICIPATION DE L'ÉQUIPE PS J'AI LA SP AU VÉLOTOUR SP OMG ! On a tellement eu de plaisir au Vélotour SP 2019 organisé par Division du Québec de la Société canadienne de la sclérose!! Grâce au soutien financier d'un partenaire, nous avons permis à  3 femmes atteintes de SP et à leur accompagnateur de se joindre à l'équipe PS j'ai la SP.  Ensemble, nous avons amassé, roulement de tambour, 22 000 $. On était tellement heureux. Mais en plus de l'argent amassé, nous avons créé des liens. Nous sommes maintenant 6 femmes atteintes de la maladie qui peuvent compter l'une sur l'autre pour passer à travers les hauts et les bas de la maladie. Nous nous sommes entraînées. Et nous avons pédalé près de 150 km en deux jours. Nous sommes les SuPerFemmes. On répète l'expérience en 2020. J'ai tellement hâte de rencontrer les futurs membres de l'équipe. Vous allez voir, le groupe Facebook de l'équipe est GRANDEMENT divertissant! ;) 
  • LA RECHERCHE La recherche c'est vraiment, mais VRAIMENT important, la gang ! On va donc accompagner un jeune étudiant dans son projet de recherche pour l'aider à NOUS aider. Nous allons choisir cet(te) étudiant(e) dans quelque temps. Et par la suite, nous allons le suivre au cours de ses travaux. Ça va être très NICE! 

 

ET J'AI MILLE AUTRES PROJETS EN TÊTE !! MAIS JE NE VOUS EN DIS PAS PLUS! (LOLILOL)

 

Ce que vous donnez et ce que vous recevez

Doooonc ! On a produit des objets promotionnels!! YAY!! En échange de votre don et selon le montant de votre contribution, vous recevrez : 

  • Un T-shirt  pour un don de 30 $
  • Un "crew neck"  pour un don de 60 $
  • Un "tote bag" au pour un don de 20 $
  • Ou TOUTES ces options ! Go big or go home y'all ! pour un don de 100 $

************ LIVRAISON : JANVIER 2020 *************

 

L'impact qu'aura votre don 

En faisant un don au Fonds Sophie Berriault, vous :

  • contribuez à l'avancement de la recherche sur la SP;
  • soutenez PS j'ai la SP dans les projets qui vous touchent et qui vous apportent de l'espoir et du réconfort;
  • permettez de faire grandir la plateforme PS j'ai la SP qui permet aux jeunes, et moins jeunes, adultes atteints de SP de se sentir moins seuls dans leur combat contre la SP;
  • soutenez une cause importante, la SP touchant plus de 77 000 personnes au Canada;
  • posez un geste qui aura un impact sur l'avenir d'une personne de votre entourage qui est atteinte de SP que ce soit un ami, votre conjoint, un collègue, votre amoureux ou un membre de votre famille;
  • faites preuve de compassion et d'humanité (c'est beau, hein!) 

 

Le défi de cette campagne 

Amasser des fonds n'est pas chose facile! Sachez que chaque dollar compte. Il n'y a pas de petit don. Et s'il vous est impossible de contribuer une somme vous permettant d'obtenir un objet promotionnel, vous pouvez tout simplement donner le montant qui vous convient : 1 $, 2 $, 10 $. Peu importe, je vous remercie à l'avance de m'aider à AGIR CONCRÈTEMENT sur cette maladie!

 

Vous ne pouvez pas donner? 

Vous êtes dans l'impossibilité de contribuer financièrement à cette campagne de sociofinancement? Voici comment vous pouvez tout de même aider le Fonds Sophie Berriault à atteindre son objectif : 

PARTAGEZ SUR FACEBOOK  :)

story:
For over sixty years, ACHIEVE has offered services to adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities. ACHIEVE empowers these individuals to become more independent and enhances their quality of life through various programs. These programs include, a day habilitation program, vocational services, resident services, summer programs, family support programs, and more. Supporting these programs is essential to the individuals served by ACHIEVE so that they can grow to be more independent and develop new skills that will guarantee them a higher quality of life. 

As a chapter of NYSARC, Inc. it is the mission of ACHIEVE to advocate for an enhanced quality of life through skill advancement, inclusion, integration, and independence of persons with intellectual, developmental and other disabilities through services provided in Broome, Chenango and Tioga Counties. 

It is the vision of ACHIEVE to be the leading regional resource and premier provider of comprehensive services to individuals with intellectual, developmental and other disabilities.

Our team of Binghamton University students is looking to raise $1,000 to supply exercise tricycles to the Day Habilitation Program at ACHIEVE. Contributions will ensure that more individuals are able to take advantage of the benefits associated with physical exercise. 

If a donation is not possible, please share our campaign through social media and use word-of-mouth to help us reach our fundraising goal. We believe the exercise these individuals get from the tricycles can make a big difference in their lives!

story:
Their Story

Suzanne (Wuz) Bolyen - sister of Nick Scott and friend to many - is seriously ill. She is a very committed single mom to her amazing daughter Vaile. They live in Ellensburg, WA where Vaile is entering her senior year and need our help to provide immediate relief and some long-term security for Vaile!

How you can Help

We are holding a benefit on 9/7 at the Royal Room in Seattle. Please come and offer your support! You will be treated to three crazy-good bands!

  • Tom Price Desert Classic
  • The Swords of Fatima
  • Gallow Swings
Plus -- Hot Dog Cart! Carnival Games!
TPDC Record Release!

The Impact

All proceeds from the benefit will go to Wuz and Vaile. We hope to establish an account in Vaile's name to provide her some future security and to help her understand that despite hardship, others are here to help!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you are not able to attend the benefit show you can still help!

    • Donate here!
    • Share this campaign!

    And that's all there is to it.

story:
Introduction

Hi, I'm Vandy Roadifer and I'm passionate about real food, nutrition, evidence-based medicine, and health advocacy. My favorite hobby is creating recipes for people with food allergies/sensitivities and limited diets since I have experience with all three. I recently completed the academic requirements for my Master of Science in Human Nutrition after returning to school to pursue a career that will help improve the lives of people like myself with complex chronic illnesses. I began studying dietary changes, nutrition, and biochemistry on my own after I was disabled a decade ago from health issues caused by inflammation and oxidative stress from mold exposure in water damaged buildings. Conventional medical treatment caused dry beriberi, a serious B vitamin deficiency, that made my body slowly shut down. It took over a year and visits to multiple specialists before I obtained a diagnosis and treatment for a problem that could have been prevented with an inexpensive supplement available at every grocery store and pharmacy. I realized then that most doctors don't recognize symptoms or risk factors for nutrient deficiencies and don't know how to prevent, test for, or treat them even though cells need proper nutrition in order to function and to reduce risk of disease, disability, and/or early death. My health slowly improved as I worked with an integrative/functional medicine MD to implement what I learned from my studies. I eventually returned to school to study evidence-based nutrition in an academic setting with a goal of helping people with chronic illnesses with nutrition and lifestyle changes that will improve their overall health. I am steps away from completing that goal and need your help to achieve it.

Objective

I'm seeking funds to start a nutritional consulting company out of my home with in-person and remote appointments available through telephone, email, instant messenger, and/or video chat. Working out of my home will allow me the freedom to set my own schedule and work around my ongoing health challenges. As an independent nutritionist I'm not beholden to any sponsorship agreements with governmental agencies, food industries, drug companies, or private laboratories made by professional organizations. While I have biases in favor of real/whole foods over industrial foods, I'm guided primarily by high quality scientific research, biochemistry, and experience.

To reach my goals I need at least $1500 to take Heart-Root Nutrition from a seed of an idea to a living and growing company. Those funds will be used in the following ways:

  • articles of limited liability corporation and local business license
  • professional liability insurance
  • domain name and website, credit card processing, etc.
  • signage, promotional materials, business cards, etc.

If I don't meet my entire goal, my business priorities are establishing my LLC and local business license and obtaining professional liability insurance. Without those three things I can't be a practicing nutritionist.

Perks

Donations will be happily accepted, but I don't expect something for nothing. I'm offering my services as a clinical nutritionist as well as a few other perks using the research and writing skills honed during my studies.

  • Standardized advice for your choice of one chronic illness, including autoimmune diseases, coronary artery disease, GERD, hypertension, inflammatory conditions, metabolic syndrome, obesity, pre-diabetes, and type II diabetes. Document will cover dietary advice, lifestyle changes, supplements, and suggested laboratory testing, also includes citations from relevant research articles.
  • A PDF copy of my science-based Clinical Guide to Botanical Medicine containing information on 50 common herbal supplements. Information within the guide includes the biochemical and physiological effects of each botanical, dosages used in clinical trials, standardization criteria, and a list of clinically effective brand name products, many verified for purity and dosage by third-party testing.
  • Initial nutrition consultation with me either in-person or via remote services (telephone, email, instant messenger, or video chat), depending on your location. Includes a personalized nutritional and lifestyle plan based on information provided to me in your new client packet (medical history, recent laboratory test results, a three-day food log, etc.) and associated materials required for you to be successful.
  • Initial nutrition consultation as discussed above plus a follow-up visit 2-4 weeks later to discuss your progress and any challenges or successes you've had.
  • Research report on a health issue of your choice. I'll analyze and summarize recent research so you don't have to. Report will include pathophysiology, conventional treatments, promising future treatments, nutrition and lifestyle interventions, and citation of relevant research articles as appropriate.

Impact

Our healthcare systems are overwhelmed by people with chronic diseases and the number is expected to significantly increase by 2030 (see chart below). In order to reduce the rates of chronic diseases and improve the lives of those already living with them, people must take control of their own health. This is where Heart-Root Nutrition comes in.

Heart-Root Nutrition offers personalized, evidence-based nutrition and lifestyle recommendations along with guidance and support to individuals with chronic illnesses or at risk for developing chronic illnesses, helping them improve their own lives, which in turn reduces stress on an overburdened healthcare system. By offering in-person and remote services I can help many more people than just those within my community. I also plan to offer discounts to people with disabilities or low incomes, active or retired military personnel and their families, and those referred by participating healthcare providers. By supporting my campaign you're not only helping me fund the growth of Heart-Root Nutrition, you're helping yourself and others obtain life-changing nutrition and lifestyle information for years to come.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know only too well that not everyone can afford to support a fundraising campaign with money. You can still help by spreading the word and sharing this campaign with your friends, family, and social media network. Thank you!

Document will cover dietary advice, lifestyle changes, supplements, and suggested laboratory testing, also includes citations from relevant research articles.
A PDF copy of my science-based Clinical Guide to Botanical Medicine containing information on 50 common herbal supplements. Information within the guide includes the biochemical and physiological effects of each botanical, dosages used in clinical trials, standardization criteria, and a list of clinically effective brand name products, many verified for purity and dosage by third-party testing.
Initial nutrition consultation with me either in-person or via remote services (telephone, email, instant messenger, or video chat), depending on your location. Includes a personalized nutritional and lifestyle plan based on information provided to me in your new client packet (medical history, recent laboratory test results, a three-day food log, etc.) and associated materials required for you to be successful.
Initial nutrition consultation as discussed above plus a follow-up visit 2-4 weeks later to discuss your progress and any challenges or successes you've had.
Research report on a health issue of your choice. I'll analyze and summarize recent research so you don't have to. Report will include pathophysiology, conventional treatments, promising future treatments, nutrition and lifestyle interventions, and citation of relevant research articles as appropriate.
ImpactOur healthcare systems are overwhelmed by people with chronic diseases and the number is expected to significantly increase by 2030 (see chart below). In order to reduce the rates of chronic diseases and improve the lives of those already living with them, people must take control of their own health. This is where Heart-Root Nutrition comes in.Heart-Root Nutrition offers personalized, evidence-based nutrition and lifestyle recommendations along with guidance and support to individuals with chronic illnesses or at risk for developing chronic illnesses, helping them improve their own lives, which in turn reduces stress on an overburdened healthcare system. By offering in-person and remote services I can help many more people than just those within my community. I also plan to offer discounts to people with disabilities or low incomes, active or retired military personnel and their families, and those referred by participating healthcare providers. By supporting my campaign you're not only helping me fund the growth of Heart-Root Nutrition, you're helping yourself and others obtain life-changing nutrition and lifestyle information for years to come.Other Ways You Can HelpI know only too well that not everyone can afford to support a fundraising campaign with money. You can still help by spreading the word and sharing this campaign with your friends, family, and social media network. Thank you!

story:
From Kristen Hemingway and Kathy Grady:

We have been clients of Heartwood Center for 10+ years and have come to rely upon it as a source of inspiration, wellness and spirituality. The unique, practitioner-led environment creates community in times of change and fosters an entrepreneurial spirit.

  • The mission of Heartwood remains constant as it has transitioned to become part of Mindrol Ösel Ling - to deliver affordable holistic healthcare across many modalities:
    • MDs
    • Chiropractic
    • Psychotherapy
    • Body Work
    • Acupuncture
  • A critical part of the transition to non-profit status is the expansion of affordable or free care for clients through the Women and Cancer Program and our partnership with Erie Family Health.
  • Any donation is welcome and every donor will receive a tax-deductible letter and a "perk" as a thank you.
  • Please visit http://mindroloselling.org for more information about the Mindrolling Lineage and Jetsun Khandro Rinpoche.
  • You can also reach out directly to Kristen Hemingway (773.294.0636) or Kathy Grady (847.864.1055) to ask questions about this campaign.
  • ALL contributions will be applied directly to the non-profit which is a 501(c)(3).

story:
Thank you for supporting #KEEPSLAUSONFRESH!

We are thankful to everyone that has given on this platform and helped us exceed $75k in donations! We are proud about how people everywhere have stepped up to give access to fresh food for everyone.  Perks will still be available here until they're gone, so feel free to keep sharing!

We have purchased the space, but we are still raising funds to open our doors! Please visit keepslausonfresh.com to make a tax deductible donation, and learn how to support in other ways below. 

 

Produce to the People! 


Health disparities kill more people than anything else in our country, and 24 million Americans live without fresh food access. These conditions shorten life expectancies in marginalized communities before babies take their first breath. Enough is Enough. It is time to take a bite out of hunger by establishing healthy affordable food options in our Hoods. 

SÜPRMARKT was founded in 2016 to provide weekly produce pop ups + deliveries services which make it easy and affordable to eat well in LA's food deserts. Since starting, we've served up over 25,000 pounds of produce in South Central & beyond and we are taking our next big step by opening a healthy retail location. 

Actually doing it.

Our biggest lesson from Nipsey's life is actually doing what you know is needed instead of wasting time thinking about it. 

This turning point will empower us to not just think of solving food disparities in our neighborhoods, but to ACTUALLY DO IT. If you know there is something wrong with leaving your neighborhood everytime you crave a salad, and want your children to grow up in a world where their life expectancy isn't 20 years shorter because there is no quality food around, please do everything in your power to spread the word and help get this off the ground.


 

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Essential Goal: 111k Downpayment & Renovations

To secure the Mr. Wisdom's space, we'll need $65,000 for a down payment, as well as another estimated $25,000 to renovate and modernize the space. This amount gets our foot in the door with some of the resources needed to turn this establishment back into a health store. We estimate $5,500 would go to Indiegogo fees, and $4,500 would go toward perk fulfillment.

Stretch Goal: 250k Downpayment, Inventory, Renovations, Staff

This amount is our sweet spot. It allows for a larger downpayment of $140,000, resulting in a lower mortgage, and allows us to budget $40,000 for renovations, $25,000 for staff and $23,000 for inventory. We estimate $12,500 would go to Indiegogo fees, and $5,500 would go toward perk fulfillment. 

 

Ultimate Goal: 750k Purchase Property, Renovation, Inventory, Staff, Insurance

This would be phenomenal. Raising this amount would allow us to purchase the property outright, so that we can guarantee our service to the community for decades to come and never have to worry about eviction or rent increases. 

$520,000 would mostly pay for the property, with $70,000 for renovations, $50,000 for staff and for $34,000 for inventory, $30,000 and for other concerns like marketing and insurance, giving us a great start to a successful business that will serve the community for decades to come. We estimate $37,500 would go to Indiegogo fees, and $8,500 would go toward perk fulfillment.  

 

Dream: 1.2 Million Everything above + Free community dinners and programs. 

An additional $450,000 would help us expand our community impact. SÜPRSEED is a 501(c)3 that powers events, grocery giveaways, juice cleanse scholarships and more to create the experiences and support systems needed for long term lifestyle changes. Raising 1.2 million is a dream that would empower us to continue free plant based dinners Mr. Wisdom lead each week, offer support to other healthy food start ups in the area, discount goods in the store based on the area median income, and make a huge and lasting impact on South Central's health for good. 

What We'll Have

 

Organic Fruits & Veggies & Bulk Goods from local farms like Alma Backyard Farms, & the South Central Farmer's Co-op.  We'll carry tropical goods like pineapples & mangos + dry bulk goods like nuts, dates, coconut oil, quinoa and more. 
Healthy Snacks + Packaged Foods from brands like: Beanfield's and Field Roast.
Delicious Prepared meals + Grab & Go options from local artisans like Baba's Vegan Cafe
Sustainable Body Products & Household goods from brands like: Dr. Bronner's, Alaffia, Dr. Hauschka's & more.

 

What's our backup plan? 

We are 100% committed to making this a reality. That said, if we fall short of our fundraising goals we will use whatever we have toward securing the store and continue to raise funds via whatever channels become available to us!

 

The Impact

Feed People.

With a physical location, we can start serving 1,000 Angelenos per week. Having more space to pack produce boxes, delivery vans, and manufacturing space means we can have a significant impact on the 1.3 Million people in our area, and even get food insecure to folks across LA.

Heal People.
1 billion dollars is spent on preventable healthcare in the US every day.  Living in a food desert makes you far more likely to suffer from a preventable disease. For instance, obesity rates are 25% higher in South LA than West LA and 13% higher than the county average. As natives of the community, we combine an urgent need to heal our friends and family members with well branded retail access to healthy food. Most importantly, we lead events and programs that help our audience eat healthily in culturally relevant ways. For instance, we've sponsored free and affordable juice cleanses for 40 people.  

End The Health Apartheid.

Our success in opening this store will be just the first step in a nationwide movement to provide forgotten areas with the resources they need to thrive. We've had people write us from places like Chicago and try to order produce from places like Alabama-- so seeing us succeed will inspire people everywhere to do the same and equip us with the experience to help others and expand this concept.

 

Risks & Challenges

SÜPRMARKT has been in business for almost 3 years, serving the local community with affordable produce boxes, popup dinners, and educational food seminars. Our work has been featured by Forbes, Tastemade, Popsugar, SXSW, Afropunk, and more. 

It is always a risk to open a brick and mortar location— but the neighborhood needs this. We're the right fit to step in and take over where Mr. Wisdom's left off.

Our biggest plus is that we have worked out many of the learning curve kinks associated with grocery service and built up a customer base. That said, these areas will be new challenges for us:

  • Starting a Kitchen
  • Building out a physical location

We are grateful to have access to support and guidance from organizations like:

Everytable
Hot and Cool Cafe
Hank's Mini Market
sweetgreen
LA Kitchen
The Pollination Project

to help guide us through this new process.

 

Everyone Can Help!

If you are reading this, you can help. 

  • Follow supr.mrkt on Instagram
  • Share this campaign with everyone you can via texts, emails, socials, & everything else!
  • Organize a group donation on behalf of an organization you are part of
  • Organize a popup dinner/fundraiser— we'll be on hand to talk about our experiences and showcase recipes using our produce.

Learn more and download promo materials at keepslausonfresh.net

story:
Hi-

If you've spent time on The Heron land, you know that there's something special about it....
Some even say that the land feels magical...

People travel from all over to spend time here to reconnect with friends, and rejuvenate themselves.

We feel it too and are grateful to be able to live in it daily!

For the past 30 years, generations have danced, laughed, drummed and walked in our woods.

 

Now something *very exciting* is happening... and we'd love for you to be a part of it.

This past summer, the property right beside The Heron went up for sale.  

 

We immediately started to dream....

If we had access to the house, barn and land, we could create a whole new array of experiences and services that you could enjoy throughout the year.

We imagined a new location for retreats... the creation of a small cabin village... an extension of our wooded trails....

But how could we turn the dream into reality?


Then, at the end of the 2019 Great Rhythm Revival, Jim Donovan announced to the audience that there would be a tour of the property and that anyone interested in checking it out should meet at the back of the tent.... and that the tour would be leaving in 10 minutes!


By the end of the property tour, enough people felt strongly enough about the potential of this new land that they committed enough funds to secure the wining bid at the property's auction soon thereafter!!


In a matter of minutes, this DREAM started to become VERY REAL.


Between then and now, 25 of us have created an LLC, business plan, mission and vision for this new venture. 

To finalize the real estate transfer, we need $325,000 by November 15th. We have raised over $253,000 so far.  Will you help us raise the final $72,000 in the next week?

(Till Monday November 11th, we are still open for new investors at the $5,000 and above levels)

 

MORE INFO-

This is a project that began as an idea from the HEART.  It grew out of our desire to bring opportunities for wellness, healing, inspiration and personal growth to you and our far reaching community. 

The goal for Phase One of this project is to finalize the purchase of the property adjacent to The Heron. This new land includes 65 acres, a 4 bedroom home and a large barn/outbuilding. Purchasing the property next door will allow for expansion of what The Heron Farm and Event Center has offered for almost 30 years. 

PFM Ventures, LLC is being formed in order to act as stewards of this new piece of land and expand on the legacy of The Heron.  PFM stands for PURE F*ING MAGIC and expresses our belief that we can manifest anything we set our hearts to. We have had an abundance of people with all sorts of exciting ideas for what they would like to offer for programming and events once the PFM Venture land is ours. The possibilities are endless and we want to share all of this with YOU!

We want to include you, our supporters, friends and Heron family in solidifying Phase One, the beginning of this exciting endeavor! We have some special things to offer you that will bring you onto this amazing PFM land in the coming year to feel the MAGIC! 

Please JOIN US NOW!

With All Sincerity,  Thanks and Love,

The PFM and Heron Family

story:
The human-animal bond is something that people just don't understand unless they've experienced it themselves. It becomes more than just a relationship between an animal and a human. There is an unspoken connection that is created through the experiences and time spent together. At All Pets, we understand that this connection is important and that's why we make that bond the core of our endeavors. Think back to the last time that you were at a veterinary clinic. Did you feel safe leaving your pet there? Did the staff help you with all your questions and worries? Did you feel that your pet was treated with the respect and kindness that all animals should be treated with? We've experienced the worst of the worst and we think it's time to make a change in today's clinics. We've revolutionized the veterinary clinic model and reformed it into a diverse multi-model platform that answers all needs of all pets. Pet owners need not worry anymore. We believe in a high level of communication and care that has never been seen before in the industry. Join us in creating a clinic that will become the new standard for clinics all around America. 

What We Need & What You Get

Any generous contributions towards our cause is always greatly appreciated! With your help, we know our dream is possible and we've prepared a few gifts in return for your contributions. We hope you enjoy the perks!

We know that not everyone can make a monetary contribution; spreading our cause to your friends and family is a great way to contribute. Our hope is that together we can reach as many people as possible with our name and our cause. 

The Impact

We aim to shock the industry with our level of service. As pioneers of great service and treating all animals with compassion, we will morph the industry into something spectacular. It will be an experience that all pets and pet owners will look forward to.

story:
Avotcja Poet/Musician/Radio personality is a 75 year old performing Artist living with MS (Multiple Sclerosis) who needs your help. The Wheel Chair lift for her Van needs to be replaced & her car needs brakes. Without them, to quote her “without my Wheelchair I feel like a caged Bird & this caged Bird won’t sing because I can’t get to Gigs!” 
Avotcja has done more to support live music, poetry, and artists than anyone I know in the Bay Area. For more years than can be counted, Avotcja has consistently contributed enormous amounts of energy and love to our Bay Arts Community: keeping it alive, keeping it current, keeping it vibrant, communicating between communities, bringing us together again and again.
 As a long time disc jockey on both KPOO and KPFA, Avotcja has played the most up to date music that listeners have almost no other way of hearing anywhere else. Be it the latest or the classic genres from San Francisco, New York, Puerto Rico, Brazil or Cuba Avotcja knows about it, plays it, and schools us all in the beauty of a myriad of art forms. Avotcja is the first person to give an interview, and to support, both the struggling artist and the well known icon. She has loved and helped us all, time and time again, playing our music, putting us on the calendar, showing up at our shows, inviting us to express ourselves, and moving us towards a larger conocimiento of what it means to truly participate in the arts and in community. 
Not to mention, that Avotcja is a tireless artist herself. She is an award winning poet and an award winning band leader and musician in her group, Avotcja & Modúpue. She has the energy of 3 people!! Let me just say that this woman gets around'. Avotcja is an inspiration in so many ways. I cannot EVEN imagine her without her van or her wheelchair operating and in good condition. It is just not thinkable. Folks... Can we get this taken care of? Please, donate what you can, and let’s get Avotcja rolling again, safe and sound.
Any donations small or big will be appreciated. 100% of the donations will go to Avotcja Jiltonilro.
This campaign has been created by &/or endorsed by Carolyn Brandy, Lincoln Bergman, Linda Tillery, Jose B. Cuellar aka Dr. Loco, Ronnie Stewart-West Coast Blues Society, Lauren Muller-Chair Inter Disciplinary Studies CCSF, Nancy Hom, Afrikahn Jahmal Dayvs KKUP & KPFA, Linda Wosskow, Greg Landau, Ellen Gierson, Aixa Gannon, Taller Bombalele, Greg Bridges & Leslie Simon.
Thanks for your support!

Be it the latest or the classic genres from San Francisco, New York, Puerto Rico, Brazil or Cuba Avotcja knows about it, plays it, and schools us all in the beauty of a myriad of art forms. Avotcja is the first person to give an interview, and to support, both the struggling artist and the well known icon. She has loved and helped us all, time and time again, playing our music, putting us on the calendar, showing up at our shows, inviting us to express ourselves, and moving us towards a larger conocimiento of what it means to truly participate in the arts and in community. Not to mention, that Avotcja is a tireless artist herself. She is an award winning poet and an award winning band leader and musician in her group, Avotcja & Modúpue. She has the energy of 3 people!! Let me just say that this woman gets around'. Avotcja is an inspiration in so many ways. I cannot EVEN imagine her without her van or her wheelchair operating and in good condition. It is just not thinkable. Folks... Can we get this taken care of? Please, donate what you can, and let’s get Avotcja rolling again, safe and sound.Any donations small or big will be appreciated. 100% of the donations will go to Avotcja Jiltonilro.This campaign has been created by &/or endorsed by Carolyn Brandy, Lincoln Bergman, Linda Tillery, Jose B. Cuellar aka Dr. Loco, Ronnie Stewart-West Coast Blues Society, Lauren Muller-Chair Inter Disciplinary Studies CCSF, Nancy Hom, Afrikahn Jahmal Dayvs KKUP & KPFA, Linda Wosskow, Greg Landau, Ellen Gierson, Aixa Gannon, Taller Bombalele, Greg Bridges & Leslie Simon.Thanks for your support!

story:
Homemade Betty

My name is Rebecca and a Stay at home mom of 3 children. I have been Holistic my whole life and have always looked for natural ways to heal myself and my family. My skin care line started over 10 years ago after searching & searching for a lotion.I wanted something that would not only heal my skin but also that I could pronounce the ingredients, I came up empty handed.

I started looking back on all that I learned growing up and started making a rich body butter with only 4 organic, vegan ingredients in it. It was amazing! After years of using it and giving it to friends and family, I looked to my medicine cabinet to see what else I could replace. One by one I replaced my drug store items with all natural simple and effective skincare.

I started selling to the public over 3 years ago and have grown very fast. Not only do I take pride in being a cruelty free, organic, fair trade and Eco-friendly company, but also being a resource for many amazing customers.

With funds raised for Homemade Betty we will be able to open a  local store front where customers can bring their zero-waste jars and refill on their favorite products. Learn about natural skincare and what they can do at home, sample all of our products to see what fits their skin needs and also we will have teaching events that will be held monthly to learn how to make their own body care.

In addition to these funds, extra money will be used to create a vegan, organic makeup line &  more household items for zero-waste options. Such as, laundry detergent, Castile soap, multi-purpose cleaner & other useful non-toxic items.

My company could have not come this far without my amazing customers and their appreciation for my products. This dream of opening a store has been something I have always envisioned and we are finally ready to move forward.

Ways you can help...

  • $1,000 Donation- Exclusive ticket to our grand opening party, Organic Spa box (est delivery 3.15.17) Exclusive 15% off lifetime card!
  • $500 Donation - Exclusive ticket to our grand opening party, Our best Seller box(est delivery 3.15.17) Exclusive 10% off lifetime card!
  • $100 and up Donation - Organic French Lavender 8 oz jar ( est delivery 3.15.17) & 20% off coupon.
  • $50 and up Donation - Organic Coffee Face Scrub 4 oz jar (est delivery 3.15.17 ) & 10% off coupon.
  • $25 and up Donation - Organic Raw Vegan Lip (est delivery 3.15.17) & 5 % off coupon.
  • Would love to donate but cant right now? I would love if you could just SHARE!!! With friends, family on social media or at the dinner table.

I am seeking $5,000. to repair a older store that is local to Somerset, NJ.

All the repairs will be a Eco-friendly and will make the store more open. Plus the repairs will also create a space for teaching and to have monthly parties/classes.

The additional $5,000 will be growing a expanding line of household items and Cruelty free handmade makeup line. Which will require more permits and inspections.

 

The Impact

Our impact is a strong one! We are looking to help change how people address their lifestyle for skincare.

  • Educating local community on taking care of their skin.
  • Teaching how to use in the future
  • Creating a local awareness of organic, vegan options.

Challenges

In creating this new venture I will of course face challenges as any company would. I have been doing this for over 3 years and have never looked back or stopped. I'm ready to bring the next level and support to my community.

Thank you for your time and support!

story:
What your funding supports!

- Mastering a Digital Cinema Package (needed for theater screenings) 

- Online target marketing 

- Advertising

- Events to raise awareness

Family, identity, home, life and death are all themes explored in Everything Must Change.  Over the last 6 years we have been intensely living through Mariam's Breast Cancer diagnosis, while making this intimate film.  The story has taken a life of it's own and expanded into a broader story of hope, healing and survival. Having personally financed the film for over 6 years, we've maxed out our funds and need your support to complete the film in time for festival submissions this September.

Dear Friends,

Six years ago when I was diagnosed with Breast Cancer, I thought it would just be a “bump in the road.”  Boy, was I wrong.  With the help of my ex-boyfriend Kenny Krauss, who came to support me, we started documenting my journey from the very beginning not knowing where it would take us.  What unfolded was stranger than anything we could have ever imagined. Despite the personal challenges of living through it, while making the film, we continued to follow the story. And we didn't hold back.  It's RAW, REAL, FUNNY and UPLIFTING.

Needless to say, facing a life threatening illness has irreversibly changed us both. This uplifting documentary explores themes such as: the quest for meaning when faced with a life-threatening illness and the healing power of true love and friendship.

Kenny and I have over 20 years of experience working on TV shows telling other people’s stories. We have worked for networks including: CBS, PBS, ABC, FOX, MTV, A&E and more. Our documentary, The Fighting Cholitas, about female Bolivian wrestlers premiered at Sundance, winning an Honorable Mention and went on to be screened at a hundred festivals around the world, winning 9 additional awards along the way.

We have been filming and editing this story for the last 6 years. At this point, we are asking for your support to finish the film.  We have a 73 minute cut, but have to raise finishing funds to complete it. Our goal of $35,000 will go towards:

  • 2 additional weeks of Editing @ $6,000
  • Music composition and licensing @ $7,000
  • Archival footage licensing @ $3,500
  • Color correcting @ $7,500
  • Audio mixing @ $6,500
  • Festival submission fees @ $1,000
  • Indiegogo/IDA fees @ $3,500

Help us produce this uplifting story and spread the inspiring message of HOPE and LOVE. 

Thank you all!

Lots of Love,

Mariam and Kenny

Co-Directors/Co-Producers

HELP US SPREAD THE WORD! WE CAN'T DO IT WITHOUT YOU!! 

TAX DEDUCTIBLE DONATION

Your donation is tax-deductible!!!  Everything Must Change is a fiscally sponsored project of the International Documentary Association (IDA), a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization.  Contributions on behalf of Everything Must Change are payable to IDA and are tax-deductible less the value of any goods or services received, as allowed by law.  The value of goods and services being offered is noted under each donation level.  If you would like to deduct the entire donation you have the option to simply decline the reward at check out.

story:
Vancouver Opera (VO) is Canada's second largest opera company and has been working in partnership with the local community since 1960. Since that time, our education and outreach initiatives have reached 1.75 million children and their families.

From 2016-present, Vancouver Opera has been partnering with the Kettle, a Downtown Eastside based social services agency that focuses on supporting adults living with chronic mental illness and addiction-related conditions. Each week, VO chorus and music staff travel to The Kettle to conduct a regular choral and songwriting workshop with residents. The aim of this partnership is the creation of an on-site community choir, and a new opera entitled Requiem for a Lost Girl.

Requiem for a Lost Girl will be performed as part of the 2018 Vancouver Opera Festival at SFU Woodward's on May 4 and 6. This compelling work will feature personal stories of the Kettle residents and will allow the Kettle choir to perform in front of audiences. The healing work that has been achieved through this project is transformative, and the testimonials offered by the participants are heartwarming.

The positive impact that this project has had on everyone involved is significant and it’s very important that we keep this project going. The funds raised will be used to create a legacy program which will allow VO to continue sending our staff to the Kettle, with the ultimate goal of teaching their staff and volunteers how to run the program so that they can be independent.

Vancouver Opera is at the forefront of a global movement to improve lives through the arts. Our outreach initiatives don’t just improve lives locally, we’re inspiring change globally. Our work creates ripples that affect everyone and in a more practical sense, we’re creating partnerships and systems that can be replicated anywhere.

Why should you donate to this cause? Because you see the joy on the faces of the participants. You believe that everyone should have a voice. You know that small acts of kindness lead to big societal shifts. You want to make a difference—and you can.

On behalf of everyone at Vancouver Opera and the Kettle, please accept our sincere gratitude for your consideration. Please share this far and wide, and we hope to see you at the show!

Find out more about the Kettle at www.thekettle.ca

story:
Summary

Hi, I'm Terra, and I live in Mount Airy, Maryland. If you've seen our town in the news recently, it's because it's become a hotspot for COVID-19. After getting over the initial stress of the pandemic coming to my hometown, I realized: I have a sewing machine, some extra fabric, a little skill, and some free time. "I should get involved and make masks for healthcare workers," I thought.

So I called the nursing home where the outbreak was, and they said they were wearing N95 masks only, with fabric masks not needed from the community. I called some friends in other healthcare jobs, and they said the same. I even called the local food bank--they haven't gotten back to me yet, and aren't accepting non-monetary donations from the public at the moment.

Then I had to go out for groceries, and I saw someone with a towel tied around their face in lieu of a mask, and thought "I should focus on the community, because that's where fabric masks can be most useful." So I'm making masks, distributing them around the community where I see they are needed, and hopefully continuing to do this after everything reopens, because I think that the public wearing masks will be crucial to avoiding a second COVID-19 wave.

Why I Need Your Help

For now, I am fortunate enough to be able to provide these masks for free--however, if I want to provide a meaningful quantity of masks, I will need all the help I can get from my recipients (and anyone you share the link with!). I'm currently furloughed from work, and I've spent a lot of my own time and money on materials so far. I'm glad I have the opportunity to give back to my community, but until my income source returns, I'll only be able to do so much. (Fortunately the state of Maryland's unemployment system is not as bad as some other states', but I've still had trouble with the website, so I haven't received benefits yet.)

All funds will go to me to recover the cost of the fabric and materials (about $200 so far) and help with my bills. If this campaign makes over $1000 in the 60 days it will run, all extra money will go to the Mt. Airy NET food bank--and honestly, after I pay for the fabric, I will try to make a donation no matter what, even if it's not a lot. Every little bit helps, both for me and everyone else.

Challenges So Far

I wanted to start distribution much earlier, but the project it a few snags along the way. I tried multiple prototypes to see which one would be the best fit for the most people, and I eventually settled on a slightly modified version of the UF Department of Anesthesiology Prototype 1... but it took a while to get there. (See my FAQ for the video link)

Then I spent hours cutting a certain fabric I had into dozens of squares... and I didn't find out that it wasn't breathable enough to use in masks until I made one and try it on. That was an annoying and slightly embarrassing lesson to learn, and I learned in on April 16th, two days before the new law in Maryland went into effect mandating face coverings when entering any retail store. Oops.

That unusable fabric represented a huge quantity of the fabric I had, so of course I had to go buy some, and... well, the supply at Wal-Mart has been decimated, of course. I wound up ordering online from Joann Fabrics (god love 'em, they're still doing curbside pick-ups) and I was able to order about $100 worth of fabric from them, although the supply was going quickly. I've had to improvise some fabric sources (i.e. I bought some bed sheets to cut up) but those are poly-cotton blends, rather than the recommended 100% cotton. But I had to do what I had to do, and I made sure to test everything this time to make sure it was breathable!

These challenges slowed me down, but did not stop me. I am in this for the long haul, because even after life returns back to normal--and despite what ANYONE says, we really don't know exactly when that will be--the need for masks will not disappear overnight. I will keep making them as long as they are needed.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute any money, that's okay! I appreciate you taking the time to read this far! <3

But you can still help me a lot by spreading the word to your friends, so that I can get more masks out there, and potentially more contributions. You can use the Indiegogo share tools, you can copy and paste the link to social media, you can text it to someone, you can send it in Morse Code to your quarantined neighbors--whatever works! Even just leaving a message is appreciated.

A Word of Gratitude From Me

If you found this link through receiving one of my masks, I hope it's nice and comfy, and it keeps you safe and healthy. If you found it through any other means, thank you for your time--it means a lot to me to have this opportunity to help people, and to have someone who hasn't even benefited from my hard work yet reading about it is pretty neat.

I've never really done any project like this before. I didn't take up the mask-making effort because I'm a particularly good or noble person, I don't think--it just seemed like the least I could do to help those around me, rather than sit around and waste all this time when I have the skill to help. I'm a pretty privileged person, all things considered, and I could've wound up in a much worse situation if this had happened at any other time. A lot of good things were going on in my life just before the pandemic, but a lot of them weren't time-sensitive, so they're just delayed, not outright cancelled. I would've been in a much worse situation if this had happened last year, or next year, or even maybe a few months from now (I was in the process of moving closer to work before this happened, but that's been put sorta on hold for now).

This has helped me re-evaluate how I look at myself as well--I didn't think I would have any skills that would be useful in a global-catastrophe situation, and I certainly didn't think I'd emerge as a hardworking person in a circumstance that forced everyone to stay home. And sure, I played my fair share of video games! But then I got to do this.

True story: as I was typing this section, I got a message of gratitude from a friend who had already received some masks from me. That was awesome.

So not only have I been quite lucky (despite being unemployed), but I am in a position to help others benefit from my relatively-good fortune. I hope these benefits are felt in my community, and I wish everyone the best. Stay safe, stay inside, and stay positive.

Love, Terra

story:
Thank you for taking a moment to review my campaign.  I am a mom, friend, farmer, and passionate advocate for good.

My dream is to use my experience growing food, flowers, and herbs to start a small profitable farm to offer my community healthy food options and also to provide those in need with healthier alternatives.

Working in the soil is my passion.  I plan to be chemical free and to use sustainable practices that will aid in soil conservation, increasing bee population, and not use methods that contribute to environmental pollution.

Your contribution will help me do what I love and also allow me more freedom to be a care giver to my loved one.
story_txt: Thank you for taking a moment to review my campaign.  I am a mom, friend, farmer, and passionate advocate for good.My dream is to use my experience growing food, flowers, and herbs to start a small profitable farm to offer my community healthy food options and also to provide those in need with healthier alternatives.Working in the soil is my passion.  I plan to be chemical free and to use sustainable practices that will aid in soil conservation, increasing bee population, and not use methods that contribute to environmental pollution.Your contribution will help me do what I love and also allow me more freedom to be a care giver to my loved one.

story:
**Final Thank You!**

Missed the Deadline? Any further donations are still HUGELY appreciated! 

You can make them on our website www.mindfullivingretreats.co.uk/donate 

Stay in Touch via Facebook or our Newsletter

 

Thank you so much for contributing to our crowdfunder!

We've been so moved and excited by each new contribution to the campaign.

It's now officially finished and we raised a total of £6,856 -over 191% of our initial target! It's been so beautiful for us to experience this support from friends, family and the mindfulness community. We are incredibly grateful for every donation, all the messages of connection and support, and the other offers of help.

The money raised will allow us to:

  • Buy mats and cushions, and practice related books for our retreats
  • Put down deposits to secure our first choice venues for 2020
  • Create a bursury fund for those in financial difficulty to attend our retreats
  • Provide 4 free evenings of mindfulness for NHS workers
  • Offer a donation based day of mindfulness for caregivers, environmental activists, and those who sustain society (e.g. educators)
  • Offer a donation based day of mindfulness for young people (18-35)

Huge thanks to you all, our personal heros helping our dreams come true:

Sian ip-Chung, Jane Knight, Mike Chan, Anna Rapp, Jonny, Christopher Chan, Sarah Shenker, Craig Malpass, Delphine Jegoudez, Nina Bain, Petra Kamula , Surrey Mindfulness, Ben Winter, Xavier Fontenille, Julie Weston, Chris Goodenough, Chris Bunney, Chantal Callan, Ruth Chambers, Richard Curtin, Georgia Le, Mick McEvoy, Sue Hodgson, Tim Woodward, Nick & Katrina, Andrew Brown, Alex Hood, Judy Smart, Adrian Sia Lu, Selina Ip, Peter Gahlinger, Ajay lal, Sahil Suleman, Persephone Pollock, Hong-An, Brother Long, Kamin Au, Anoushka Samanta, Doran Amos, Richard, Lucas Reynes-Matter, Emily L, Elina Pen, Sylvia Overton, Rosa Lewis, Peter, Joanna Bywater, Jay & Angela, Joe Holtaway, Paul Collins, Sarah Markiewicz, Michael Smith, Verity Lewis, Barry Thurgood, Max Wahlund, Ruby Ung, Jo Furney, Shu Yum Chan, Richard Fox, Carys, Karen Davies, PLUS a large number of anonymous donors

**An Update (3 days left!) from Ethan & Lucy**

Reaching over £5500 has been absolutely wonderful & we've already been able to set in motion our free mindfulness & self-compassion events for NHS workers, a group of people who are close to our heart. Thank you so much for enabling us to do this important outreach work.

Any further donations are still HUGELY appreciated!  We're at the final push towards our final stretch goal of £6250 which will help us share practices with young people & contribute to the well-being of our future generations.

£3500: Start up costs covered - achieved at less than 24 hours - Thank you so much!

£4500: Creating a bursary fund for our retreats so they are as accessible as possible - achieved at less than 48 hours - SO much gratitude!

£5500 - achieved in our last week of crowdfunding - unbelievably grateful & humbled - thank you!

  • 4 free evenings of mindfulness for NHS workers
  • A donation based day of mindfulness for caregivers, environmental activists, and those who sustain society (e.g. educators)

£6250:

  • A donation based day of mindfulness for young people (18-35)

Once again, sending you all our deepest gratitude.

Love Ethan & Lucy x

---

Our Story

As most of you know, we've been offering mindfulness retreats on a fully voluntary basis for the last couple of years. We love this work and we've been touched by how meaningful these weeks can be. Our dream is to continue to offer retreats but we need a little help to get going.

Lucy: "When I started attending retreats, it felt like I was finally coming home; there was a deep sense of belonging which I hadn't been able to touch before. With time and patience, the wisdom from mindfulness & self-compassion practices allowed me to come home anytime, no matter where I was or what I was going through. With this process, I began to touch joy, peace & an open-hearted tenderness that I now carry with me even outside of retreat spaces. It would be a true privilege to share this gift with others having seen how transformational it was for me."

Ethan: " Mindfulness has been personally transformational for me, helping me deal with anxiety, depression and find a sense of wholeness and purpose. Retreats don't just connect people to these life-changing practices, but help create a sense of belonging and connection to ourselves and the natural world. I've spent over 6 years living and working in retreat centers and it's clear we need more spaces where people can touch this sense of connection and well-being. Our dream is to work towards creating a fully residential retreat center, where people can come all year round. We'd be incredibly grateful for any help on our first steps towards this dream!"

 

What We Need

We need £3,500 to contribute towards start up costs including:

  • £1,300 for enough mats, cushions and blankets for at least 15 people
  • £300 for a selection of mindfulness books in our portable 'retreat library' to inspire our retreatants
  • £1,900 for deposits to secure venues in 2020

We have already pooled our own resources to secure venues for 2019, but to secure beautiful venues for 2020 we need to put deposits down now (retreat spaces are often booked a year or more in advance)! This money will be re-invested each year into securing retreat locations in line with our ethos of promoting calm, tranquility, and connecting with nature.

As you know, financial accessibility is very important to the both of us, having both previously received help in attending retreats when we were students or financial unable to attend. Currently our pricing is limited by the cost of venue hire. Therefore any money raised beyond our £3,500 target will immediately create a bursary fund to help those in financial need.

As a Thank You

Our intention is to dedicate ourselves to supporting people in their mindfulness practice, and we love that we can offer perks as a thank you to those of you who are able to help! This includes everything from guided meditations and practices, to free places on our retreats. We are especially excited about our unique online 7 day home retreat, where we will offer daily guided meditations, practice inspiration and more!

If we don't reach our target, any donations will still be very gratefully received and will go towards the costs listed above, our priority being the mats and cushions for this year's retreats!

The Impact You Can Make

We have an in-depth understanding of mindfulness alongside the experience necessary to  skillfully guide groups into a deep retreat experience. We have also developed the behind-the-scenes skills of logistics, admin and other necessities that allows the smooth-running of a retreat. We have consistently received encouraging and positive feedback from over 600 retreatants so far. In addition we have been gifted the wonderful platform Mindful Living Retreats. We are ready...We just need a little push start from you!

Your support will help us begin to create a small livelihood for ourselves so we can continue to offer these skills to benefit many more people. Anxiety, chronic stress, loneliness and depression continue to be pervasive problems for many people; we've seen first hand how practices like mindfulness and self-compassion can turn lives around. Our hope is to not only offer retreats and days of mindfulness, but also to develop free online courses to help people learn and integrate these practices into their daily lives.

Challenges

Our main challenge at the moment is :

  • Finding quality and affordable venues where we can host retreats; eventually owning a venue would mean we can offer retreats in a much more affordable way but in the meanwhile we continue to do a lot of research in this area and would appreciate any suggestions.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many non-monetary ways you can help us:

You can:

  • Stay in touch by joining our newsletter
  • Tell other people who might benefit about our retreats
  • 'Like' us on Facebook
  • Leave a review on Google and Facebook if you've enjoyed a retreat with us; it greatly helps by giving others confidence and reassurance in the experience we offer.

Sending our immense and deep gratitude for any help you feel able to offer!

**With huge thanks to our friend, colleague, and fellow Barn co-ordinator Barry Thurgood for all of his help and patience in creating the video for this campaign.

story:
Short Summary

  • I am Sr. Edelquine from Kenya and currently pursuing a degree in Master of Theological Studies at the University of Notre Dame, Indiana-USA
  • Construction of a maternity Center in Lirembe Village in Kenya is a campaign that aims at assisting women to access better health care services during and after delivery because the nearest center is fifty miles away.
  • As contributors, you will be giving life to these women and their children because you will give them closer services than they had before. 
  • I intend to raise fifty thousand dollars that will assist me to build the maternity center in three phases. First, four rooms that will serve as pharmacy, consultation, ward and delivery room. Second, connect piped water in the facility. Third, add more rooms that will serve as more wards, kitchen and store. Finally, purchase a car as an ambulance.
  • I will let you know of my perks with time
  • If I do not reach my goal, I will limit the number of buildings per phase.
  • My campaign is most important because it is pro-life. Its major aim is not to make profit but to allow women feel cared for when their time for delivery comes. Good life is what we all need in the world.
  • I have not held such a great project but I have faith that it will be possible to begin it and to keep my contributors updated through videos and photos once the project sets off. On this you can trust me. As a nun, I believe you will all have trust in me with your contributions since I made the campaign consciously.
  • Nuns are always trusted and I am one of them
  • There are many risks in it though. For instance, entrusting finances to another may be difficult but we cannot succeed without risking. This is because of my place of campaign, which is in the states and the venue for the center, which is Kenya. However, I will make often visits to ensure that the project is functioning as it should be. I will make efforts to ensure my contributors visit the site to ascertain the functionality of the center.
  • I will also ask for receipts for any purchases made so that transparency is enhanced. Money being an obstacle, with your contribution, I am convinced that it will be a stepping stone for the next move. My family has already provided me with land and other few local resources, which reduce the obstacle of such needs.
  • I ask you friends to help me on this campaign and let your friend be aware of it. Advice is also welcome. Some of you may wish to join hands so that we make this an organization. If you have similar thoughts, Please come on board so that we save our women and promote life.
  • You are also reminded to use the Indiegogo share tools! Thanks so much and I long to hear from you.
story_txt:
Short Summary

I am Sr. Edelquine from Kenya and currently pursuing a degree in Master of Theological Studies at the University of Notre Dame, Indiana-USA
Construction of a maternity Center in Lirembe Village in Kenya is a campaign that aims at assisting women to access better health care services during and after delivery because the nearest center is fifty miles away.
As contributors, you will be giving life to these women and their children because you will give them closer services than they had before. 


I intend to raise fifty thousand dollars that will assist me to build the maternity center in three phases. First, four rooms that will serve as pharmacy, consultation, ward and delivery room. Second, connect piped water in the facility. Third, add more rooms that will serve as more wards, kitchen and store. Finally, purchase a car as an ambulance.
I will let you know of my perks with time
If I do not reach my goal, I will limit the number of buildings per phase.

My campaign is most important because it is pro-life. Its major aim is not to make profit but to allow women feel cared for when their time for delivery comes. Good life is what we all need in the world.
I have not held such a great project but I have faith that it will be possible to begin it and to keep my contributors updated through videos and photos once the project sets off. On this you can trust me. As a nun, I believe you will all have trust in me with your contributions since I made the campaign consciously.
Nuns are always trusted and I am one of them

There are many risks in it though. For instance, entrusting finances to another may be difficult but we cannot succeed without risking. This is because of my place of campaign, which is in the states and the venue for the center, which is Kenya. However, I will make often visits to ensure that the project is functioning as it should be. I will make efforts to ensure my contributors visit the site to ascertain the functionality of the center.
I will also ask for receipts for any purchases made so that transparency is enhanced. Money being an obstacle, with your contribution, I am convinced that it will be a stepping stone for the next move. My family has already provided me with land and other few local resources, which reduce the obstacle of such needs.

I ask you friends to help me on this campaign and let your friend be aware of it. Advice is also welcome. Some of you may wish to join hands so that we make this an organization. If you have similar thoughts, Please come on board so that we save our women and promote life.
You are also reminded to use the Indiegogo share tools! Thanks so much and I long to hear from you.

story:
Bref Résumé

Je cherche à collecter 10000 € pour l'agrandissement de mon centre holistique qui aidera tous ceux qui cherchent à avoir la santé et bien-être au Cameroun.  Mes méthodes naturelles sont très sollicitées parmi non seulement les internationaux, mais de plus en plus les camerounais, car on prend conscience que la santé se trouve dans la nature.  Le centre sera l'oasis au milieu d'un monde trépidant et stressant, où l'on peut venir trouver le soin, la relaxation, la détoxification, et même les cours de l'alimentation saine.

Le Besoin

Au Cameroun, à cause de plusieurs facteurs socio-économiques et même culturels, la santé de beaucoup de monde se détériore inclus les enfants qui développent les maladies comme le diabète et l’obésité. L’obésité engendrent : les maladies cardio-vasculaires, la tension, le diabète, la faiblesse physique et sexuelle, la fatigue physique et mentale, et à la longue, les problèmes psychologiques comme le stress et la dépression, entre autres.  Et ce sont ces derniers qui sont le plus néfastes, parce qu’ils créent ou empirent les mêmes problèmes engendrés par l’obésité. Pire encore, les gens ne savent pas quoi faire pour rester en sante. Alors que faire ?

A propos de moi

Je suis Flore Ymélé HUNTER, et je suis spécialisée en Médicine Holistique.   Après avoir eu mon « Associate’s Degree » en science aux Etats-Unis, j’ai continué mes études pour devenir une guérisseuse.  J’ai suivi la formation en infirmerie pour avoir la certification d’une « Licensed Vocationnel Nurse » (LVN) avant de faire un apprentissage intense en Acupuncture et Naturopathie.  Ensuite, j’ai complété ma formation avec une certification en Massage et Soin Corporel que j’ai approfondi avec la connaissance de l’Aromathérapie et la Nutrition.  En tout, j’ai fait 7 ans des hautes études, avec plus de 9 ans d’expérience.  J’ai travaillé dans des spas de référence dans la zone urbaine de Washington DC, où j’ai perfectionné mes propres techniques thérapeutiques qui sont devenues extrêmement sollicitées et célébrées.

Avec la compréhension que tout dans la santé est connecté, j’ai mis ensemble des techniques thérapeutiques de la médecine traditionnelle Chinoise, Autochtone de l’Amérique, Indienne, Africaine et Japonaise pour ainsi créer une touche à moi que j’ appelle « Mboumi, » un mot qui signifie « le bien-être » dans ma langue natale.  Avec Mboumi, je résous tous les problèmes qui nous menacent en exerçant les techniques pour le traitement des malaises, des stress, de l’obésité ainsi que la réhabilitation après des attaques cardiovasculaire.  En plus, j’ai  développé  un programme de nutrition pour rester en sante et pour perdre le poids progressivement et naturellement sans pouvoir le regagner facilement.

Le Service

Avec l’expérience vécu aux USA concernant la santé humaine négligée, je n'aimerai pas que le Cameroun suit les mauvais pas des pays développés dans la négligence de leur santé.  Alors depuis trois ans, j’ai une clinique nommée  « Acupressure Wellness Center (AWT) » à Yaoundé, Cameroun, où j’adapte mes techniques pour le Cameroun.  Ma clientèle (composée des internationaux et nationaux) ne fait qu’accroitre, alors je vois que maintenant est le moment d’ajouter d’autres services en plus de la thérapie Mboumi pour avoir un vrai centre de bien-être : le Health Oasis. 

Le Health Oasis sera composé non seulement du clinique AWT, mais aussi encore plus des massages relaxants, comme" hot stones" et "hot towels", soins de la peau, body scrubs et exfoliations pour la detoxification, et encore plus des sessions d’aromathérapie pour relaxer, tonifier, et équilibrer le corps.  En plus, il y aura le yoga et les cours de médiation, et surtout les cours de la nutrition et de l’alimentation saine.  Tout le monde, surtout les internationaux, veut manger la nourriture ethnique camerounaise avec tout son goût et ses saveurs.  Mais souvent la manière de la préparer n'est pas bien pour la santé car il y a beaucoup d'huile ou trop de sel.  J'apprends aux cuisiniers et à tout le monde des façons de cuisinier sainement sans perdre une goutte de la saveur camerounaise.  Avec tous ces services dans une espace tranquille, le Health Oasis sera un centre où les humains pourront s'y rendre pour se guérir et avoir une information et une éducation détaillée sur comment rester sain.

J’appelle le centre Health Oasis parce qu’il sera vraiment un sanctuaire tranquille et restaurateur.  En traversant le portail, le stress, les mouvements et bruits de la vie quotidienne à l’extérieur seront laissés loin de soi pendant qu’on est transporté à une espace sans soucis ou problèmes, où on trouve tout pour la santé et bien-être.

L'impact

Avec le Health Oasis, ceux qui cherchent à devenir ou rester sains auront finalement un lieu qui les comble.  Pour le moment, Yaoundé n’a rien : pas de parcs, pas d’espaces verts, pas d’endroits calmes retirés des voitures et des foules de gens qui doivent chercher leurs vies.  Alors une zone salubre où on peut méditer sans distraction aux solutions de l’avenir est nécessaire.  Le Health Oasis permettra à tout le monde de se retirer, même si c’est juste pour quelques moments précieux, pour se rétablir et retrouver son focus et son énergie.

De plus en plus, on relie le stress aux maladies graves et mortels, comme les crises cardiaques et la tension.  Mais en plus, une personne au bout de sa force n’a plus rien pour donner à ses enfants ou son époux, une réalité qui a des conséquences encore plus néfastes et touchantes.  Le "Health Oasis" redonne la vie à ceux qui se sentent dépassés en faisant que ces hommes et femmes redeviennent capables de faire leur mieux.  Et quelqu’un qui a la capacité de contribuer positivement à son lieu de service ou chez lui ou même au centre-ville peut changer le monde !

Le Financement

Je veux recueillir 10000 € pour faire mon nouveau centre de bien-être:

Les fonds servira à acheter:

  •  Des fournitures comme des armoires, les meubles de réception, deux tables en plus de traitements,
  •  Des appareils; chauffe serviettes,le stérilisateur, le système audio, écran de télévision, réfrigérateur et cuisinière.
  • Plusieurs ustensiles de cuisine; Le mixeur, marmites, assietes, verres, couteaux ect.... pour compléter le fournissement de la nouvelle espace qui se trouve dans la région de Bastos.

Si le fond est amassé avant le 5 Mai 2018, ça sera formidable car je pourrai acheter tous ces restes ustensiles et être prêt de commencer aussitôt dans le Health oasis  parce que mes clients et des autres membres de la communauté  attendent impatiemment  que ces services s’ouvrent pour améliorer leur dégustation et leur santé saine.  

Je suis passionné de continuer à améliorer la vie des gens -- de l'intérieur jusqu'à l'extérieur. Je crois qu'avec une bonne santé, on peut vivre plus longtemps et atteindre un meilleur objectif.  Votre gracieuse participation mettra l'humain ensemble et fera du monde un meilleur endroit.

S'il vous plaît, je sais que vous croyez en la bonne santé humaine. Alors aidez-moi à aider les gens qui cherchent une vie saine et durable en contribuant à mon projet. Et je vous prie de veiller inviter vos chers amis attentionnés à le faire aussi à travers indiegogo.
