Sincerely Yours,
Devon Ward-Thommes
 
“Genuine progress occurs when the individual not only sees some results in achieving higher levels of meditative states but also when their meditation has at least some influence on how they interact with others, some impact from that meditation in their daily life — more patience, less irritation, more compassion. That’s productive meditation. Something that can bring benefit to others in some way.”
- H.H. Dalai Lama

story:
Do what thou wilt shall be the whole of the Law.

Perun Lodge is small yet highly dedicated local body of Ordo Templi Orientis in Zagreb, Croatia. 

With total of more than 250 workshops and events per year we are highly motivated to continue our service to the Thelemic community in Croatia and Worldwide.

Our regular events include: Man of Earth O.T.O. Initiations, Gnostic Mass, Man of Earth O.T.O. degree Workshops, E.G.C. Workshop,Reiki Workshop, Ceremonial Magick Workshop, Hatha Yoga Workshop, and Progressive Meditations Workshop (Vipassana).

We also serve as an organizational backbone for OTOK - biannual International O.T.O. Conference which every year gathers more and more brethren from Europe and all over the world for a weekend of exciting and fruitful experience of true Brotherhood of Man.

During this campaign on Feb 25 and 26 2017 e.v. we are organizing Basic Initiation Workshop for Oasis degree officers that will host attendees from few European countries.

Our cozy living room often serves as a comfort logging for traveling brethren, and holds national O.T.O. library.

We kindly ask you for your support so we can maintain and upgrade our Temple, activities and modes of promulgation of the Peace, Tolerance and Truth in accordance with the Law of Thelema.
 

Thank you!

To show our gratitude for your support we have prepared flowing perks for you, your friends and loved ones. We will do our best so you receive your items before Thelemic New Year on March Equinox V:III e.n. 

Here they are: 

Advanced Thelemic Calendar V:III

Highly practical 16x45cm 14 page Advanced Thelemic Calendar.

It includes: vugar date, position of Sun and Moon in degrees and minutes, day of the week as planetary ruler, phase of the moon with time of major phases, Thoth Tarot rulers of Major Arcana, Court cards, and Minor Arcana, Thelemic Feasts according to Book of the Law including times of eqinoxes, solsticesand cross-quarters, Birthdays, Greater Feasts and traditional celebrations of Saints of Ecclesia Gnostica Catholica.
Also there is plenty of space so you can add your own marks and important dates.

All calculations are made for Universal Time. 

Boleskine floor marker

10 cm diameter, durable hard laminated, floor sticker. to decorate your Temple or your favorite sacred space. Boleskine is considered the source of Thelemic current.

Following catastrophic fire on Dec 23rd 2015 e.v. we can only add quote from the Book of the Law: 

"But your holy place shall be untouched throughout the centuries: though with fire and sword it be burnt down & shattered, yet an invisible house there standeth, and shall stand until the fall of the Great Equinox; when Hrumachis shall arise and the double-wanded one assume my throne and place." Liber Al vel Legis III:34 

Small poster (45x32 cm)

One of the following fine prints on 200g quality paper. They are convenient and practical reminder tools suitable for any wall.

  • Saints of Ecclessia Gnostica Catholica small  poster

  • Tree of Life small poster 

​

  • Liber XIII diagram small poster

  • Magick small poster 

Liber XV - Croatian Edition

Softcover edition of the Croatian translation of Liber XV - O.T.O. Ecclesiae Gnosticae Catholicae Canon Missae.

Liber CCXX - Croatian Edition

A hardbound pocket edition of the Croatian translation of the Book of the Law. For all those who still miss this edition in their collections. 

Enochian Watchtowers set

Set of 5 Enochian tables. Large ones are 30x32,5cm and the table of Spirit is 10x12,5 cm. They are radiant and vividly colored. Fine print on 200g paper. Cut to the dimensions. 

4 Small Posters set

A set of our 4 small posters shown above.

Large Tree of Life poster (98x68cm)

Although map is not the territory, the good map can be of great help to any explorer. Tree of Life is the basic blue print in the Western Mysticism. In this scheme we are presenting the Thelemic version following notes of Aleister Crowley in his books Liber ABA, Liber 777, and Book Of Thoth including:

"The general colour of the traditional card is subfusc; it represents the confusion and darkness of the material world. But the New Aeon has brought fullness of Light; in the Minutum Mundum, Earth is no longer black, or of mixed colours, but is pure bright green."- Book of Thoth

This is a true beauty in kingly size. 

Love is the law, love under will.

story:
The Truth: Sacred California white sage is in critical condition...

and She is calling upon us now.

 

We MUST transmute the white sage smudge stick market!

  1. It unethically profits from stolen, over-harvested wild medicine and exploits The Mother
  2. It creates an illusion of cleansing, healing, and purifying
  3. It perpetuates our scarcity-mindset

Let's be real, white sage smudge sticks are just not viable.

  1. We burn way more medicine than we need, as they are intended for community ceremony
  2. They require a lot of energy to light
  3. The amount of smoke they release is pretty intense
  4. Extinguishing them can often be a struggle
  5. We are left with a whole lot of ashes afterwards
  6. AND our beloved Pachamama is reaping ZERO benefits!

 

We MUST transmute the current white sage smudge stick market.

We MUST remedy our over-harvesting of sacred medicine.

We MUST focus on a viable solution!

 

Our Solution: Aura Wisp!

The super sustainable white sage smudge stick substitute

May we honor & restore The Mother and Her children. And so it is.

We affirm:

  1. We empower mindful medicine use
  2. We reduce white sage demand (Our goal: 36%, at least!)
  3. We intentionally dose certified organic, lovingly-nurtured white sage
  4. We are easy-to-light
  5. We safely contain our embers and ashes
  6. We self-extinguish
  7. We are completely organic and compostable
  8. We are guided by Southern California Native ancestors, the original white sage stewards
  9. AND we fund a developing white sage restoration program and various other native initiatives!

We promise, this medicine is pretty freakin' potent. Why? It is grounded in true reciprocity with The Mother AND its elements are sourced with the highest love and integrity. This purity activates the sacred medicine's true healing energy.

 

Your Perk: Sacred Aura Wisp Altar

By receiving a Sacred Wispies Altar, not only are you contributing to white sage restoration, but you are also gratefully supporting:

  • Abalone restoration
  • Bat restoration  

 

We MUST return All of the love, support, and healing we have graciously received from Her.

 

Let’s Manifest!

Secure your Sacred Wispies Altar now, then share this solution with your soul family.

We MUST transmute the current white sage smudge stick market. Yes!

We MUST remedy our over-harvesting of sacred medicine. Yes!

We MUST return All of the love, support, and healing. Yes!

We MUST answer the call! YES!

May we purify, honor, and restore. And so it is.

Meet Your Medicine Mama

I am Issa Crow, Sovereign Mother Goddess, and a descendant of Southern California Natives.

I am so grateful to Be Here with you.

story:
Five days ago, another of my closest friends in the world joins the cancer epidemic. Worse, it's her child.  Diagnosed with bone cancer, her 14-year old now begins a lifelong journey with cancer and (we pray) recovery.

By 2024 there will be 19 Million cancer survivors, in the US alone. Dealing with RECOVERY. 

That means half of our friends or family members will be touched by cancer in their lifetime.

These patients are desperately seeking qualified experts in the HEALTH SIDE OF THE CANCER EQUATION to support and protect their health and provide long-term survivorship plans.

So many great practitioners do not treat cancer, but they can support and protect the health of their patients through every stage of their journey.  

You can help a great health practitioner become the health expert that cancer patients are looking for and get the training they need to design individualized HEALTH plans for cancer patients and cancer survivors.

THAT is how our loved ones thrive, during and AFTER treatment.

The need is huge and there is a real shortage of well trained, frontline clinicians with expertise to serve patients already searching for support.  

Please help.

story:
What Makes Us Special?

Our heritage formulations, inspired by our grandmothers’ and great-grandmothers’ skincare remedies have been reinvented as nature intended when they meet our "natural preservatives packaging technology". We spoke to over 350 people of various ages, from all walks of life, ethnicities and cultures and here's what we asked,

"What did your grandmothers and great grandmothers use for their skincare?”

No one replied with, “Oh my grandmother used toxic chemicals, sulfates and dyes!” and not one person said, “My gramma used phthalates, hydroquinone and micro-beads!" So we decided, we would not use them either!

    

We’ve searched far & wide for ingredients that are safely ingestible (either edible or drinkable) in their own right. We then combined them in such a way that they work beautifully together with no chemicals! We found them in global pantries and gardens from around the world!

We truly use natural, organic and toxic-free ingredients! For example, our pure organic chardonnay grape seed oil is not only easily digested but also has a 2-year shelf life!

Plus we use ZERO water in our formulas and thus require no synthetic preservatives either!

A few short months ago we came together to build Borbón Skincare a San Francisco-based, Latina-owned premium organic & natural personal care brand. Now we’re creating products made from the world's finest raw organic, natural & wild crafted ingredients inspired by homeopathic traditions and a goal to bring to market products made with our organic & natural formulas so you don't have to worry about what is being absorbed into your blood stream through your skin!

A Couple of Our Other Heritage Products

Some of our other handcrafted top formulations are turning the organic & natural skincare industry on its ear and we’re certain our Soothing Herbal Massage Serum will do the same as well!

        

Borbón No.1 Revitalising Facial  ~ (Coffee Exfoliation Masque & Scrub with organic Japanese Peppermint Essential Oil)

           

Borbón No.2 Invigorating Body Polish ~ (Coffee Body Exfoliant with organic Sweet Orange Essential Oil)   

Nature Meets Technology ~

And last but most definitely not least our unique Borbón proprietary formulations such as our No.1 Revitalising Facial, No.2 Invigorating Body Polish and our latest creation, the Soothing Herbal Massage Serum (roll-on) are all hand packed & poured into our Violet Glass Technology!

                        

What IS Violet Glass?

Simply put, our dark violet glass bottles & jars filter the “bad light” out. Big deal, right? Most colored glass vessels do this. But our bottles and jars ALSO allow in THREE types of “nourishing light” that help to NATURALLY preserve the integrity of the organic/natural ingredients inside our beautiful sleek packaging!     

                                                                   

Our Place In The Market ~

The personal care market is currently estimated at $30B and the global demand for ORGANIC personal care products was $7.6B in 2012 and expected to reach $13.2B by the end of this year.

Our Passions & Our Purposeful Ways ~

Every Borbón jar & bottle is carefully created to be safe enough for our entire community of women, men, tweens & teens, especially our Cancer Warriors, Champions & Divas!

As we grow we’ll also help other communities in our own backyard and in other countries, through our philanthropic efforts as well as our commitment as a business that reflects our beliefs in social responsibility and eco-sustainability. This is why we exist.

What does the future hold?

Several of our products have dual or triple functions that assist in acne, scars, age spots & blemishes / uneven skin tone / dryness & dehydration challenges. Our products range from aging enhancers & fine line reducers to soothing muscle relaxation with a dose of extra emollients, herbal relief and clean scents.      

                                                     

We’re redefining THE CLEAN & GREEN BEAUTY REVOLUTION and we want to empower people everywhere to live clean, healthy & beautiful lives with our Hydrating Moisturizer, Clarifying Cleanser and Intoxicating Toner (coming early 2019) and dozens of new scent combinations of our current product lines as well!   

But first things first...

Our first goal (Spring) is to bring our Soothing Herbal Massage Serum to market in the next few weeks which means we’ll need to revamp our website, design our (labels & marketing collateral), buy ingredients & supplies (bottles, boxes) and ship your orders!

Our second goal (Summer) is to stay in San Francisco and move into a production facility at a new development for SF-based manufacturers.

Goal number three (Winter) is to create our BODO Program (Buy-One-Donate-One) for Heaven’s Door Cancer Foundation (www.heavensdooropen.com) (2019)

Other Ways You Can Help 

  • Please MAKE SOME NOISE! Share our campaign with your friends and family!
  • There's lots of way to do this via your social media and Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you from the bottom of our hearts~

Thank you for your pledges! We’re grateful and humbled by your support!

WE are Borbón Skincare, Inc. YOU are our heroines & heroes!   

Carmen Milagro ~ Founder at Borbón Skincare, Inc. (53)

   #bornofnature #madebyartists #latinaowned #handcrafted #sfmade

2017 Cover Ads in FitnFabs Magazine

Please remember...You know your body best! As with any & all food, as well as, skincare products & formulations some people may experience allergic reactions. We encourage everyone to read our labels (which are easy to understand), go to our website and of course, keep products away from eyes & do a test patch on the inside of their wrist when you begin to use our products! 

Our Challenges

We’re a start-up company, that much is true but we’re ready to raise the bar and change the norm in the organic premium skincare market!  And, we’re not following, we're LEADING the way in the premium organic skincare industry! We feel our timing is right and we KNOW the time is now!

We expect to begin to ship orders within 30-40 days from the last day of our funding campaign but please bear with us if we run a little later than that. We have healthy fantastic relationships with our vendors, service providers & suppliers but we don't have the volumes (yet) that would place us in their "top priority" as their #1 client. But we promise we will do our absolute best to keep you posted and ship on a timely basis.

Please note:
At this time we are NOT able to ship to international locations.
 

Note: "Shipping charges" factor in all processing, handling, warehousing, importing/exporting, entry, customs and Indiegogo fees so we can do our best to meet our goal to ship "from our door to your door" as quickly as possible and with no transportation delays or "surprise additional fees" on your end.

We’re small...for now, but we are determined to empower our cancer warriors and everyone else to live clean healthy beautiful lives! We're passionate about our mission to create safe products, as well as build an eco-friendly, scalable, repeatable and socially responsible legacy company!

How will we accomplish this?
With the guidance of our highly-skilled, massively successful and experienced team of advisors and strategic alliances. It's simply going to take us a little time to implement our "growth phases" after this product launch.

story:
June 12, 2017 Update

WE DID IT! We reached our initial goal of $8,000. Thank you thank you thank you to everyone who contributed. It has been truly powerful to be supported by people in the neighborhood awaiting our opening, by friends and colleagues in our well connected community acupuncture network, and by lots of individuals and families in RI and Mass who simply care deeply about these cities we live in, about health care access, and about economies that make sense. We are feeling so much love and gratitude!

...AND WE KEEP GOING! Every dollar we raise beyond that will bring us closer to hiring another acupuncturist, extending our clinic hours, and providing more care for our friends and neighbors! We are so excited to match the momentum and enthusiasm of our supporters, and we are committed to providing a healing space that meets the needs (and demand) of our community. We invite you to join us in reaching for our stretch goal of $10,000.

Thank you for being on this journey with us.

 

Short Summary

My name is Korben and I am an acupuncturist, parent, and story-teller living in Providence, Rhode Island with my wife and 8-year-old son. I've been practicing acupuncture for 15 years and community acupuncture for 10 years, and have found it to be my passion and calling to offer affordable health care to my friends, family, and community.

 

 

I have been gathering the seeds of Kindred Community Acupuncture for a long long time. I started gathering them when I learned as a young person the simple invocation to think globally and act locally. I gathered them as a young adult when acupuncture not only healed several serious and chronic conditions of mine but also made me feel ecstatic and re-connected, and when I was lucky enough to learn the art and science of Chinese Medicine at New England School of Acupuncture.  I gathered them as a practitioner when providing free group acupuncture treatments all over New Orleans after hurricane Katrina, and when starting Philadelphia Community Acupuncture,  which was one of the first and busiest of the new sliding scale clinics to open around the country. Most recently, I’ve been gathering the seeds here in Rhode Island, treating thousands of people per year over the last half decade at Providence Community Acupuncture, which, like Kindred, is a member of the People’s Organization of Community Acupuncture.

I invite you to join our team of people committed to making effective and natural medicine widely accessible as we plant and nourish and grow Kindred Community Acupuncture into a well established, and vitally important resource for Pawtucket and the Providence neighborhoods of Hope and Mount Hope and North Providence; for Central Falls, Lincoln and other communities along the Blackstone River; for Attleboro and other areas in southern Massachusetts. These neighborhoods comprise some of the most densely populated areas in New England, as well as the communities least served by the profoundly effective natural medicine of acupuncture. Support our launch campaign to make affordable community health care to thousands of people in the area.

                                     

Ash Trull                                                                         Gayle Rodgers
Project Manager                                                          Chief Adminstrator
Marketing Coordinator                                             Office Manager

What We Need & What You Get

We are so excited to open the doors of our clinic in July with a growing community of supporters around us and in the chairs! In order to start with enough financial capital, we need to raise $8,000 in crowdsource support. This amount will go towards:

  • Front Office Set-up: A desk, new computer and printer
  • Communications Equipment: phone and internet connection
  • 3 Months Worth of Acupuncture Supplies: single use acupuncture needles, blankets, pillows, first aid materials
  • 3 Months Rent: for our beautiful new space in the Mills Building at 545 Pawtucket Ave
  • Marketing Materials & Merch: fliers, business cards, t-shirts, and stickers*

*We are really excited to offer some of our beautifully-designed merch as perks for our contributors! See the perks at the right to decide how much you’d like to give --->

Blessed with what will be a beautiful and relaxing sanctuary of a clinic space, we hope that by our summer opening it can serve as a giant shade tree for neighbors and fellow travellers at our intersection between cities. By helping cover the costs for those first three growing months,  you’ll help assure that Rhode Island and southern Massachusetts can harvest the fruits of a completely flourishing clinic and community space by autumn, usually the busiest time for community acupuncture. At that point, we’ll throw a Kindred Harvest Party to thank contributors and patients and continue the process of creating community.

What We've Got So Far

We are so excited with all the momentum we’ve generated so far! As of now, we have an amazing launch team taking on different aspects of our opening: the treatment, financing, administration, and marketing

We are also very excited to already have a base of over 200 patients and supporters via our existing networks, facebook page, and email list!

We have a beautiful clinic space in the Mills at 545 Pawtucket Ave. The space includes beautiful hardwood floors, enormous windows for natural light, and an amazing community of local businesses, artists, and activists also housed in the same building.

The Impact

With your help, Kindred will open this summer to provide quality acupuncture treatment at a low-cost sliding scale fee ($15 - $45) to (you and) thousands of our neighbors who have  been yet able to access and afford  this vital natural medicine. We will be joining the network of hundreds of successful and boming community acupuncture clinics around the country as part of the People's Organization of Community Acupuncture (POCA).

Most people don’t want to pay for an individualized and quasi mystical “experience”, or for a specialist in a lab coat-- or have the money for that! Kindred will focus on our maximizing our patients' treatment results, respecting patients as an essential part of a healing community, creating a comfortable and casual atmosphere for healing, and increasing patients' ability to get frequent and regular treatments.

Risks & Challenges

In offering community acupuncture at affordable rates, our clinic will only succeed if we are able to build a strong base of support and patients invested in the clinic and also experiencing the benefits of regular acupuncture treatments. We know that success in building a base in the first 6 months of opening Kindred will be essential in allowing the clinic to sustain itself and continue to offer vital health services to the region. Through our existing networks as well as our reputation for providing relief and healing through acupuncture, we are confident that our clinic has the critical mass it needs to be successful. We see this crowdsource fundraiser campaign as a visible manifestation of that community of support in creating and sustaining this essential space of healing, treatment, and relief.

Other Ways You Can Help

Unable to contribute to this campaign? Or excited about contributing AND doing more? Here are some other ways you can help! We need:

Promotion:

  • Share this campaign on your facebook page
  • Send a direct message to 2 friends who are excited about healing, acupuncture, community, or health equity who may want to support this project

Equipment and materials:

  • A beautiful desk for front office
  • Nice waiting room chairs
  • Small couch for waiting room. Bright and clean and comfy.
  • Beautiful clean rugs. 2 large round or square. 1 for a narrow hallway.
  • 2 or 3 more recliners
  • A R T !  Our themes will be place, home, maps, body, growing, play
  • Drapes or curtains

Volunteers

  • Promoters: people with skills in outreach and publicity via phone, door-knocking, social media, emails, and networking
  • Movers: people with skills in moving furniture, painting, decorating
  • Translaters: people bilingual in spanish and english who can help with translating outreach materials and forms
  • Event planner: people with skills in event planning, cooking, space set-up, MCing, and more who can help us with our kick-off party on May 13

Why Community Acupuncture?

In the U.S, outside of some East Asian communities, acupuncture has become known as a boutique treatment, performed on tables in individual cubicles. This model has less to do with any traditional understanding of the best way to receive acupuncture and more to do with our cultural training as individualized consumers in a psycho-medicalized market. In our clinic we use recliners grouped in a quiet and soothing space. Treating patients in a community setting has many benefits: it’s easy for friends and family members to come in for treatment together; many patients find it comforting. We also believe that a collective energy field becomes established which makes individual treatments more powerful. Many people fall asleep, and wake feeling refreshed, energized, clear-headed.

Community acupuncture is about improving results by expanding access. It’s about the patient being able to get more, and therefore more effective, treatments by virtue of our sliding scale. If the practitioner knows she or he might see you 6 times instead of once, the treatments can be simple, relaxing, geared towards long range goals as well as immediate relief.

The other kind of access which is important to us is that of each patient’s connection to community and to collective healing. Much of our modern illness and injury is related to isolation and oppression, and the antidote to this is not more separation but more connection, more caring and more community.  

Here’s what you can rely on from us. Experienced and dedicated and licensed practitioners and a clinic open the kind of varied hours including evenings and weekends that most of us need given our work and family schedules. Expert and friendly front desk staff. Clear information about our policies, fees, and what to expect and not to expect as a patient. A calm and clean sanctuary with a slow buzz of energy and where every effort has been made to ensure the comfort and safety of every patient. A gathering space for community groups and a small library of information about local health and justice issues. Local art. The pioneering of a program offering local high school students the opportunity to observe and study community acupuncture in action.
story_txt:
June 12, 2017 Update
WE DID IT! We reached our initial goal of $8,000. Thank you thank you thank you to everyone who contributed. It has been truly powerful to be supported by people in the neighborhood awaiting our opening, by friends and colleagues in our well connected community acupuncture network, and by lots of individuals and families in RI and Mass who simply care deeply about these cities we live in, about health care access, and about economies that make sense. We are feeling so much love and gratitude!
...AND WE KEEP GOING! Every dollar we raise beyond that will bring us closer to hiring another acupuncturist, extending our clinic hours, and providing more care for our friends and neighbors! We are so excited to match the momentum and enthusiasm of our supporters, and we are committed to providing a healing space that meets the needs (and demand) of our community. We invite you to join us in reaching for our stretch goal of $10,000.
Thank you for being on this journey with us.
 
Short Summary

I've been practicing acupuncture for 15 years and community acupuncture for 10 years, and have found it to be my passion and calling to offer affordable health care to my friends, family, and community.

story:
¿Quieres ver esta campaña en Español? Da click aquí. 

Has your phone ever ruined your day?

Your social media feed is full of articles you don't want to read, arguments you don't want to have, memes that add nothing to your life, and windows into the lives of others triggering emotions that aren’t good for you.

Yet you keep coming back for more, several dozen times a day. Why?

Because it's a powerful, highly addictive tool, one that was designed to hold your attention and keep you coming back for more.

Smartphones are not the enemy...in fact, they have access to everything you need to improve your life and go after your dreams: books, audiobooks, educational podcasts, exercise classes, guided meditations, and time-tested philosophy.

Phones are tools, and like all tools, they can be used constructively or destructively.

Instead of focusing on the latest viral moment, you could be watching a 7 minute chapter of an e-course, which can help you reinvent yourself and your career without getting another degree.

Instead of articles that add nothing to your life (like The 10 Best Whatevers About Whatever) you could be listening to an audiobook, feeding your mind with ideas that will enrich your knowledge and creativity (increasing your chances of coming up with something truly innovative). 

Instead of being pushed into an existential crisis after scrolling through picture after picture of lives that seem to be far better than yours, you could be addressing the exact obstacles you're facing and getting specific advice. 

You could still be addicted to your phone – forcing your addiction to help you live a more focused, objective-driven and productive life.

We’re here to trigger better thoughts, better actions, and better ways of investing your time. 

 

Teledipity’s software will be one of a kind: it will combine the latest developments in artificial intelligence with the centuries old system of numerology (from the mind of Pythagoras himself).

This system theorizes that our lives unfold in endlessly repeating 9 YEAR CYCLES. The same progression of themes unfolds in a similar fashion, and understanding its order can help us see our weekly challenges from a different perspective (without ever actually giving us the ability to predict the future, because that is impossible). 

Of course, this doesn't mean that we live through the EXACT same experiences over and over and over again.

It means that the same THEMES get repeated in the same order, and there are some general inferences we can make about our challenges and opportunities when we pay attention to those patterns. 

Curiously enough, this is the entire basis of artificial intelligence: the universe is built from patterns that can be trusted to make educated predictions and eerily accurate insights.

When you trust patterns, you will almost always be right (because even the most intelligent beings, artificial or otherwise, are NEVER ALWAYS RIGHT). 

What would an application that understands both spirituality and science tell us about our lives, our problems, and our road to happiness? 

Our "life coach" will simulate the experience of Facebook/Twitter/Instagram, but with much more productive content..

Start with an eerily accurate personality and talents profile. We will be able to identify key personality characteristics based on your social media activity. 

We will combine these insights with insights from the Pythagorean system, which are also eerily accurate in giving a detailed account of strengths, weaknesses and talents.

Continue to a chat session with none other than PYTHAGORAS himself (a super fun chat bot). He will ask you a few questions about your interests, hobbies and dreams.

Pythagoras will use all that information to help you write a clear mission statement for your life.

 

Arrive at the daily content area, where Pythagoras will show you a daily selection of:

  • Online courses you should be taking (based on your stated objectives)
  • Books and/or audiobooks you should be devouring (based on the hobbies, industry of choice, and self-improvement areas of focus you mentioned)
  • Blogs, articles, and podcasts about the future of your industry, relevant self-improvement topics, and powerful reflections from humanity’s most respected philosophers and thinkers (all aligned with your needs).

And of course...

  • The original content you’ve come to know and love as a Teledipity subscriber: monthly and yearly forecasts, in both written and audio form, about where you stand in Pythagoras’ 9 year cycle.

 

Whether you want to build a company, make a movie, design a board game, or invent a product, our system will be able to identify content that will help you achieve your short and long-term goals...

But that is not all.

If you love what our software is able to do we have two exciting offers which will help you go past your individual objectives, and dig deeper into your relationships.

  • Compatibility reports to compare and contrast your personality with the personalities of the people in your life.
  • A gift recommendation tool, allowing you to select the perfect course or book to give to a loved one.

Think of Teledipity as a ‘success GPS’.

For the past two years, I wrote, recorded, and published a weekly string of updates with specific life lessons based on Pythagoras’ system.

They include articles, reflections, and podcasts, all inspired by humanity's greatest writers (properly cited, of course), and all aligned with your stage in the 9 year cycle.

They were all created to address the specific issues identified by Pythagoras as the most important during this month (or year) of your life, and they're overflowing with motivation, optimism, and the deeply held belief that your life and future are up to you.

You don't have to wait for the application to go live to experience this content. Visit Teledipity.com to get an instant (and FREE) assessment of your personality based on Pythagoras' system, and start getting your weekly email updates dissecting the current month and year of your life.

 

The ULTIMATE REWARD

Explained

$58 (Discount EXTENDED!)

$88 (Regular Price)

 

 

- One 30 minute skype call with me
We can go over your numerology chart, your goals for 2018, and any questions you may have. 

- 20 free compatibility reports 
Will be released around April/May on the Teledipity website.

-10 free gift recommendations
 Will be released with the mobile application.

-1 immediate compatibility report
 While mine won't be available until April, I can send you one about you and a chosen one right after you make your donation. It was written by an excelent numerologist whom I deeply respect.

- Be involved in the design of the application
Throughout the development phase, I will need feedback from active users to make sure every button and feature fits your needs. If you support at this level, you will be part of the team of users I will be soliciting feedback from throughout the process. 

- Early access to the application 
Months before the app goes live on Google Play and the App Store, we will release it privately to the BETA team (a select group of Teledipity users who will test the product). Giving at this level guarantees your spot in this special group!

story:
Hey name is Aidan and I'm a graphic designer from Dundalk, Ireland. My one passion in life apart from design, is brewing beer. I've been brewing beer for the last 3 years and have decided to start a blog documenting my move to all grain home brewing.

All grain brewing requires a lot of equipment, and that's where I need your help. I have raised just under half of what I need to produce that sweet nectar we call beer. The aim of this campaign is to help raise the other half of the funds required to purchase an all in one grain brewing system.

If I fail to hit the €600 mark, any funds donated will still go towards brewing equipment - it might just take a little longer to start the brewing adventure!  

Having this system can speed up the process, and allow me to make quite a lot of beer, which in turn helps fuel the blog and its content.

The blog will not only document the beer-making process but will also help to grow my brewing skills with the overall goal of producing a beer worthy of gold at the National Homebrew Championship 2016.

Through the blog I'll share everything; my wins, my fails, my recipes, my brew days, my bottling process, label design and everything else that falls under the bracket of Homebrew. 

I've put together a couple of perks :



Thanks for taking the time to read this and I look forward to talking to you on the blog! www.brownboxbrew.com

The blog will not only document the beer-making process but will also help to grow my brewing skills with the overall goal of producing a beer worthy of gold at the National Homebrew Championship 2016.
Through the blog I'll share everything; my wins, my fails, my recipes, my brew days, my bottling process, label design and everything else that falls under the bracket of Homebrew. 
I've put together a couple of perks :










Thanks for taking the time to read this and I look forward to talking to you on the blog! www.brownboxbrew.com

story:
I am interested to start a Himalayan Salt Healing Center on my land here in Pai, Thailand. I call the land Om Dome and thus far have two domes: one bungalow and one 2 meter diameter sauna on my roof.  The goal is to have a total of three domes!  To get a feel for the existing house and land you can check out the slideshow here. 

http://www.flickr.com/photos/87715241@N07/sets/72157631633959459/show/

The idea of creating a healing center sounds pretty simplistic but this project is as multidimensional as we are. We made some original paintings to illustrate exactly what we would like to do. 

The main focus of the Himalayan Salt Healing Center is a 4 meter diameter salt room dome which is multipurpose.  This room will be a general healing space for meditation, singing and soaking up the healing ions of Himalayan Crystal Salt.  The salt room dome will also have a natural roofing structure build over it to protect it from rain as rainy seasons here are quite strong.



You can read about salt therapy here and what it is..  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salt_therapy

Another focus will be a 10 meter diameter octagonal meeting space (Sala in Thai) constructed from natural materials where people can do dynamic dancing, yoga, meditation & singing.  This will have a polished earth floor so that people can soak up the natural energy of the earth through their bare feet!

Also I would like to build an earth bungalow to accommodate participants during their stay. (The 2 below images show you the stages of building, taking it from adobe earth bricks to a naturally plastered white exterior. The natural plaster is Lime.)


I will also have a solar heated salt bath. (this is featured in our youtube video).

So to recap what I would like to provide for people:  salt room therapy, sound healing, salt bath, dynamic dancing, steam sauna, breath work (Pranayama), yoga, massage and detox dieting including water/salt therapies, juicing/raw & liver cleanse.  This is a vegetarian & vegan friendly environment and we will be cutting animal products completely in favor of fresh organic vegetable & fruit based sources of energy.  Also the major emphasis is on growing our own organic food & medicinal herbs!  People who wish to play in the garden are more than welcome!  So what these funds will help me to be able to do is to pay for the necessary Himalayan salt & to build all of the structures needed.  The most important thing to remember here is that our purpose is to heal and promote well being for all...imagine how many lives will benefit through the renewed health & spirit they will experience from their stay at our healing center!  

About Star Crystal Salt...  I started Star Crystal Salt around 2 years ago and have been importing Himalayan Crystal Salt with the assistance of angel investment (Thank you Tania).  Currently selling Himalayan Salt in stores around northern Thailand and currently in a growing phase but self sufficient as it is.  We are committed to importing Himalayan Salt in a sustainable way supporting an amazing supplier who runs a family owned salt factory in Pakistani Kashmir.  We believe in supporting local and keeping things as green as possible donating salt to orphanages in Chiang Mai, Thai & Western schools in the village of Mae Hee in Pai and setting up a program so that local Thai's can buy Himalayan Salt at an affordable rate.  We would also like to offer free retreats to local Thai's every year.  You can read more about Star Crystal Salt on the website.

http://www.starcrystalsalt.com/about-us.html


Here are the details to create the Himalayan Salt Healing Retreat Center...

Himalayan Salt = $6,000

Currently I have a small amount of Himalayan salt in stock to run my business but in order to purchase enough to do the center, including salt bricks for salt room, I would need this amount to purchase from my investor who keeps the stock in Chiang Rai, Thailand.  The salt is very expensive when you consider transport cost, taxes, customs, broker, fees and again transport in Thailand.  Most of the cost is in transport.  We would need roughly 3,000 salt bricks for walls and floor.  The floor will be made by pressing each brick into clay earth with natural mortar grouting between.  The wall will be made by pressing each brick into clay plaster on adobe brick walls. Needless to say this structure will be a very grounding experience.

Each brick is 8 inch long by 2 inch thick.  Each brick costs $1.50 after customs, taxes & transport.  The remaining balance would be used for purchasing salt stock for the retreat center for the purpose of consumption & cleansing.  All of our salt is edible grade!

Here is an image of the salt brick..


Salt Room Dome = $5,500

This includes labor, earth, construction, materials as well as dehumidifier, salt air ionizer, all electrical and surround sound speaker system with wooden door.

Octagonal Meeting Space = $3,000

This is to purchase all wood posts and roofing wood (wood is expensive these days in Thailand) and to pour beams under ground around perimeter.  This would also include surround sound system as well as mic etc.

Solar System for pool (including jacuzzi system) = $4,500

This includes purchasing all materials including black tubing for solar heating water, platform to put piping on and pump for jacuzzi jets.  Additionally the pool would need to be saturated with Himalayan salt and purification systems put in such as ozone.  The pool also needs cover for rainy season and needs to be pH checked for acidifying or alkalizing.  

Earth Bungalow = $9,500

We want to make our accommodating first class which means building in a solid and long lasting way.  Also we want to make the bungalow sealed from bugs and so that it is warm in winter and cool in summer.  This is possible when construction is fully sealed. This cost includes solid reinforced concrete beams with proper foundation.  All water piping, electrical as well as top class flooring such as granite tile and teak parquet wood floors and tiled kitchen & bathroom.  Everything will be sealed with lacquer. Additionally the rooftop will be a high cost due to the need to lay concrete planks down and then pouring a floor then to be tiled.  Ceramic roofing tiles will fan out from the edge of the flat roof to protect the earth walls.  I have experience building in Thailand and know how to save cost, direct workers in Thai and how to build the best for this climate. The end result will be a very comfortable bungalow and stunning construction with beautiful views and quiet relaxing energy for patrons to enjoy!

If this project is funded then I expect it to be finished by Summer 2015.  If I am unable to meet the goal then I will still build the salt room & dance/yoga meeting space as priority and currently have a guest room that I can make work for accommodation in the meantime. The bungalow will be needed in the future though so hopefully we can fully fund!

By helping me fund this you are enabling this planet and it's people to start to heal one person at a time.  I really trust these techniques for bringing people to wholeness and health and feel strongly that it is my life purpose to bring this to the world.  I have a great reputation with the community in Pai and am known for my honesty and follow throughness.  I am a strongly motivated person with great perserverence and I simply will not stop until this project is brought into full fruition!  I am confident that it will be!


What You Get!!

I can offer you some of the highest quality Himalayan Crystal Salt around!  Here are your perks!  120g Reusable Glass Salt Shaker, 200g Reusable Glass Salt Grinder with ceramic grinding mechanism (stainless steel head), 250g Salt packs, 1kg of your choice of assorted salts.  250g is roughly .5lb.

Here are the images of your perks!


120g Reusable Glass Salt Shaker...

 

200g Reusable Glass Salt Grinder...

 

250g Fine Granules Pack...

 

250g Salt Crystals Pack...


Free Shipping!! 


Finally I am offering something very special for $500 & $1,000 donors.  I am offering a free stay at the new healing center at any time you choose.  The credit is yours to use when you please after Summer 2015.  Of course reservations are subject to scheduling and availability.  In the meantime I will also throw in some free salt for you!


Please remember to spread the word to friends, family and coworkers regarding this project and let's all unite together to make it happen!  Huge THANK YOU to all of you!  Sincerely..  Dave

story:
Help us blanket Charleston with Naloxone (aka Narcan) 

Our county is still in a crisis. We lose a family member every two and a half days - mostly to opioid overdoses. There is an easy-to-use antidote for these overdoses, a nasal spray version of Naloxone called Narcan. By making this medicine widely accessible, we can save more lives. 

For the past 6 months, a new community group SOAR (Solutions Oriented Addiction Response) has trained and helped equip over 50 local businesses, churches, and nonprofits with Narcan. Most all businesses put up a sticker that says "We Carry Naloxone", which challenges the stigma around addiction while alerting bystanders that the antidote is nearby. 

We wouldn't have been able to do this work to date without major help - including working with Dr. Lindsay Acree, Dr. Christine Teague, and Kathy Kay. 

Below are some of your favorite Lifesavers: 

  • Oddbird Gifts
  • Starlings Coffee & Provisions
  • Base Camp Printing
  • Piggly Wiggly (on Spring St.) 
  • Nappy by Nature Hair Salon
  • Elk City Records
  • Kinship Goods
  • Charleston School of Beauty Culture
  • The Consignment Store
  • Partnership for African American Churches


How Your Donation Helps: 

We're just getting started. We're excited to keep recruiting Lifesavers in 2020 and keep finding ways to challenge stigma around this life saving medicine and other ways we can reduce harm and save lives in our county and state. 

  • Help us fund 1-2 part-time community outreach organizers who will help us reach out to many more businesses and churches in Charleston and beyond.
  • Help us buy more stickers! (they're kind of expensive).
  • Help us advocate for policies and programs that will save more lives. 
  • Help SOAR become an actual nonprofit! 
     

The Perks:

"I Carry Naloxone" Bumper Sticker 

Do you carry Naloxone, or plan to carry it soon?* Turn your car into a Lifesaver! Or place this sticker on any surface to let the people around you know that you have Naloxone (aka Narcan) and that you know how to use it! 

You can also get more stickers just in time for your friends and families for the holidays! 

  • Your donation of at least $25 gets you a fresh bumper sticker.
  • Your donation of at least $50 get you THREE fresh bumper stickers. 
  • Your donation of at least $100 gets you SIX bumper stickers AND 1 limited edition Lifesavers Pin.
  • By putting these stickers up, you're more likely to connect with someone who needs your help, and your donation will also help SOAR distribute more Naloxone throughout our community! 

*Don't have Naloxone yet? You don't need a prescription to get Naloxone at your pharmacy! Your pharmacist can also help answer your questions. If you have Medicaid, Naloxone is no more than $3.00. Alternatively, your local Health Dept or charity health clinic may offer free Naloxone! 

All stickers (and the pins) are designed by Base Camp Printing, a design and print shop on Charleston's West Side. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Are you looking for other ways to help SOAR save lives in 2020? 

  • Invite 100 friends to like our growing facebook page!
  • Follow us on Instagram
  • Want to join our volunteer canvassing team? Want to help us write grants? Want to partner up on projects? Drop us an email here. 

Thank you for everything you do to help our city, county, and state SOAR!

story:
The Canstruction Toronto event challenge is to build a structure made entirely of (canned) food, all of which is then donated to the Daily Bread Food Bank. All of the money you donate will go towards buying the food required to build our top-secret structure. We need to raise well over $6000 dollars to make our entry another huge success, and maximize the quality and quantity of the canned food which will be donated to the Daily Bread Food Bank.

Our past entries were huge successes - check out the ""MiCANaak" turtle pictured here, or the previous year's "BeaCAN Of Hope" Lighthouse! Though our entries won accolades for design and structural stability, the real prize is having raised over $3,800 in food donations last year alone. We love this event because it creates an opportunity for us to apply creativity, teamwork, and analytical problem solving in a fun event that benefits our community. We need your help to finance this year's entry. Your contribution will help provide relief to an ever-increasing hungry population in Toronto. We truly appreciate any support that you can offer to our campaign, whether it be a monetary donation, or making some noise about this event and passing along the info to your own contacts.

story:
Children In the Mountain /

01 October 2018 - 15 November 2018

"Charity 50" Official Event Page:

  • www.arteet.com/Children-In-The-Mountain

 

Working with the Sichuan Azalea Charity Foundation, Arteet Gallery will provide basic necessities for children living in extreme poverty in Sichuan Province, China, such as books, school supplies and sports equipment. We rely on generous donations from people like you to ensure that these kids can further their education and work towards a better future.

Charity 50 /

In making a donation of $250 USD, you will not only be helping these children to secure a better life for themselves, but you can also select and receive a painting from the 50 beautiful art pieces in the “Charity 50” collection, selected exclusively for this event.

Delivering Your Painting /

  • 1. Donate $250 USD on Indiegogo.
  • 2. Visit "Charity 50" event page :
    www.arteet.com/Children-In-The-Mountain
  • 3. Select your favorite painting.
  • 4. Fill in your shipping address.
  • 5. Arteet Gallery will deliver this painting to you.

Help Us By Sharing /

Please share our campaign, donate to the cause, so that you can help us to bring a brighter future to the 277 children of Yato village in Sichuan Province.

Find Out More /

"Charity 50" Official Event Page:

  • www.arteet.com/Children-In-The-Mountain

Arteet Gallery Official Website:

  • www.arteet.com

Shall you have any questions, please kindly get in touch with us. Our employee usually reply within 6 hours on business day.

  • charity@arteet.com

story:
Summary

For 20 years, Dave White has single-handedly run The Downtown Boxing Club. Ever the pioneer, the club has been housed in many up and coming areas, from Chinatown to Blagden Alley, to Union Market, all before they were desirable. As the neighborhoods have gentrified, The DBC has been priced out: so here we are, getting ready to start the next round and find the next space. With your support, the gym will find a new home. Thank you!

What We Need & What You Get

Dave isn't looking for a handout. In exchange for your financial support, we have some great items for you and they'll be ready for pick-up in the new space! That being said, if you'd like to make a contribution to the cause, we won't say no!

Goals

Our goals are as follows:

The goal is for new space - $10,000

Stretch 1 – new ring, $20,000

Stretch 2 – all-new bags, $25,000

Stretch 3 – $30,000, Dave takes a vacation

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can contribute, thank you again. If you can't, please consider sharing this campaign with anyone who might be interested.

On behalf of Dave, who as we all know, is not very tech-savvy, thank you!

story:
Our Story

There are very few of us that have not been touched directly or indirectly by someone who has suffered from the disease of addiction in its many forms – whether it is from drugs and alcohol, gambling, or shopping.  Those of us who have experienced firsthand the devastating effects on our families and communities know and understand how critical it is for our loved ones to have a haven where women and men feel safe, nurtured and supported and where the process of healing and recovery can begin. 

In order to successfully provide treatment for substance abuse clients, Verdun House and Marina House, projects of The Substance Abuse Foundation Inc., need funding to effectively manage their operations and provide treatment for clients and their families who are in need.

Energy and utility costs are a significant contributor to our operation expenses.  Research has shown that the use of solar energy can greatly offset costs associated with electricity. Given our location in Barbados, this is the most appropriate energy type to harness because of the record days of sunlight that the island enjoys.

We have therefore started a campaign to raise USD30,000 to finalize the purchase and installation of solar panels at Verdun House, our male residential drug treatment facility.

 

The Solar Photovoltaic (PV) Rooftop Project: Quick Facts

  • Estimated size of solar PV panels that can be accommodated on existing buildings – 502
  • Use of current building's roof space and so generate as much electricity as possible without exceeding BLPC capacity limits (based on the main breakersize)
  • Projected total capacity of all PV systems – 159.6 kW
  • Anticipated total amount of electricity to be generated per annum – 246.594 kWh
  • Annual revenue stream projected to be approximately BBD$102,583
  • The overall project involves the purchase of 502 panels at an estimated cost of BBD$1,000 per panel
  • Payback based on preferred vendor – 5.2 years

 

Cost of Project

The purchase and installation of the solar PV panels will account for a significant portion of this project. It is scheduled to completed by December 2017, with a total estimated cost of approximately BBD502,000, based on pricing of BBD1,000 per panel. USD30,000 (BBD60,000) raised from this campaign will ensure we can complete the project.

 

The Impact of Renewable Energy Project

SAFI already demonstrates best practice standards in support of environmental programmes. This project builds on this track record of leadership and innovation, and helps contribute to Barbados’ national target of being fossil-free by 2030. This investment will help us reduce our operating expenditure, enhance our ongoing “greening” initiative, fund critical programmes, and provide even more work opportunities for our clients.

 

The Solar PV Rooftop Project will help us make a difference in several ways:

  • Doing our part to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and protecting our country, region and the world for future generations
  • Actively participating in contributing to national development goals – one of which is transition to affordable and clean energy
  • Reducing the expensive cost of electricity bills to make available more funds to support critical rehabilitation, therapeutic and family programmes, as well as education and skills training
  • Earning revenue to improve our ability to treat more individuals and their families
  • Providing clients with the opportunity to participate in skills training in the emerging sector of renewable energy. This increases their chances of gaining employment and providing for their families.

 

Our Ask

Every gift counts. Your contribution and investment will go a long way in further promoting substance abuse treatment and changing the lives of men, women and their families. Please help us make our communities, our country and our world healthier and safer for all.

 

Resources

The Substance Abuse Foundation Inc.TheSAFinc.com Home: thesafinc.com/

The Substance Abuse Foundation Inc. - Business Barbados: businessbarbados.com/trending/the-substance-abuse-foundation-inc/

Verdun House - Home | Facebook

https://www.facebook.com/Verdunhouse/

National Sustainable Energy Policy [Revised]

www.energy.gov.bb/web/component/docman/doc_down...

Our Story 
There are very few of us that have not been touched directly or indirectly by someone who has suffered from the disease of addiction in its many forms – whether it is from drugs and alcohol, gambling, or shopping.  Those of us who have experienced firsthand the devastating effects on our families and communities know and understand how critical it is for our loved ones to have a haven where women and men feel safe, nurtured and supported and where the process of healing and recovery can begin. 
In order to successfully provide treatment for substance abuse clients, Verdun House and Marina House, projects of The Substance Abuse Foundation Inc., need funding to effectively manage their operations and provide treatment for clients and their families who are in need.
Energy and utility costs are a significant contributor to our operation expenses.  Research has shown that the use of solar energy can greatly offset costs associated with electricity. Given our location in Barbados, this is the most appropriate energy type to harness because of the record days of sunlight that the island enjoys.

story:
All the way from 2016 our team has been bringing the steamroom, or how it is more commonly known, the banya, to Black Rock citizens. The masters of steam in our camp facilitate in creating the mistery of encountering the deepest of ourselves, cleaning the dust of everyday life and opening up the emotions and hidden knowledge.

The 2018 is the I,Robot year of Burning Man. Indeed, contemporary life makes us less humane and blurs the knowledge of life. To re-learn what it really means to be human, is what we work on in the Art of Steam.

Banya is more of a spiritual restoration rather than just a physical one. It is about unity with the nature, both inside and outside. It is like coming home, finally. Both from the psychological and physical points of view, banya goes out of the bounds of being regular, as it affects one on all: body, emotions and mind.

Burning Man is the great place to discover the eternal future for all; here is where we share the ancient novelty of this guided practice of acceptance and revival with everyone. This is the reason we bring our banya to BRC each single year.

From the onset of the camp in 2016 more than 1700 people have visited our banya. And for many it was the pinnacle of transformation - as much as it was for us.

 

This is a lot. But in 2018 we want to take it even broader and deeper. We want to make our ritual even more mystical, we want it to be even more beautiful as this year our ceremonies will take place at the sunrise in the deep playa. We want to come to different camps and collaborate with the healers' teams of the BRC. We wish to create emergent patterns of healing and awe. We need to move around! In order to achieve this, we decided to make an Art Car banya, to be here for many years to come.

Our art car will consist of a steaming room, a lounge and a car.

Both the car and steamroom are built to symbolize a crystalline rock.

We decided to call our banya "The amethyst", as the beauty of this rock has given us so much inspiration. James Larkin, one of the most amazing organic architects of our time, came up with the concept once having a stone in his hand, and it became what you see now. Even though it doesn’t look remarkable from the outside, an incredible beauty, clarity and wisdom are all hidden beneath the shell. The only way to understand it all is to go inside.

The alchemy of steamroom now will play together with the elusive geometry of the Black Rock City and playa. Isn't it amazing? You can help make it happen in reality.

___

Without your support, this emergent beauty has no chance to arise and shine for years and years to come. We need you, brothers and sisters of the Playa alchemy.

story:
Summary

Hi, I'm Josh Bochniak. I have been a rock climber, program coordinator and outdoor and experiential educator for nearly 20 years. I have worked with thousands of individuals and groups in that time, and I have seen that challenging, non-competitive and experiential activities like rock climbing can bring people together and help people develop in a number of ways. It teaches lifelong fitness, self-confidence, personal resilience through skill mastery, and problem solving in a non-traditional fitness setting. Scrapyard Climbing Collective will provide a space to do this in a supportive and engaging social environment. Your contributions will help make this dream a reality. Your generosity will provide a place for kids to build confidence and get away from screens. You will enable adults to find connection in an engaging new way. And you will support the creation of a diverse community of individuals, bonded by the reality that shared experience brings us together.

The Details

I have funding through personal finances to get this all started, but not enough to fully expand the facility. The climbing gym as it is now does not meet the needs of the community we envision. We need taller, roped climbing walls to engage a wider variety of people, walls that are more beginner friendly and provide better teaching opportunities. We are asking for $30,000 to expand what the space offers.

That funding will be used for:

  • Building new climbing walls
  • Installing top ropes and auto belay stations
  • Installing new climbing safety flooring
  • Buying more climbing holds to fill the new walls
  • Buying furniture to create a comfortable seating area for all visitors

In return, you can choose from a variety of perks. Beyond the satisfaction of helping make this dream come true, we have memberships, apparel, and experiences at the ready. You’ll also have the option of giving these opportunities to someone else through sponsorship.

The Impact

As highlighted above, Scrapyard Climbing Collective will be a place that fosters personal and group development in a variety of ways. And in a world where many of our social interactions are dominated by technology, rock climbing also provides an activity that invites participants to put down screens and phones and be present. Climbing teaches responsibility for direct attention to others to keep others safe. In addition to creating a welcoming community, we seek to provide a place that offers this direct connection. And for the many children and families in Holland who cannot afford to try climbing, we are seeking ways to provide access without a high price tag. We think climbing and outdoor recreation should not only be for those who can afford it. If you are in Holland, then this place will be yours if you choose to join us. If you are far away, then your contribution is valuable as a mark of your support of this vision.

Risks & Challenges

We have an exciting and challenging road ahead of us. Implementing programs and building membership will be a daily effort. Our greatest risk is overestimating the market capacity for this place. As the only facility within 40 minutes, we believe the Holland community will support a gym our size. The main challenge will be getting the word out about it and drawing people in. 

I may be the owner, but I am fortunate to have a group of passionate individuals who are invested in the success of this vision. Together, our team has experience in program coordination, community engagement, marketing and communication, and a variety of other skills to help us make this endeavor a success. With your support, we will be able to bring this vision to the Holland community.

Other Ways You Can Help

We would love your contribution but know that not everyone can help financially. If you're not able to contribute but are excited about our vision, please help us make some noise about Scrapyard Climbing Collective. Share this on social media, with friends, family, co-workers. Come visit the facility and see what it's all about!!

Thank you for considering this opportunity. Climb On!

story:
Dating Yourself: Finding Self Love Before True Love is about finding self-happiness before entering a serious relationship. The biggest investment that we will make in our lives is the partner with whom we choose to share our lives. By further discovering ourselves and what makes us truly happy, we can then have an easier chance of finding a person that makes us happy.

My name is Matthew Henry and I am the author of Dating Yourself: Finding Self-Love Before True Love. I wrote this book because after I wrote my first book on Bipartisanship in American Politics, I realized that communication was not a political problem but a people problem. After many discussions with close friends, I noticed a pattern in how a lack of communication was also impacting the way we date. I want to show people that they can date people that are healthy for them but first they need to look at their own happiness first.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover self-love will make you a better person, friend, and romantic partner in the long run. Sometimes our worst enemy can be ourselves. We need to get rid of negative talk and re-program our minds to think more positive. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for self-love in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you continue building yourself while also finding the right people to surround yourself with.

In this book, you'll learn about

*Understanding your emotional infrastructure, further understanding your needs in a partner by looking at yourself

*Managing those moments of depression through empathy and self-discipline

*Finding out what you truly want in a partner, and what red flags to avoid in the future.

You will love this book if you are a fan of authors like Shawn Anchor, author of the Happiness Advantage, and Daniel Pink, author of Drive.

The Book - Dating Yourself: Finding Self-Love Before True Love


The book is written in Four Parts:

Part I is titled How We Got Here. This portion takes a look back at Dating before the age of social media and dating apps. We will briefly look at the history of dating and the effectiveness of Dating apps.

Part II is titled Principles of Self-Lovers. This portion is about introducing different concepts that can help empower you. You will soon discover that dating is not so much about finding the right person, instead it’s more so about finding the type of person you want to become.

Part III is titled How to Date Yourself. This portion of the book is about managing your own happiness by avoiding the pitfalls of depression and anxiety. Looking after yourself first is crucial before entering the dating world. Not only are you investing your time in another person, but they are also taking time to invest in you!

Part IV is titled How to Date Others. This last portion of the book takes a look at real-life relationships and looking at what people have learned about themselves through their relationships. The most highlighted chapter in this section is “How to Avoid Red Flags.” No matter their age or education level, every person that I’ve interviewed mentioned the importance of finding those red flags in the beginning and the consequences of not doing so.

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer


When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book NOW:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author

Matthew Henry is a TEDx speaker, published author, and a recent graduate of Georgetown University. Meeting and connecting with people has become a passion for Matthew. Last year he wrote his first book titled Working Together: Why We Need Bipartisanship in American Politics.

He learned that the problem in politics was not political but more so about understanding people. This need to further understand the human connection inspired Matthew to write a book about dating in the digital age. He is by no means an expert in dating and probably needs advice of his own, but Matthew is simply curious on ways in which men and women can better connect. The thesis for his book is that you will be much happier in a long-term relationship if you focus on your own self-happiness first.

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #loveyourself hashtag tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Matthew Henry

story:
I live in NYC and lost my job of 30 years one morning in April with no warning. Two weeks later my dog Josie went into heart failure and I almost lost her. The hospital and cardiologist was able to get her stabilized and she has been doing really well...until a few days ago where she had a bit of a set back. I need to go back to her cardiologist for an EKG, blood work and chest x-rays asap and I need to pay for her monthly medical bills ($300-400) as she has other issues as well. I do not currently have a job although I am working on that every waking moment. When I went to borrow from my 401K I found out you can only take a loan out when you are working! She is my baby and an incredibly special soul. She brings joy to all who cross her path. I never had any children and I love like family and love her heart and soul. I would be deeply grateful for any help. I've spent years giving to charities and helping animals in any way I can. Now I need help and I am asking you...

What can I offer you in exchange? I am a singer and I would give you an mp3 of either an original song or a cover of a song that I recorded. 

If you can't contribute then please share, I would appreciate it.

Thank you..in.love.and.gratitude...

Minx
story_txt:
I live in NYC and lost my job of 30 years one morning in April with no warning. Two weeks later my dog Josie went into heart failure and I almost lost her. The hospital and cardiologist was able to get her stabilized and she has been doing really well...until a few days ago where she had a bit of a set back. I need to go back to her cardiologist for an EKG, blood work and chest x-rays asap and I need to pay for her monthly medical bills ($300-400) as she has other issues as well. I do not currently have a job although I am working on that every waking moment. When I went to borrow from my 401K I found out you can only take a loan out when you are working! She is my baby and an incredibly special soul. She brings joy to all who cross her path. I never had any children and I love like family and love her heart and soul. I would be deeply grateful for any help. I've spent years giving to charities and helping animals in any way I can. Now I need help and I am asking you...
What can I offer you in exchange? I am a singer and I would give you an mp3 of either an original song or a cover of a song that I recorded.

Thank you..in.love.and.gratitude...

story:
Who we are!

Hey, thank you for clicking on our page! We are four students at the University of Tennessee, Knoxville who all have a big heart for serving others. We are currently enrolled in an english class that takes a hands on approach to raising money for a non-profit organization.

 

Our Purpose!

Millions of Americans go to bed hungry every night. In fact in the state of Tennessee, one in six people are food insecure. Food Insecurity is defined as someone who does not know where their next meal will come from. In Knoxville, food insecurity is not just prevalent; it is an epidemic. This widespread misfortune leaves people on the streets and in desperation to survive.  The organization we are advocating for, The Love Kitchen, is trying to change this one meal at a time. The Love Kitchen is a non-profit organization working to fight hunger right in our own community of Knoxville, Tennessee. Love Kitchen not only alleviates people’s hunger but also provides a place of comfort, support, and belonging. We are determined to try to raise money for this non-profit to be able to provide more meals to those in need. With your help we can create a domino effect to work towards turning the one in six food insecure, to one in a million. 

 

About The Love Kitchen!

The Love Kitchen is a non-profit located in Knoxville, TN. Began in 1986, where it started serving people outside of a small church. Has grown so big it now is located a little ways down into its own building. Started by Helen and Ellen, twin sisters,  they ran off the ideals of their father. The sisters created what started out very small to an important non-profit for the community. The Love Kitchen provides opportunities to lots of people from delivering food to the homebound to letting people from off the streets eat on Wednesdays. All the people who work at The Love Kitchen is un-paid and all volunteers.

 

 

We need your help!

We cannot eliminate food insecurity in Knoxville on our own. That is where you come in! The Love Kitchen is doing amazing work, but they cannot continue to operate without your donations. It is our dream that one day the Love Kitchen will never have to turn anyone who walks through their doors away hungry. All of the proceeds we receive will directly go to operation costs The Love Kitchen incurs. With your help, no man, woman, or child has to go to bed hungry. Let's team up to make this happen!

 

Other Ways You Can Help!

Donations aren't the only way for you to contribute. The Love Kitchen always is looking for volunteers to help. This can be from a variety of objectives but most importantly is going to serve food to others.

For more information about volunteering visit the this link: https://thelovekitchen.org/volunteer/ 

 

What is in it for you!

We believe any donation no matter how small, can help abolish hunger in the Knoxville area. To go along with the joy you will feel from donating to a good cause, we are also offering four different perk packages in order for us to thank you for your generosity.

Love, 

Cale, Kian, Brittany, and Mallory

 

Works Cited 

“Home Page.” The Love Kitchen, 27 June 2019, https://thelovekitchen.org/

“Tennessee.” Feeding America, www.feedingamerica.org/hunger-in-america/tennessee.

“World Hunger, Poverty Facts, Statistics 2018.” World Hunger News, www.worldhunger.org/world-hunger-and-poverty-fa....
