story:
ISLAMIC SOCIETY OF DENTON ( ISD ) 1105 Greenlee, Denton, Texas 76201

 

                   www.dentonmosque.com

 

The FIRST MASJID BUILD in TEXAS (established August - 1981)

ISD is a 501 (c) (3) Non-profit organization; Tax exempt ID: 75-1706138

Full-Time Imam: Mohammed Fouad Hefny

The Islamic Society of Denton (ISD) is a non-profit religious organization founded to serve the greater Denton area community. ISD is dedicated towards worship and education services according to Islamic faith principles, based on the Quran and the authentic sayings and traditions of Prophet Mohammad, peace be upon him. The Masjid was built by residents of Denton, which included students attending both the University of North Texas and Texas Woman’s University. Through hard work and generous donations the Islamic Society of Denton opened in August of 1981 making it the FIRST Masjid built in the State of Texas. The ISD is not affiliated with any private, public or other political organizations. Since the inception of the ISD Masjid the Dallas/Fort Worth/Denton metroplex area has rapidly grown to become one of the largest metro areas in the USA. This growth has attracted many Muslim families and students to the City of Denton. These and other factors have caused severe space restrictions for our growing community. We have already purchased the land for the future expansion and the architectural plans are complete. We ask for your participation and support.

Why we urgently need to expand our Masjid:

1. We do not have enough room to accommodate all the Brothers and Sisters that come for Friday (Jumaah) prayer.

2. The weekend Islamic School does not have adequate space for students. The children’s classes are being held in masjid’s prayer areas and only office; at least four classes are being held in the largest prayer hall at one time.

3. We have been unable to hold the two EID festivals at our Masjid due to space restrictions. The celebrations are instead being held at the Denton parks and recreation facilities.

4. Denton County has rapidly grown to over a million people and the City of Denton is projected to be over 120,000 people by 2011. This gives us many more people that could be directly served by the expanded facility.

5. The Islamic Society of Denton is a historic masjid because it is the First masjid built in Texas.

DONATE AND BUILD YOUR FUTURE: "The likeness of those who spend their wealth in the way of Allah, is as the likeness of a grain (of corn); it grows seven ears, and each ear has a hundred grains. Allah gives manifold increase to whom He pleases. And Allah is All-Sufficient for His creatures’ needs, All-Knower" (Surah Al-Baqarah; 2:161)

 

Mail donations to: Islamic Society of Denton

                                          P.O. Box 3084

                                          Denton, Texas 76202-3084

                           Email: isd1105@gmail.com

 Donate Securely online with PayPal at: www.dentonmosque.com

story:
Nourishing Acres

We are bringing life back to this land. Nourishing Acres will be the first medicinal herb farm in the upper Midwest with an organic certification in mind for our long term goal. This small farm surrounded by woods with beautiful Linden trees overlooking the property, significant because Linden trees are a "symbol of love, prosperity, friendship, peace, justice, altruism, and good luck. They're also popular in traditions due to the positive aspects IE; healing trees, protective trees, trees that are keeping away the diseases". This space will become a permaculture style farm for medicinal herbs. While the few medicinal herb farms in the country tend to use traditional row crops as harvest is generally much easier, we have a different idea.

This farm is a community space to get back to our roots and connect to herbalism and tradition. We aren't aiming for widescale production and distribution. We will be growing to serve our community and bring life back to the soil, the air, the water. Keeping the biodiversity up, focusing on medicinal natives, and of course always giving back to the land. This farms destiny is to bridge the gap between traditional and modern approaches to wellness, both in children and adults. Even just from working with dried herbs to fresh as the season allows. To get folks involved in herbalism and seeing where and how these wonderful plants grow. You can tell a lot about a plants medicinal properties by how it grows. Does it love wet soil? Is it mucilaginous? Getting the communities hands in the soil and creating something bigger than ourselves. To have hands on workshops about use and preparations after harvesting the herbs ourselves. Seeing, smelling, tasting, feeling.  To sit under the stars in the summer, in front of a fire with music and fireflies dancing around us. To take community plant identification walks and open the world of plant ID and foraging. A whole language just waiting to be learned and explored in this community.


Herbs aside, we plan to have a community space and stage in the back left corner for music (music is medicine!) As well as a fire pit. Next to that will be the waldorf playspace for children. A space for open ended imaginative play in nature. Fully equipped with an organic UPick tea garden. On the other side of the property tucked in the back right corner we hope will be a Yurt for the outdoor school to utilize. Next to that, the animals. We have goats, chickens and bunnies (and eventually 2 Llamas :) )!  In between all of it, throughout several acres will be a magical permaculture herb farm with wandering paths full of magic, including a small trail into the woods for a quick step into another world. On the left side of the property is a small creek. We plan to grow an elderberry forest on the other side of this creek, as there are several established plants in place as it is. They seem to love the conditions over there. This is all of course after we bring life back to this soil. While it hasn't been farmed for at least 5 years if not more, it certainly needs some love. We will be working with nature and not against it to bring locally grown healing plants to our community. We plan to use permaculture methods to reduce pests and disease as well. We already have quite a few bats, and in the area that the bats reside, the mosquito population is significantly less! We have a couple bat houses to put up in other areas of the property too. The barn will be utilized as a drying space for herbs as well as a space for workshops and we hope to find the perfect person to do a mural on the back over looking the farm.


Our plans are on going, and huge and exciting! For this community space to come to life we need help. This is a HUGE undertaking. I know it will be worth it, but I hope you can join us on this journey! We are setting up this crowd funding site to help with some of the bigger overwhelming bits. The yurt for the full time outdoor school and potential workshops, and some equipment we are desperately needing (a tractor). Things are coming together and we are so excited!! Our donation goal will be set out through September. We will have a celebratory event upon the crowd funding closing and have you all out to the farm to check out the progress and to see the site! We hope to have a band playing and some food trucks. While, we obviously won't have anything planted yet, you will be able to really see how the land is healing and how the community is coming together!

story:
Overview

 

Unlike professional caregivers,  family caregivers often hold down jobs and are raising their own young families while simultaneously trying to support their aging loved ones.

This can come at great sacrifice for the family caregiver. 

 

 

 

Caregivers Connect's Mission is Simple :

Care for the Caregiver

 

 

 

 

An Unique Highway to Caregiving

Summary of Services

Care Buddies:

Hands on helpers, available to assist with loved ones, run errands and be an extended support system for the family.

Care Counselors: 

Professionals to guide and assist caregivers as they discover options and create care plans for themselves + loved ones.

Caregiving Wellness App & Website:

An interactive experience where caregivers can connect to each other, care buddies, counselors, resources, trainings, and more.

Training:

Workshops and courses led by  medical and certified wellness experts to help caregivers strengthen their skills.

Free Resources, Guides, and Customized Research:

Free guides, resources, and customized research through our VIP membership.

Support Groups:

In person meetups, online chats, and support groups regularly hosted in the New York City area, as well as online.

 

How We Want To Say Thank You (PERKS!)

 

Caregiver Assessment ($30)

Are you a natural born caregiver? Give $30 and receive the trademarked and patented Caregiver Compass assessment* which reveals your true caregiving skills. Take yourself or give to someone else.

Assessment is delivered directly to your email inbox, along with instructions. 

*Delivery: This perk will be delivered within 1 month of order.

Care Journals ($20-$35)

Take notes, create to-do lists and everything in between with this softcover 72-page blank journal. Features the Caregivers Connect heart in hand logo. We also have a 72-page Interactive Family Journal*, filled with writing prompts and questions for you to ask your family. This is a great way to bond with relatives and capture memories in a unique way.

*Delivery: Orders for journals will be facilitated 30 days after campaign ends

 

Care Packages for the Caregiver ($45-75)

Show someone you care with a unique care package! The Caregiver Care Package is filled with artisanal goods, features indie brands and fun functional items to brighten anyone's day. Packages* may include items such as:

  • Candles
  • Perfume
  • Bath Soak
  • Artisanal Tea
  • Handcrafted soap
  • Stationary

*Delivery & Details: Please note that content of packages vary and may not contain items shown in picture. Please review perk card for additional details. Packages will be delivered up to 30 days after order.

 

One Year VIP Caregivers Connect Membership ($200)

Enjoy full access to all resources, guides, and trainings exclusive to members through our website + app. VIP Membership* includes full access to network of care-buddies, as well as a free Caregiver Assessment through Caregiver Compass.

*Delivery: You will receive notification of membership 60 days after campaign officially ends and can access site once it launches.

 

If We Don't Reach Our Goal

If our initial funding goal is not reached during this campaign we plan to use funds to complete the Caregivers Connect Wellness app + website so caregivers can begin accessing resources and offerings.

 

Risks & Challenges

Gaining enough financial support to successfully reach our target audience.

Team

Our team is made up of individuals with decades worth of experience in caregiving, marketing, and social entrepreneurship ventures.  Our support network is a mighty one and includes Not-for-Profit board members, pastors,  and top tier Fortune 500 companies. Now that we're ready to launch, all efforts are being focused toward outreach and marketing.

OTHER WAYS TO SUPPORT

 

To learn more about us, what we do and how to support, please visit caregiversconnect.co.

Special Thanks:

Everyone from the Caregivers Connect team would like to thank those who helped to make this campaign possible. We'd like to especially thank:

Marisa Gershenhorn - Film maker/animator

Martha Levytsky- Voice actor

Ethan Keeley- Voice actor

story:
Short Summary

Democrats sure diddily didn't do so great in this most recent election, but that's okay! I'm sure President Trump will be reasonable!

...

And I'm sure if he's not, Republicans will stand up to him when he does Racist Bullshit.

...

https://tinyurl.com/RepMuslimBanResponse

...

Alright, we're fucked and we need our Democratic Leaders to step up and prove to Progressives and the American People that they'll stand up to Trump and obstruct a fascist agenda. Since we're stuck with our current Democratic Senators for two years, maybe this campaign can buy them some spines so they won't get primary'd in their next election cycle and replaced with Progressives who will stop playing nice and start concerning themselves with defeating an anti-women, anti-worker, anti-POC, anti-LGBTQ Republican agenda. 

What We Need & What You Get

Vertebrae replacement costs $45k. I just googled it, so I'm asking for that much. But if no Democratic Senators want to volunteer for vertebrae replacement, I'll give all the money from this campaign to the ACLU (who kicked ass this past weekend fighting the Muslim Ban Executive Order).

In return, you'll get the peace of mind of knowing that you're at least TRYING to stop the Trump agenda. 

How else can you help?

  • https://www.indivisibleguide.com/

Start here. This is a guide written by former Congressional Staffers that tells you how to employ Tea Party tactics to make Congress listen to your concerns. 

  • Call your Senators and Representatives Every. Single. Damn. Day.

2 GOP Senators are now voting against Education Secretary Betsy DeVos due to a high volume of calls from their constituents. One easy way to call your Senators is to go to  https://5calls.org/

  • Is your Senator's voicemail full because they're human garbage?

You can still annoy them using a fax machine! Yes, those still exist, and they can't get filled up! AND YOU CAN SEND THEM FREE ON THE INTERNET https://faxzero.com/

  • Show up to protests in your local city!

More bodies on the ground can help sway public opinion and keep pressure on lawmakers to have your voice heard. Plus, Congress scares easily: http://time.com/4635551/mike-coffman-aca-obamac...

  • Support Journalism!

The New York Times is not failing, but in a time of Alternative Facts, we need to rely on investigative journalism to get the job done and deliver the real stories because there's no way we can trust this douche nozzle: https://www.good.is/articles/sean-spicer-tweet

Subscribe to your local newspaper or the NYT or the Washington Post and stay informed from reliable sources. And distrust all Facebook Memes. 

  • November 6, 2018 -- Midterm Elections

This is where we can actually get pay back. Democrat turnout is NOTORIOUSLY low when there isn't a Presidential Election and it's crucial that you and 10 of your friends all go to the polls together and kick some Republicans out of Congress. If you live in a safe Blue district, go to https://swingleft.org/ to help out in your nearest Swing District. 

  • Don't. Stop. Fighting.

The Trump White House is intentionally trying to exhaust and confuse the public. Chaos is their friend because with it, they can get you to tune out and do whatever the hell they want. They want to wear you down. Don't let them. Don't give an inch. It will be exhausting to be outraged for 4 years, but vigilance is the only way to stop fascism. Vigilance, and Democratic Senators with spines.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Democrats sure diddily didn't do so great in this most recent election, but that's okay! I'm sure President Trump will be reasonable!
...
And I'm sure if he's not, Republicans will stand up to him when he does Racist Bullshit.
...
https://tinyurl.com/RepMuslimBanResponse
...
Alright, we're fucked and we need our Democratic Leaders to step up and prove to Progressives and the American People that they'll stand up to Trump and obstruct a fascist agenda. Since we're stuck with our current Democratic Senators for two years, maybe this campaign can buy them some spines so they won't get primary'd in their next election cycle and replaced with Progressives who will stop playing nice and start concerning themselves with defeating an anti-women, anti-worker, anti-POC, anti-LGBTQ Republican agenda. 

What We Need & What You Get
Vertebrae replacement costs $45k. I just googled it, so I'm asking for that much. But if no Democratic Senators want to volunteer for vertebrae replacement, I'll give all the money from this campaign to the ACLU (who kicked ass this past weekend fighting the Muslim Ban Executive Order).
In return, you'll get the peace of mind of knowing that you're at least TRYING to stop the Trump agenda. 

How else can you help?

story:
"We're not giving money for a baby, we're giving money for hope."

To be honest, I’ve been resistant to this notion for a while. Freezing seemed like a silly idea! “If it’s supposed to happen, it will happen” is what I would tell myself. My friends weren’t quite satisfied with that resolve however. They knew the weight that each year brought for me…although I don’t feel 41, the reality is that my eggs don’t have a choice to feel any other way except 41. They are who they are and feeling a certain way about them won’t change their age.

So I started exploring the notion of freezing my eggs. “This is crazy!” I thought. How the heck did I get here? This is not how I dreamed my life to be at 41…I expected to be married with a couple of kids by now. But I’m not. So I went to a fertility clinic and found out that while I still have some good eggs, time is running out. The money it costs though is crazy! So I sat on it for a second.

I sat and I sat and I sat. The amount of money to freeze overwhelmed me.

And that’s where I sat for a while.

Then I answered this question – if I had the money today, would I freeze tomorrow? And the answer was yes. Absolutely. No questions asked. I mean, what a gift it is for women to be able to birth children! The fact that we can give life to another human is such an extraordinary privilege! And I want to know the full extent of my humanity and have the opportunity to love my own child! Come on!

But the money! What the heck! THE MONEY.

I’m fortunate to have incredible friends who swept in, helping me process the whole thing. I finally came to the conclusion that I MUST DO THIS. My friends offered to throw a party to fund-raise as much as possible. I was reluctant. What if I don’t want to be so open about it? What if, for some reason, it doesn’t result in a baby? What if it makes people feel weird? But these words from a dear friend broke me in the most beautiful way - "Rachel, we're not giving money for a baby, we're giving money for hope. That's what you stand for, for us." Eventually, I accepted their offer. And so, the fundraising has beggun (as have the puns)!

I’d sure love to be married at some point, but I’d love the opportunity to do so without pressure. I don’t just want to marry someone so I can have kids – I’d rather allow space for us to find one another when the time is right, and then we can create something beautiful together at that point. More options and less pressure.

Here's the $ facts:

Egg Freezing is comprised of three basic components...

1) Professional Fees (physician fees, labs, ultrasounds and cycle management) $4900

2) Surgery Center (facility and Anesthesia services) $1000

3) Reproductive Center Fees (embryology lab services, anesthesia) $1800

Plus storage for 3 years: $1650

TOTAL: $9,350

THANK YOU IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR SUPPORT! LOVE YOU ALL!

story:
We are so excited to move into our new yoga space. It is on the 2nd floor in the same building, directly under our current space. There is more light and it is a bigger space with high ceilings. We will be installing Aerial Yoga Hammocks and introducing 4-5 classes a week to begin. This won't be changing the class schedule much. If it does, subscribe to our e-mail list through our website to receive updates. Our new yoga space needs some work before we move in. We need to install a new floor, order and hang hammocks, paint, decorate, and more. We will be in the new space on December 1st. We gratefully ask your help in this transition...

The benefits of Aerial Yoga Hammocks:

- Total body workout: Due to the nature of aerial yoga movements, almost all the body parts are forced to move and stretch. Muscles are toned and redefined, and joints are regenerated and strengthened due to these movements.

- Psychologically beneficial: Just like almost any other workout, aerial yoga helps rebuild your emotional system because it clears the mind and relieves stress due to its meditative state. It also helps you combat stress throughout the day and increases your creativity, which leads you to develop your own artistic skills.

- Improves flexibility: Aerial yoga helps you to move more freely, with less effort, by counteracting gravity. Suspension in the air releases tension on the bones and muscles, increasing flexibility and deepening your practice. Suspended yoga strengthens core muscles and increases spinal and shoulder flexibility.

- Heals back problems: It gives you the chance to hang freely, allowing your spine to lengthen. With less strain on your back while doing the exercises, it eases tension in the spinal cord and hip joint, helping you feel better.

- Increases strength: Aerial yoga improves strength and flexibility, which carries over into other daily activities. The core workout is a beneficial cross-training, as it helps runners increase stamina and be able recover faster.

- Puts you in a great mood: Another key benefit of doing aerial yoga is that it gets your adrenaline going while going against gravity. It also releases “happy” hormones like serotonin, endorphins, oxytocin, dopamine, which boost your mood and help you feel more energetic.
Improves balance: While going against gravity can be exciting, aerial yoga also helps with balance and stability in daily activities. Balance is a key component in daily activities, and aerial yoga helps maintain a good balance both inside and out.
Aids digestion: The different types of stretches and movements help improve the digestive system, thus helping in healing various digestion-related issues, including constipation and indigestion.

- Old age and heart disease: Aerial yoga improves the circulation of blood, thus combating aging and its symptoms. Aerial yoga also helps detoxify the circulatory and lymphatic systems, which lowers the onset of various cardiovascular issues.

- Improves memory: Aerial yoga fortifies your neural connections, thereby, rendering better memory power. In a way, practicing aerial yoga can make you smarter!

story:
Greetings!

My name is Yudo Robert Yorga and I am the founder of a zen community in Minneapolis, Minn.

The zen community is called Orchids and Bones. I chose orchids and bones because they epitomize the qualities we are trying to manifest in ourselves, grace, beauty, gentleness, strength, and structure. 

I began formal practice in 2007 with my first sesshin or week-long retreat. In 2009 I met my zen teacher, Junpo Denis Kelly and I immediately saw the value of his teachings. Emphasizing the importance of awareness training so that we truly understand the information buried beneath the surface noise of our emotions. We are able to transform ourselves and our relationships by meeting each moment with increased clarity and understanding. 

I have been working with these teachings for about four years now and want to bring this to my hometown of Minneapolis. I established Orchids & Bones in February of 2013; we meet weekly for meditation and discussion. A number of people have suggested a more intensive period of meditation and this brings us to the zazenkai or day-long meditation retreat.

The Campaign

To host a day-long retreat I need about five more sets of cushions or zafus/zabutons and an inkin or bell to begin and end zazen or a meditation period. I have bought a few sets of cushions already and I would like to get more as our community is getting larger. 

So this is what I will spend the funds on....

  • 5 sets of zafus/zabutons
  • An inkin bell
  • If I raise an additional $1500.00 we will be able to buy a big bell for morning service
  • If I raise a lot more than $2500.00 I will be able to buy more cushions, more instruments, and also do more outreach.

What you get for your money

  • You will know that you are helping a super worthy cause by increasing awareness and emotional maturity in people's lives.
  • There are some nice thanks you's over in the column on the right.
  • You will be directly helping of a day-long retreat happen on March 22nd.
  • You will be helping the long-term ability of this group to help others

Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can share this campaign with your friends who you think might want to help, thanks!

More info on Mondo Facilitation here, and my life coaching here.

More info on Hollow Bones here, and my community here.

story:
We need your help to build a comfortable place, in which people can also relax and talk to each other after practice or any activity.

Appart from the initial rent fee, we will need to get some tatami, mats, tv, sound equipment and install a shower if necessary.

みんなさんのサポートが必要です、練習やアクティビティの後でリラックスしてお互い話せて快適な場所を作りたいと思います。
最初の賃貸料の他に、畳、マット、テレビ、音響機器など、必要があります。
ご協力お願いします ?‍♂️

Join us! Already in the group:

Instructor aikido fourth dan

and experience teaching kids English and communication skills for more than 10 years

小学校で10年間英語を指導しました

story:
10 Natural was founded in 2010 in Antigua, Guatemala by Ben Richard, who has lived and worked in Central America as a Peace Corps volunteer, teacher and naturalist for 15 years. 
He continuously works with various non-profit organizations and Macadamia farmers offering technical assistance to isolated  Maya communities planting tens of thousands of trees  to restore the natural environment, develop a sustainable food source, and create a future source of income to enhance their economic base.
From these experiences he learned how amazingly beneficial Macadamia Oil is for our skin and hair.  He was inspired to create 10 Natural Pure Macadamia Cosmetic Products.

​​Geriatric Casa Maria opened on September 1, 1995, on Broad Street in La Antigua, Guatemala. Initially it was established as a company, but they encountered the harsh reality that most people who need services like those offered by Geriatric Casa Maria, are poor people and often do not have family to care for them.  That revealed the great demand in Antigua, Guatemala and across the country for homes with special care for elderly people, especially for people without financial resources.  

Since 1998 Asociacion Geriatrica Casa Maria has operated as a private, nonprofit civil association, comprehensive development, and apolitical. Moving forward for this home has been a constant strugle.  Thinking about the welfare of all people living here and all the people who still need this service.

 

 

10 Natural conducted a study on the benefits of Macadamia oil, treating skin problems in older adults at Geriatric Casa Maria with excellent results after just one week of use.

Because they are older adults who were abandoned and have no way to survive we realized the great need they have.

Thus the idea of this campaign!

With your help we hope to provide Skin Cream, Macadamia Oil and Lip Balm to all the elderly at Geriatric Casa Maria  for one year.

Macadamia is native to the East Coast rainforests  of Australia.  These sweet, crunchy nuts grow in abundance in tropical and subtropical Australia, Hawaii, Central America, Brazil and South African regions .

 

 

 Benefits of Macadamia Cream and Oil

  • Macadamia Oil has been shown to slow the signs of aging.  It has also been used to improve the appearance of scars, sunburn and other minor skin irritations.
  • It restores Palmitoleic Acid (Omega 7) levels in our skin which decline with age, contributing to the appearance of fine lines, wrinkles and weathered skin.  It is also an active anti-microbial found naturally in youthful skin.
  • The Linoleic Acid (Omega 6) in Macadamia Oil helps to restore the skin’s barrier function and reduce water loss.
  • These fatty acids also have anti-inflammatory properties.
  • It’s high in monounsaturated fatty acids, including Oleic Acid (Omega 9) that moisturize, regenerate and soften the skin.
  • Macadamia Oil absorbs immediately without feeling greasy.

 

                                                  

 

 

 Our Goal

 
  • Our goal is $ 5000, to supply for 1 year all the needs of Skin Cream, Macadamia Oil and Lip Balm, for all elderly in Casa Maria. 
  • We match every dollar that you donate $1 for $1 
 What you Get

$1 to $25 -  10 Natural will match your donation for the cause.

Select a $30 Perk and receive a bottle of Macadamia Oil and a code for 20% discount on all 10 Natural Macadamia products.   Also, we will match $1 for $1 for every dollar of your Perk.

Select a $50  Perk and receive an Oil, a Lip Balm, free shipping and a code for 20% discount on all 10 Natural Macadamia products. Also, we will match $1 for $1 for every dollar of your Perk.

Select a $100 Perk, which will provide 3 months supply of Macadamia Cream, Oil and Lip Balm for two elders.  We will deliver to you your own package of 10 Natural products  valued at more than$60 USD. And, 10 Natural will donate $100 USD for the cause.

 

Other ways you can help 

  • Donate any amount you are able and we will match every dollar of your donation.
  • Please help us spread the word, share on Facebook and Indiegogo, so that more people can collaborate and to reach our goal.
  • Go to the page of www.10natural.com and purchase our products 
  • Enter www.casamaria.com to see what else you can do.
 
FAQ
 
Q: What happens if we don’t reach our goals?
A: If we are unable to raise the funds, 10 Natural will distribute the amount donated so that all elders receive the benifit even though it can not cover the full year.
 
Q: What happens if we surpass our goals?
A: If we surpass our goal for all the elders of Casa Maria, we have identified two more centers, Hogar Fray Rodrigo and Cabecitas de Algodon, expanding the campaign to other nursing homes that have the same needs.
 

Q: When will you receive your Perks for your donations?

A: Our expectation is that we will have the Perks fulfilled within two weeks of your donation.

Please help us spread the word, share on Facebook and Indiegogo, so that more people can collaborate and to reach our goal.
Go to the page of www.10natural.com and purchase our products 
Enter www.casamaria.com to see what else you can do.

 
FAQ
 
Q: What happens if we don’t reach our goals?
A: If we are unable to raise the funds, 10 Natural will distribute the amount donated so that all elders receive the benifit even though it can not cover the full year.
 
Q: What happens if we surpass our goals?
A: If we surpass our goal for all the elders of Casa Maria, we have identified two more centers, Hogar Fray Rodrigo and Cabecitas de Algodon, expanding the campaign to other nursing homes that have the same needs.
 

Q: When will you receive your Perks for your donations?
A: Our expectation is that we will have the Perks fulfilled within two weeks of your donation.

story:
Namaste,

My name is Swami Rudra Das. I am the chef for Kashi Ashram. Thank you for taking some time to learn about a pivotal moment for our kitchen.

Our next major stepping stone is to purchase a buffet serving table with temperature controls and breath guards. One table costs $18,000, and eventually we will need four of these. This campaign focuses on buying one serving table, and 100% of the money collected will go towards this.This custom-made unit will enable self service from both sides and will keep our food both hot and protected. This is a big deal ! It will elevate our standards and move Kashi forward now and well into the future. It will help Kashi welcome and feed more people!

My Guru, Ma Jaya Sati Bhagavati, lived and breathed serving humanity. She shared her Baba’s teaching to “Feed Everyone”. My heart and soul is to serve and feed people in Ma’s and Baba’s name. There is so much joy in cooking and feeding people. I love our dining room full, the food line going out the door, and everyone eating and enjoying themselves. Our “Prasad Program” feeds seniors, families, and children in need. Everyone who walks through our doors is always fed, whether they can pay or not.

Perks!

We have some awesome perks for you!  You will experience the uniqueness of Kashi, whether it be sponsoring an ancient puja that has been handed down for thousands of years, coming to our Kashi Sunday Market and enjoying a delicious, organic and nutritious meal, or one that touches my heart so deeply:  sponsoring a family from the Prasad Program for dinners and market lunches. This perk will feed this family 10 meals a month for 1 month. (We serve dinners Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights).  We are also able to offer an orginal piece of Ma's art.  Ma's art is so deeply spiritual and prolific. There are many series to choose from to find what resonates with your soul. And coming to Kashi for a weekend for a personal retreat will undoubtedly help you to restore and replenish.

Impact

Our Prasad Program feeds healthy, nutritious, organic meals to food-insecure individuals and families three nights weekly in a community atmosphere among people from all walks of life. We have many veterans, those in recovery, seniors, women's empowerment groups, yoga students, spiritual seekers and many local people  coming through our doors on a regular basis.  We want to take care of them all to the best of our ability.

Kashi is a beacon of light in these crazy, uncertain times offering an oasis for every heart. We are Interfaith and embrace all people, no matter their sexual orientation, race or religion. All are welcome. Ma would say that Kashi is a vacation from hate.  

Our last Indiegogo campaign was a success! So many upgrades were made to the kitchen, dining room, serving room and Welcome Center! Thank YOU! Our goal and main focus is   how can we accommodate and welcome more people. We just received a new walk-in cooler thanks to a grant from the Sebastian Clambake Foundation and many generous donors. We have so much gratitude for these necessary changes that will help us expand to feed everyone.

Challenges

 If we do not reach our goal, the money donated will go towards getting the serving buffet as planned. We need the funds to carry out the projects that will help Kashi to expand and efficiently serve all who step through her doors. Because we are a non-profit,  part of our existence depends on donations. Fundraising is an important part in capital campaigns to reach our goal, and your donations help make that possible! The serving buffet is a necessary improvement and will enable us to welcome and feed more people.

Please Share Our Campaign! Please share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and just plain word of mouth! Indiegogo has very convenient share tools. Sharing with just 10 people would really help our campaign get off the ground!  We would be so grateful!

Thank you from the bottom of my heart,

Love, your Swami Rudra Kali Das

 

This is a similar version of the serving buffet I would like for Kashi.

story:
Chronic illness doesn't have to be a life sentence

A recent study [1] specifically found that just eight hours of mindfulness meditation down regulates (dampens) HDAC and COX2 genes – meaning that mindfulness is an antihistamine and a mast cell stabiliser [2] as well as a prostaglandin inhibitor [3]. 

After 30 years of severe chronic illness, much of it experienced while covering conflicts for CNN and the BBC, in March of this year I was finally diagnosed with an inflammatory condition called mast cell activation syndrome/disorder (initial diagnosis was histamine intolerance). Because mast cells are a key component of the immune system and are found in every organ, symptoms number in the dozens and span every bodily function. The most serious of these symptoms is anaphylactic shock, which, unlike in allergies, is not to any one thing, but rather hundreds of potential triggers, including stress, heat (even a hairdryer!), foods and sex. Yup, you heard right! 

In the last two years I have managed to completely turn my health around, without any medication. An incredible feat for me, having been on at least two meds daily (and up to 8) for most of my life. Diet and nutrition took me as far as I could get, but something was missing. And so I began meditating for the first time in years. The power of meditation on my health is so strong that it even helped me when I went into anaphylactic shock in Kenya this year. No doctors or meds were available, and so I did what I could, and lived to tell the tale. 

I’ve been practicing mindfulness/meditation in general on and off since the age of 18, but this time it stuck. I think it did because I truly committed to it and  finally understood the science behind it, namely that:

Meditation is an antihistamine and a mast cell stabilizer, precisely the two things we are supposed to take a number of meds for, as well as a prostaglandin inhibitor, more meds. It’s so powerful that it brought me back from the brink when I went into anaphylactic shock and had no meds on me. Meditation actually changes the way our genes express. How about that for an epigentic boost!

While I’ve known for some time now that yoga lowers inflammation and yogic pranayama breathing fights asthma by lowering histamine [4], I was nonetheless incredibly excited to hear something specifically linked to my condition.

What works for me generally applies to others with my condition, as well as a related rare condition called mastocytosis, as well (I believe) as fibromylagia, ME, and other chronic inflammatory conditions with mast cell involvement. 

I plan to run 8 week virtual/online mindfulness meditation workshops of 2hrs, once a week, for those who are not well enough to travel. As these cluster of conditions are triggered by altitude and changes in pressure, flying is out of the question for many, while others are simply bed bound or unable to expose themselves to the outdoors where even pollen can be fatal. I know it sounds outlandish but please google the condition and you'll see I'm not exaggerating. 

The sessions will be live, with a recording available for those who miss it. There'll be a Q&A at the end of the session. I mean for this to be a highly interactive experience for us all. The course I'm developing will be highly adapted to our situation (mindfulness at the dinner table, in the kitchen, in the supermarket) and I plan to make a number of mp3s available for download as a bonus. 

As with the cookbooks I sell on my site, I plan to allot a certain number of "seats" to people unable to fund their meditation, as well as offering discounts to those on limited incomes. 

The Nitty Gritty

I need to raise $2,800 to attend a one week mindfulness meditation course here in the UK:

http://zenways.org/yoga-events.html#3rd%20January%206pm%20-%206th%20January,%202pm;%202014

The perk I'm offering is $75 for a space on my 8 week virtual mindfulness retreat. This course will be priced at $150 for the course in the future. 

If I'm unable to raise the full needed funds for the course I'll do a less expensive but less conveniently timed online course (same hours as the other course but over 10 weeks instead of 1), which means I'll be unable to begin teaching courses till May of 2014. The course I'm hoping to book will allow me to begin teaching on Feb 2nd and has the added bonus of being affiliated with Oxford University. 

I’m not the only one experiencing an incredible remission – check out New York Times reporter Donna Jackson Nakazawa's own experiences in coming back from paralysis.

Thank you!

------------REFERENCES----------

[1] http://www.news.wisc.edu/22370, http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/18805511

[2] http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/21605904

[3] http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/18805511

[4] http://thelowhistaminechef.com/yogic-pranayama-breathing-lowers-histamine/

story:
My ancestry is the Dakota people of the Minnesota territories who were displaced from our homelands in 1863 as a result of an "uprising" in 1862. I believe "act of resistance" more accurately depicts the desperate response to the impact of colonization. Experiencing land theft, cultural genocide, racism, corruption, starvation, the people openly resisted colonization in the short-lived Dakota War of 1862. A military commission conducted trials sentencing 303 Dakota men to death. President Lincoln pardoned all but 38 and on Dec. 26 1862 the 38 Dakota warriors were hanged with a single pull of the lever in the largest mass execution to date in United States history.

Dakota 38 is a memorial ride of healing and reconciliation to honour our ancestors, to bring peaceful rest to their spirits, and healing resolution to all peoples affected generationally by this traumatic time in our collective history. This is a ceremonial ride for the healing of all people.

Displacement trauma is transgenerational. Spirit world does not exist within the confines of linear time. For them, what happened in our yesterday is happening to them now. Trauma imprints in the blue print of the soul. Generationally that trauma is passed on because the blue print holds the pattern of the trauma. If you build a house with a design flaw in the blue print it will manifest in the construction, perhaps as a leaky roof. The repair needs to be made to the Original Cause of the leaky roof - the design flaw in the blue print. If the blue print is not corrected you can build a hundred homes with expert craftsmanship and quality materials and all of them will have leaky roofs. Trauma to the soul of a Nation produces the same result in the people.

I have seen my ancestral grandmother in a black and white image, standing on the road where they marched the people off their traditional lands as punishment for the "uprising". She did not speak English. She was confused. Her point of orientation - her people, her land, her culture, had been eradicated and her spirit could not reconcile the circumstance she found herself in. Forced into exile, her way of life erased, incomprehensible grief, loss and heartache her spirit fractured and her body walked on without her. Her fragmented spirit remains trapped on the road in timeless despair. I cannot abandon her there. I have to pick her up, wrap her in a blanket, and ride her home.

This is a spiritual pilgrimage to return the lost souls of the traumatized Dakota peoples, my ancestry, and heal the hole in my own heart and soul that bears the pain of displacement and transgenerational trauma. This is a healing for a Nation of people that transcends the physical limitations of trauma recovery.

Jim Miller (watch the documentary) had a dream. I too had a dream. My grandmother gave me a dream of my people so that I would know my roots and understand why my own life has manifested repeat displacement trauma. I met Jim and Alberta last year at Sundance. Jim gave me a copy of Dakota 38. It took me 3 hours to watch this 78 min. film. I kept pressing 'pause' to process the incredible intensity of emotional despair and the answer to my dream. For the first time in 51 years I discovered where I come from. I found Home.

I am a crisis counselor for violence against women, social activist, and advocate for First Peoples issues. Working for a non-profit organization means my salary is also "not for profit" ;-) ... which means I am unable to fund this pilgrimage myself. Those who know me would affirm that I am an altruistic humanitarian who does more than her share of supporting vulnerable people. I need to make it to this year's Dakota 38 memorial ride so that I may bring my people home. I need funds to cover my travel, accommodation, and what I see as my responsibility for contributing to the feeding, sheltering, and trailering of the horses for it is the sacred sunkawakan (horses) that ride us home.

Thank you for your contribution to healing and reconciliation. All people involved in this ceremonial ride have their own stories and reasons for being there. It is a collective effort of the heart to bring truth and healing. Support is offered in many ways; through the riders, friends, family and spouses of the riders, the horses, the communities that house and feed us, the hotels that reduce their rates, the media who validates the ride through coverage, the good deeds and acts of kindness along the ride, donations, prayers, even those who from afar watch the documentary contribute to the spiritual integrity of Reconciliation - and I thank you for that.

In the spirit of healing and reconciliation,

"Wopila"

Okute ~ the Dreamer

story: ​

SHORT STORY

Our goal is to create a lipstick  that is nourishing, uses only clean, non-toxic, organic and natural ingredients, but most importantly empowers women.  We want women to choose a color that fits their mood and style for the day---we call it Our Armor!

Sarah and Leah are sisters and founders of SaltyGirl Boutique, a beauty boutique selling brands that believe and make clean, non toxic products.  Our dream has always been to launch our own natural cosmetic line!  We started out on this journey when Sarah was diagnosed with stage 3, triple negative breast cancer at 36 years old when 32 weeks pregnant with her second child.  Leah, an Oncology Nurse by day started doing a lot of research on WHY and HOW this could have happened and the ingredients we put both in our bodies and on our bodies kept coming up. Hence why we decided to focus on clean, natural ingredients in products that make us feel beautiful both inside and out!

Our lipstick is 3 fold:  Provide a truly natural nourishing lipstick that EMPOWERS and adds to your BEAUTY and a % of every lipstick gives back to cancer patients.

ABOUT OUR LIPSTICK

All Natural • Gluten Free • Paraben Free • Made with Organic Oils and Natural Waxes • Pure Minerals • Natural High UV Protection Factor • Moisturizes and smoothes the lips • Brilliant Colors 

Our Colors:

Each color has been named after a woman who has had significant influence in our lives.  We believe these women embody our core values of our SaltyGirl Brand: Sass, Strength, Smarts, Kindness and Empowerment!

Lipstick Name: Color: Empowering Traits of this color

Rosa:  Pink:  Loving, Bubbly, Energetic: She is beautiful

Mae:  Coral:  Daring, Optimistic, Confident: She is beautiful

Jean:  Nude:  Thoughtful, Honest, Proper: She is beautiful

Kate:  Rose:  Warm, Smart, Soulful: She is beautiful

Emelia:  Red:  Diva, Flirty, Sexy: She is beautiful

Connie:  Pink/Peach:  Fiery, Fierce, Lively: She is beautiful

Krissy:  Plum:  Strong, Sassy and Bold: She is beautiful

Anna: Pinky/Mauve: Free Spirit, Positive and Curious:  She is beautiful

Ingredient: 

Ingredients: *Ricans Communis (Castor) Seed Oil, *Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Oil, *Copernicia Cerifera (Carnauba) Wax, **Glycerin, Euphorbia Cerifera (Candelilla) Wax, *Theobroma Cacao (Cocoa) Seed Butter, Mango Butter (Mangifera Indica), *Simmondsia Chinensis (Jojoba) Seed Oil, *Persea Gratissima (Avocado), Theobroma Grandiflorum (Cupuacu) Butter, Tocopherol (Vitamin E), *VItis Vinifera (Grape) Seed Oil, *Vanilla Planifolia, *Origanum Vulgare (Oregano) Leaf Extract, Thymus Vulgaris (Thyme) Extract,  *Cinnamomum Zeylancum (Cinnamon) Bark, *Rosmarinus Officinalis (Rosemary) Leaf Extract, Lavandula Angustifolia (Lavender) Flower Extract, *Hydrastis Canadensis (Goldenseal) Root Extract,  May Contain: Mica, Titanium Dioxide (Ci 77891), Iron Oxide (Ci 77491, 77492 77499)  *Certified Organic 

WHAT WE NEED and HOW WE WILL USE THE FUNDS

  • We are asking for $10,000 invest in marketing and branding.
    • Tradeshow Registrations
    • Collateral: Tradeshow materials
    • Marketing and PR
    • Samples

REWARDS

  • Thank you: $15: A thank you mention in our newsletter
  • 1 Lipstick: $30--Your choice of 1 SaltyGirl Lip color
  • 2 Lipstick: $60 Your choice of 2 SaltyGirl Lip colors
  • Bronze: $100: 2 SaltyGirl Lip Colors, StaySalty T-shirt in an exclusive color combo: Red and White Lettering (note different than photo)
  • Silver: $250 Everything in Bronze plus a custom STAYSALTY necklace by Becoming Jewelry (see necklace in photo below---written on bar will be STAYSALTY)
  • Gold: $500 Everything in Silver plus SaltyGirl Boutique Gift card and 2 tickets to Foundation4Love event June 3rd
  • Ultimate: $1000: Everything in Silver but 3 lipstick choices, SaltyGirl Boutique Gift card and 4 tickets to Foundation4Love event June 3rd.

**Foundation4Love event is an annual Fundraiser event.  Tickets include Farm to Table dinner, drinks, and incredible gift bags.  Event includes raffles, Speaker Cynthia Besteman, Founder of Violets are Blue and Breast Cancer Survivor talking about clean beauty!  June 3, 2017 at Toroso Restaurant: Kennebunk, ME

THE IMPACT

  • YOU DECIDE OUR FUTURE:  We have heard from so many people we have met over this last year.  We want to continue to provide excellent customer service, amazing education and now our own products made with the clean nourishing ingredients!
  • BIGGER THAN A PRODUCT:  SaltyGirl Lips is bigger than a natural lipstick.  We are here to empower women to be who they want to be, to express how they are feeling and to go out and be the strong, sassy, and sexy women they are!
  • HELPING CANCER PATIENTS: The SaltyGirl brand gives back a % of all profits back to our non-profit Foundation4Love which in turn gives back to those going through cancer treatment.  Often while going through treatment we can get consumed by our cancer diagnosis.  Through Foundation4Love we give back Spa Days, Dinner out, sporting events….whatever allows the cancer patient to disconnect from cancer and connect with loved ones.  We will continue giving back with every lipstick sold.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can't contribute financially, you can still make a big difference and here's how:

  • EDUCATION:  Learn more about the ingredients that are in your skincare, body care and cosmetics!  Remember it is just as important what we put on our bodies as it is what we put in our bodies!
  • CONNECT WITH US! Click on the icons to the top right of your screen and find us on Facebook and Twitter, and swing by our website to learn more. Also, find us on Instagram @saltygirlboutique
  • SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN! use the following link (https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/saltygirl-li...) and share on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc! We want everyone to wear clean beautiful cosmetics and feel empowered.  We also want every woman and man going through cancer to be given the opportunity to disconnect from cancer and connect to love!   Please tag us/use our hashtag if you post on social media so we can send some love: @saltygirlboutique , #SaltyGirllips #GiveBackBeauty 

Again, thank you for believing in and contributing to us!
story_txt:
SHORT STORYOur goal is to create a lipstick  that is nourishing, uses only clean, non-toxic, organic and natural ingredients, but most importantly empowers women.  We want women to choose a color that fits their mood and style for the day---we call it Our Armor!Sarah and Leah are sisters and founders of SaltyGirl Boutique, a beauty boutique selling brands that believe and make clean, non toxic products.  Our dream has always been to launch our own natural cosmetic line!  We started out on this journey when Sarah was diagnosed with stage 3, triple negative breast cancer at 36 years old when 32 weeks pregnant with her second child.  Leah, an Oncology Nurse by day started doing a lot of research on WHY and HOW this could have happened and the ingredients we put both in our bodies and on our bodies kept coming up. Hence why we decided to focus on clean, natural ingredients in products that make us feel beautiful both inside and out!Our lipstick is 3 fold:  Provide a truly natural nourishing lipstick that EMPOWERS and adds to your BEAUTY and a % of every lipstick gives back to cancer patients.ABOUT OUR LIPSTICKAll Natural • Gluten Free • Paraben Free • Made with Organic Oils and Natural Waxes • Pure Minerals • Natural High UV Protection Factor • Moisturizes and smoothes the lips • Brilliant Colors Our Colors:Each color has been named after a woman who has had significant influence in our lives.  We believe these women embody our core values of our SaltyGirl Brand: Sass, Strength, Smarts, Kindness and Empowerment!Lipstick Name: Color: Empowering Traits of this colorRosa:  Pink:  Loving, Bubbly, Energetic: She is beautifulMae:  Coral:  Daring, Optimistic, Confident: She is beautifulJean:  Nude:  Thoughtful, Honest, Proper: She is beautifulKate:  Rose:  Warm, Smart, Soulful: She is beautifulEmelia:  Red:  Diva, Flirty, Sexy: She is beautifulConnie:  Pink/Peach:  Fiery, Fierce, Lively: She is beautifulKrissy:  Plum:  Strong, Sassy and Bold: She is beautifulAnna: Pinky/Mauve: Free Spirit, Positive and Curious:  She is beautifulIngredient: Ingredients: *Ricans Communis (Castor) Seed Oil, *Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Oil, *Copernicia Cerifera (Carnauba) Wax, **Glycerin, Euphorbia Cerifera (Candelilla) Wax, *Theobroma Cacao (Cocoa) Seed Butter, Mango Butter (Mangifera Indica), *Simmondsia Chinensis (Jojoba) Seed Oil, *Persea Gratissima (Avocado), Theobroma Grandiflorum (Cupuacu) Butter, Tocopherol (Vitamin E), *VItis Vinifera (Grape) Seed Oil, *Vanilla Planifolia, *Origanum Vulgare (Oregano) Leaf Extract, Thymus Vulgaris (Thyme) Extract,  *Cinnamomum Zeylancum (Cinnamon) Bark, *Rosmarinus Officinalis (Rosemary) Leaf Extract, Lavandula Angustifolia (Lavender) Flower Extract, *Hydrastis Canadensis (Goldenseal) Root Extract,  May Contain: Mica, Titanium Dioxide (Ci 77891), Iron Oxide (Ci 77491, 77492 77499)  *Certified Organic WHAT WE NEED and HOW WE WILL USE THE FUNDS We are asking for $10,000 invest in marketing and branding.
Tradeshow Registrations
Collateral: Tradeshow materials
Marketing and PR
Samples

REWARDS
Thank you: $15: A thank you mention in our newsletter
1 Lipstick: $30--Your choice of 1 SaltyGirl Lip color
2 Lipstick: $60 Your choice of 2 SaltyGirl Lip colors
Bronze: $100: 2 SaltyGirl Lip Colors, StaySalty T-shirt in an exclusive color combo: Red and White Lettering (note different than photo)
Silver: $250 Everything in Bronze plus a custom STAYSALTY necklace by Becoming Jewelry (see necklace in photo below---written on bar will be STAYSALTY)
Gold: $500 Everything in Silver plus SaltyGirl Boutique Gift card and 2 tickets to Foundation4Love event June 3rd
Ultimate: $1000: Everything in Silver but 3 lipstick choices, SaltyGirl Boutique Gift card and 4 tickets to Foundation4Love event June 3rd.
**Foundation4Love event is an annual Fundraiser event.  Tickets include Farm to Table dinner, drinks, and incredible gift bags.  Event includes raffles, Speaker Cynthia Besteman, Founder of Violets are Blue and Breast Cancer Survivor talking about clean beauty!  June 3, 2017 at Toroso Restaurant: Kennebunk, METHE IMPACT
YOU DECIDE OUR FUTURE:  We have heard from so many people we have met over this last year.  We want to continue to provide excellent customer service, amazing education and now our own products made with the clean nourishing ingredients!
BIGGER THAN A PRODUCT:  SaltyGirl Lips is bigger than a natural lipstick.  We are here to empower women to be who they want to be, to express how they are feeling and to go out and be the strong, sassy, and sexy women they are!
HELPING CANCER PATIENTS: The SaltyGirl brand gives back a % of all profits back to our non-profit Foundation4Love which in turn gives back to those going through cancer treatment.  Often while going through treatment we can get consumed by our cancer diagnosis.  Through Foundation4Love we give back Spa Days, Dinner out, sporting events….whatever allows the cancer patient to disconnect from cancer and connect with loved ones.  We will continue giving back with every lipstick sold.
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELPIf you can't contribute financially, you can still make a big difference and here's how:

EDUCATION:  Learn more about the ingredients that are in your skincare, body care and cosmetics!  Remember it is just as important what we put on our bodies as it is what we put in our bodies!

CONNECT WITH US! Click on the icons to the top right of your screen and find us on Facebook and Twitter, and swing by our website to learn more. Also, find us on Instagram @saltygirlboutique

SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN! use the following link (https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/saltygirl-li...) and share on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc! We want everyone to wear clean beautiful cosmetics and feel empowered.  We also want every woman and man going through cancer to be given the opportunity to disconnect from cancer and connect to love!   Please tag us/use our hashtag if you post on social media so we can send some love: @saltygirlboutique , #SaltyGirllips #GiveBackBeauty 

Again, thank you for believing in and contributing to us!

story:
Red Grail Spiritual Retreat Center Indiegogo Fundraising Campaign

http://igg.me/at/redgrailspiritualretreatcenter

For 21 years, the Order of the Red Grail has served the Pagan community with open Full Moon Circles and Sabbats, rites of passage, spiritual counseling, education and prison ministry that has spanned 17 years. Public service includes donations to area food bank, domestic abuse shelters, military soldier support, and clergy presence at hospitals and police departments with the belief that positive examples and actions by local pagans will makes a strong statement to mainstream faith groups that while practices and beliefs are different, service to humanity is universal.  

This work is established and stable. However, progressing into the 21st century requires taking the next step – bridging differences by strengthening spiritual community among life-affirming pagans and non-pagans alike.

To this end, The Grail intends to create the Red Grail Spiritual Retreat Center where spiritual community reigns over religious differences. The Grail intends to obtain 5 or more acres of woodland to define this sacred space. The Center will initially include a barn that will be available for rituals, classes, feasts, weddings, and other community functions. As the property is developed, there will be space for children and families to learn about nature and the cycles of life, a stone labyrinth, community garden, wild preserve, and additional features as space and funds allow.

The main goal is to provide a stable setting where many can safely worship, celebrate and find peace. We invite you to join in this journey. You can help by:

  • Giving to this campaign http://igg.me/at/redgrailspiritualretreatcenter
  • Sending an e-mail to anyone you know who you think will want to help too
  • Using Indiegogo share tools to share about this campaign on Facebook and Twitter
  • Writing or blogging about us with the link to this campaign

For more information, please visit Orderoftheredgrail.org

The Order of the Red Grail: Church of Transformational Wicca, ATC, is a 501(c)(3) non-profit church located in and serving the Nebraska area since 1993.

Thank you!

story:
***Update***
Thank you so much for your interest in supporting Battlefield Addiction! 
We didn’t gain the momentum we had hoped for in the first week of this campaign and the feedback we received was clear that there was much confusion. So to help with clarity and cohesion, we have moved things directly to our website, where are followers are used to getting information from us and we hope this will allow for a smoother campaign and communication. 

You can find all the updated information at BattlefieldAddiction.com/wegotyou

 

Thank You So Much!

 

Who we are and What we do:

Battlefield Addiction is a team of recovered addicts, community and family members working together to fill the gaps that currently exist in the treatment/recovery world.  We work powerfully with and through family members who have a loved one struggling with addiction. We work in partnership with treatment centers, Intensive outpatient programs and sober living facilities that support our Family First approach.

“When Battlefield Addiction says ‘We Got You’, they mean it.


They were there for every step and continue to be there to coach us as we learn to live in the moment and reconnect with our son”  -Kristin and Monty

 

 

 

100% of funds goes directly to supporting Our Mission: “Reconnecting the Family, The Addict, and The Community” and supports the expansion of our Family-First Approach program.

Our areas of greatest need include:

• Scholarship funds for the families who need it most, to help with the cost for treatment, sober living, and other expenses necessary for recovery.

• Keeping Battlefield Coffee House open and continuing to build our internship program for young people in recovery and increasing our reach into the Community.

We are a 501c3 and all donations are tax deductible! 

 

The official "We Got You" Jersey 

Every year we have the Battlefield Addiction Supporters asking if they can buy the jersey if they don't run. 

The answer has always been "NO"

Until Now! 

 

"We Got You" Supporter Shirt 

Show your support by sportin' your very own shirt!

 

"No Bullsh*t Hugs" Shirt

Tell the world that you won't tolerate sub-par hugs! 

 

 

 

 

 

“I finally reached out to Angie from Battlefield Addiction. She responded quickly and helped me find a detox facility. She also spent the day coaching me on what to say to my son. 6 hours later I was dropping him off at a detox center.”

Malinda and Josh

“They seemed to know our story better than we knew it. They had been down this road before and nothing we said was a surprise. Having someone who understood what we were dealing with and who was able to guide us out of the mess, made all the difference in the world”

Chris and Lori

After working with Battlefield Addiction my life is so much more enjoyable. My understanding of addiction and the general way people interact in life has changed. We sought out help for our son who was struggling with addiction, but they ended up helping all of us change our lives for the better.

Kris and Melissa

 

Follow and Share Battlefield Addiction Facebook and Instagram accounts.

Do you know a family struggling with Addiction?

We can help, please refer them to battlefieldaddiction.com

story:
Hug Cards For Autism

There is a group of wonderful people, brought together by one act of love, making a child with autism smile! I am building this to help my friend Dana in order to keep her wonderful dream going. She has been working out of her own pocket and now that more and more kids are getting "Hug Cards", finances are getting pretty tight!

Stamps, Cards & Stickers are not free and we would love any support you can give. 

The Impact

Getting a "Hug Card" is a great inspiration to these kids. The smiles are worth so much more then you could imagine. 

Like & Visit Them On Facebook: www.facebook.com/groups/danashugcards

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share this and make a difference, twiter, facebook, google, youtube & indegogo.

story:
WE CAN DO THIS!!!

Breast Cancer has touched nearly everyone's life in one way or another.  Either directly, or through a mother, an aunt, a sister, a friend, or another loved one.  Many of us have gone to doctor's appointments, treatments, or cared for a loved one during their treatment praying for a full recovery... 

But what happens when a woman has a mastectomy and needs access to a bra shop to purchase breast prostheses and bras? If she lives north of the Alderwood Mall in Lynnwood, Washington, the choices are limited or nonexistent and she will likely need to travel a significant distant for this service. More importantly, there is no bra shop north of the mall that can directly bill Medicare or Medicaid. Since the closure of Virginia's Feminine Boutique in May 2012, breast cancer survivors have had no option but to order these products online without the option of a proper fitting or travel elsewhere for this needed service. Citrine Health's new program, The Bra Shop, is determined to change that-- regardless of a woman's ability to pay!

The Bra Shop will contract with insurance companies, allowing women to access prostheses and bras without having to pay out-of-pocket. All post mastectomy women need some type of prosthesis and bra, even if they choose to have reconstructive surgery later. The average cost for a breast prosthesis is $230 and related bra is $60. Many women can’t afford the cost of these items and rely on insurance and/or Medicare or Medicaid.  This service is crucial-- Finding the right breast prosthesis and proper fitting bra can be an important step for many breast cancer survivors to begin healing and feel whole again.

This campaign will help toward raising the $75,000 start up costs needed for The Bra Shop including inventory, hardware, computer software, personnel and training.

If The Bra Shop is not funded, breast cancer survivors will continue to drive great distances to purchase a basic item...  At an already difficult point in their lives, many women will be stretched financially or incur debt to purchase a bra and prosthesis. Many will not be able to get one at all.

I hope you will consider donating to this much needed service for low-income breast cancer patients and all gifts are tax deductible as Citrine Health is a 501(c)3, non-profit agency.  We can do this!!!

story:
Smile On Me is here to awaken every girl to her inner greatness and empower her to disrupt the status quo and change the world. We are a growing community of like-minded people who believe that maintaining a healthy mind, body, and community is key to a joyful life, and we aim to share our experience to lift up the next generation. 

We celebrate girls.

​

Since our 2017 launch, we've collected more than 1,000 feminine hygiene products, facilitated workshops focused on personal hygiene, leadership, and self-esteem, and have distributed bags filled with hygiene products to hundreds of girls in low-income communities throughout New York City!

Smile On Me: Summit is designed to build girls’ self-esteem, create a safe and welcoming space for her to feel connected with others, and promote mental and physical health and well being. Our aim is to ultimately host a day where girls can be their authentic selves and discover something new. We will gather middle school-aged girls from all five boroughs of New York City and lead them through workshops based on topics like emotional, physical, and mental health, and self-care.

Contribute to our campaign today and smile on all New York City girls! Your generosity will help fund our second annual Smile On Me: Summit and help us continue to provide girls throughout the city with the essential products and educational resources needed to adequately prepare them for puberty and beyond.

Follow us on Instagram @smileonmehq and join in on the conversation. To find out more, subscribe to our e-newsletter and stay up to date with all things Smile On Me!

Website: www.smileonme.org

Instagram: www.instagram.com/smileonmehq

Facebook: www.facebook.com/smileonmehq
