wisdom mixed with the innovation of modern times. They are highly effective and
don’t normally fit into regular wellness centers or yoga studios. By giving
these modalities a physical space, we make more space for them in the world and
amplify their healing and transformational reach. By creating this Temple we
are exemplifying a new paradigm that supports alternative healers and shamanic
practices and integrates them into daily life.
         As
a Holistic Professional and a Practicing Mystic, I offer a wide variety of
teachings and healing modalities, including yoga, holistic nutrition, tantric
energy healing, spiritual counseling and shamanic dance. With my wide range of
offerings and my shamanic style I found I often don’t totally fit in to
traditional yoga studios and wellness centers. This produces a problem for me
and other metaphysical teachers and healers. It is hard to find spaces to host
our events and sessions, and our community and our practices are fragmented
because we don’t have a well-fitting space to hold them. I created The Urban
Temple for people like me: metaphysical healers, teachers, ritualists and
seekers who want to create more space for their work in the world and share,
heal, connect and grow.
         I
have held a long time dream and vision of creating alternative healing centers
and temples all over the world. Three years ago I ran a community and ritual
center out of my house in Oakland for one year, called Mystic Activation
Temple. It was amazing to see how many people showed up for our events and
classes. There is such a need for spaces to gather in this way. The past three
years since then have been rich in education and experience for me, and now The
Urban Temple is the next incarnation of my visions manifesting.
         These
modalities and experiences we will offer at The Urban Temple are incredibly
transformational for the participants and the world. We feel strongly that true
planetary healing begins within, and the more we evolve ourselves, the more our
world will shift to reflect our inner peace and harmony. Modalities Offered:- Kundalini Tantra Dance-Theta Healing-Tantric Energy Healing- Reiki- Spiritual Counseling- Holistic Nutrition- Sound Healing- Zegg Forum- Imagination Healing Circle- Shamanic Journey- Meditation-Yoga- Kundalini Yoga- Educational and Empowerment WorkshopsPlus:- Community Rituals- Women's Circles- Art Shows- Local Artisan and Crystal Store (Coming Soon!)- Community Clinic (Donation Based Healing) (Coming Soon!)...and so much more!!!
Meet Our
Team:
Elaena Flow is a Shamanic and Holistic Healer,
Counselor and Facilitator. With a BA in Sociology and multiple Holistic and
Shamanic trainings and certifications, she has become a powerful and passionate
community builder and healer. She has traveled the depths and wide range of
human experience and has found that to create a healthy and inspired society we
need more deep connection, more access to alternative healing, more
non-dogmatic ritual and more consistent, supportive community. Through creating
The Urban Temple she is synthesizing her sociological and holistic findings
into one space to contribute to the birth of a healthier, happier and more
inspired culture. 
Katerina
Kan is a loving light worker, shining through as a Reiki II practitioner,
psychic medium, Tantrika, dancer and artist. Her healing practice, known as
Mercury Reiki, is an energy balancing modality inviting guidance from
ancestors, angelic guardians and universal consciousness during a Reiki
session. After 5 years of living in Berkeley and studying design at the Academy
of Art University, Katerina has become Space Director here at The Urban Temple.
She believes that every act of love has a Divine ripple effect across the web
of life, and is dedicated to creating a sacred space that will be a container
for healing, expression, growth and creativity. She looks forward to welcoming everyone to the Urban Temple.Our Needs and Your Gifts

We have created a lot already, yet to really make our space
feel like a temple and a sanctuary for healing we’ll need a few things.
Everything we currently have has been free or donated, and we plan to continue
to use re-claimed and donated materials as much as possible and build and sew
for ourselves when we can. The main things we need are:
Flooring!
The current floor in the space is a rough industrial carpet. This is suitable for yoga and community meetings, but it’s too rough for dancing or easy cleaning. We want to acquire Zebra Mats, which are movable interlocking floor pieces. They have the look of a wood floor, the feel of a dance studio, and are easy to clean. Instead of removing the carpeting and installing new hardwood floors, the Zebra Mats faux-floor will cover the entire interior carpet.We also plan to acquire soft rugs to cover the floor, allowing the space to easily convert between a dance studio, a classroom and a gathering ground.Lighting!
The overhead lighting is a generic, harsh fluorescent lighting suspended from our high ceilings. We’ve been using our own softer light fixtures, and never turn on the main lighting. We believe proper lighting is a very important aspect of creating a healing space where people feel comfortable. We want to remove the fluorescent strips and install a large chandelier or similar fixture, which will be refurbished or from a local artist. We’ll get smaller lights for low lighting.
Sound Blocking Curtains!Mystic Doorway is located on busy Telegraph Ave. This is great for accessibility, but we also get a fair amount of street noise in the space. It is important for us to buffer the sound that comes through the main windows, upper ventilation windows and doorway. We have planned a great way to make soundproof curtains by using two rolls of rubber MLV material, each sized at 25’ x 4’, in combination with heavy fabrics. The MLV is the type of rubber used in professional stage curtains, and we will sew the fabric around it to create large, heavy-duty curtains. Shelves, Cubbies & Storage!The space is a blank canvas – it is a large open rectangle with high ceilings and a restroom. We need to build a storage closet, create a reception area and build cubbies for people to store their belongings.Yoga Mats and Props, Pillows, Chairs!We need yoga mats and props for 10 students, 20 pillows for floor seating and chairs for participants who would prefer not to sit on the ground.Temple Décor and Supplies!We hope to deepen the integrity of the space with beautiful fabrics, art plants, large crystals and a water fountain. Our space already has some beautiful items in it thank you to the thoughtful gifts and donations from the community. Décor will be final portion of our spending budget.Website, Graphic Design, Advertising Materials!We’re proud to have our website up and running, but we will need assistance with branding and advertising. We’ll be working with a graphic designer to create a beautiful logo and color scheme for our center. We will also need a budget for advertising our space and offerings to the community. With your help, we can give this gift to all the right people!Indiegogo Tax, Processing Tax & Gift Shipping Costs!Total: $12,800
Our Gifts to You
We have some incredible and creative gifts
to offer our contributors!
Including: 
Altar Boxes - We are offering three sizes of
altar boxes. These will be compiled by the founding Goddesses of The Urban Temple, and each box will be unique. We are offering a travel altar box, a
medium and a large box. Each box will have candles, crystals, sage or palo
santo, altar cloths and orgonite. The bigger boxes will have more and some
added bonuses!! This was Aleksandra’s idea, and she is super excited to head up
the altar box making!
Orgonite - We are incredibly blessed to offer
two different sizes of hand made orgonite. Two different orgnoite makers,
Zachar and Michael, have offered to custom make orgonite for our campaign
contributors! We will have smaller pendants and larger desk pieces available as
gifts.
Mercury Reiki with Kate - All I can say
is she is AMAZING! A truly incredible Shamanic energy healer. This gift is
perfect for locals to the Bay or far away. She is offering her Mercury Reiki
sessions both in-person and long distance. Distance Reiki is surprisingly
effective! If you need some deeeeeeeeeep healing and revitalization, give a
contribution and let yourself receive this gift!
Nutrition for Cancer Prevention with Flow - Are you ready to be healthy and happy long into your old age? If we give our
bodies the right foods and create a healthy lifestyle, we will function well with vibrant our whole lives. There are
very easy ways to prevent cancer and other serious disease. Are you ready for a
powerful lifestyle change? With this gift you receive three phone sessions with Holistic Health Counselor Elaena Flow on Nutrition for Cancer Prevention, and your life will never be the same!
Transformational Photography with Aleksandra
Dubov - WOW! What a gift! See, feel and know your true beauty through the eyes
and lense of Aleks. In a 3 hour sessions she takes participants on a deep
journey of self love and helps them access their authentic essence and deep
beauty. Then, she photographs it! This package includes 11 edited photos of
your experience. This is so much more than a photoshoot.
Shamanic Sound and Energy Healing - Three
practitioners. Two hours. You. This is a recipe for profound healing and
revitalization! If you want to be cared for in the highest way by three loving
healers of multiple modalities, this is the gift for you! We will take you on a
sound, massage and energy healing journey like you have never experienced.
Goddess Prayer Painting - Let us show you our
appreciation for your contribution by creating a customized and deeply
intentional prayer painting with our bodies, our hearts and our souls. This
large canvas custom creating painting will be created in a deep ritual of love,
peace and healing. We will use our bodies, paint brushes and creative tools to
co-create a masterpiece of the moment. We will document our creation process
for you and send you the final work of art!

The Impact
With your help we can make a powerful place in
the East Bay for alternative and shamanic healing and ritual. We have a goal to create many temples of this kind, both Urban and Nature, and plan to blossom into a non-profit
organization that grows from this seed of The Urban Temple.
Contribute now to help bring this vision into
reality and create a ripple effect of healing and empowerment worldwide.
Thank you for your support! Stay in touch through our contact form on our website: www.theurbantemple.org. We look forward to growing with you!!Share this campaign with your facebook friends
and other networks to help The Urban Temple come to life!

story:
** Be sure to check out the Updates page! There are some changes, including:

- The Presale price has been dropped to $22 - shipping included!
- When we reach 50% of the goal I will release an exclusive 15-minute yoga class to contributors!
- When we reach 100% of the goal, I will release an exclusive 60-minute yoga class to contributors!

 

My name is Rob Ciano, and I'm a filmmaker, writer, and yoga instructor. This is the Preorder and Campaign page for my new book:



Long title, I know. I usually just refer to it as "Yoga Off the Mat" or "YOtM".

So what is Yoga Off the Mat about, anyway? This isn’t a book about getting your best Instagram-worthy shot in front of a waterfall in the rainforest, nor does it advocate sitting in deep meditation for weeks at a time. Yoga Off the Mat is about translating the lessons we learn about our yoga practice to our lives, struggles, and loves outside of the studio.

Have you ever considered what the Warrior II posture could teach you about dealing with hardship? Did you know you could apply the principles of balance in Tree Pose to your busy daily schedule? Would you like to know how to “live” in the focused mindset you practice on the mat?

One of the things I talk about in my yoga classes is that anything can be yoga, if you want it to be. That’s what Yoga Off the Mat teaches as well. Even if you’ve never stepped foot into a yoga studio, I believe this book will be of benefit to you. Through vivid description and imagery, the book dissects the lessons we learn from our instructors, and from our own bodies, and translates it to our daily lives and our daily struggles.

I believe this is a perspective that is oftentimes lost when we attend a yoga class. Many people go to class, find a positive and healing mindset for the hour or 90 minutes they’re in the studio, and almost immediately shift back to the same patterns they always live in. With Yoga Off the Mat as a tool to them, they don’t have to leave these lessons behind - and will in fact have a guide to applying these what they've learned! As such, I believe that Yoga Off the Mat could be of great benefit, most especially to yogis who would like to continue their practice outside of class, but also to people who may not be interested in (or physically capable of) a physical asana practice.

In addition to my own observations about yoga, this book will feature contributions from other yogis I've studied with and their perspectives on the lessons we learn in class. Not only that, but YOtM will feature stories and input from people outside the Yoga world, including CrossFit instructors, entrepreneurs, and musicians. 

This IndieGoGo is meant to be both a Preorder for the book, as well as an opportunity to donate toward the actual creation of it. If you're only interested in the book and would like to stick with that, great! Your $25 purchase includes shipping. I sincerely hope Yoga Off the Mat speaks to you, and that you go on to share it with the people in your lives.

If you're interested in donating toward the creation of the book, you'll be helping to finance the completion of this book, as well as to hire a professional editor and proofer, and finally to publish and market the first edition. I would like to start working with these funds 30 days from the start of this campaign, with the goal of a completely edited draft 30 days after that.

Not only will I be grateful for your donation, but I believe that the readers of this book will be grateful as well. Yoga Off the Mat is a project I’ve been working on for a long time, and I truly believe it will benefit others immensely. Thank you so much for your consideration and for your contribution.

 

Of course, you can always simply Preorder YOtM from this page. And if you do Preorder, thank you so much! However, if you're interested in contributing to some of the other goals, including marketing and distribution, we have a bunch of great perks! These include:

$1 - A Thank You letter from me.
$5 - A Thank You letter AND STICKERS!
$15 - A digital copy of Yoga Off the Mat, as well as a Thank You letter from me.
$35 - A physical copy of Yoga Off the Mat, and the above
$50 - All of the above, plus a “I’ll Take My Yoga To Go” mug
$75 - All of the above, plus a “I’ll Take My Yoga To Go” notebook
$100 - All of the above, plus I’ll autograph your copy of the book

Just want a copy of the book? Send $22 and you'll get one, hot off the presses!

If you are a yoga studio or other retail space and are interested in selling copies of Yoga Off the Mat, we also offer alternate reward packages. Donations of at least $250 from a studio will receive 10 copies of Yoga Off the Mat to sell in their own space, with another 5 copies for every additional $100.

If you're interested in a larger investment in this book, write to me at robcianoyoga@gmail.com.



EXCERPT FROM THE INTRODUCTION

Long before I started practicing yoga, I found myself sitting on the couch, a few episodes in to the third or fourth season of some television show. I had my laptop on my lap, where I was not only working on a video project, but also had my browser open and was interacting with a few different websites at once; chatting in one window, scrolling endlessly in another... If that weren’t enough, I was also texting three different people on my phone; making plans with one, counseling another, and making idle chit-chat with the third.

And I was frustrated. Frustrated because I wanted to look at the next thing on my website, but I was also trying to make progress on my project. Yet every time I opened my video program back up, a text would come through that I wanted to respond to. Then I’d rewind the television show a minute or two because I hadn’t been paying attention and it looked like something important had happened. After rewinding, I turned back to the video program, only to have a message pop up on my computer chat.

It was around this time that I had a revelation. I realized suddenly that even though I was doing all of these things at once, I wasn’t actually doing any of them at all. Every time I started to make progress on something, my attention was stolen by something else. I was giving in to every whim that surrounded me. Did I mention that my roommate was trying to talk to me as well?

Eventually, I became restless with this arrangement and started experimenting with making a few changes. I made it a point to pay attention to how many things I was doing at one time, and decided that if I were going to work on a project, maybe I didn’t need to pay as much attention to websites or my phone. If I was watching a show, maybe I could take my focus specifically there, and put down my computer for the duration of the episode. If I were talking to someone, maybe I should really try to hear what they were saying, rather than simply waiting for my turn to talk.

But there was a problem. Though I had recognized the issue and started experimenting with new ways of approaching the obligations and responsibilities in front of me, I still had years of practice operating in an entirely different way. It was like traveling to the same office every day for a decade, then getting a new job at a new building on the opposite side of town. For a long time after you may get in the car and automatically start going in the direction you’re used to, maybe getting all the way to the office before realizing you’re at the wrong place.

Eventually, I found the solution to my issue. I don’t want to say yoga was love at first sight, but it was something new, and it felt good. Despite the fact that when I would fold forward, my hands would barely reach past my knees, there was something about going to the class and performing the asanas that felt like healing. I would consistently leave the class feeling better than I did when I went in, both physically and mentally. Of course, my new yoga practice was healing me- though I didn’t know why at the time.

What I learned later on was that, in addition to the asanas, I was practicing something below the surface. As I moved through the postures, learning to focus on the feeling of my body, I was also practicing how to quiet my mind, to focus on the present moment, and to discard unnecessary distractions. I realized that the things I was physically experiencing could be used as targets for mindfulness, and that mindfulness could be applied outside the yoga studio as well as within.

It wasn’t long before I came to another revelation: the things we practice on the mat in a yoga class aren’t meant to stay there. The physical practice of yoga is, in reality, a spiritual and mental practice of mindfulness- which can be called upon at any time and applied anywhere you like! By practicing yoga, you’re doing more than moving from posture to posture, you’re training your mind to operate more efficiently.

This book is about that phenomenon. There’s so much that we learn in class on our mats, yet many of us leave these lessons behind after Savasana, the final resting pose. However, my belief is that we can apply these lessons whenever we need them, even outside of class. What I’d like to give to the readers of this book is not only the awareness of these hidden lessons, but also the knowledge of how to call upon them and apply them in your daily life.

This book will investigate individual asana postures and sequences, and apply them outside the studio. That’s not to say this book is only for those of us who practice the yoga asanas. My hope is that anyone, even someone who has never entered a yoga studio, can apply these ideas to their daily lives. So regardless of whether you’re a novice, a guru, or have never done an asana in your life, this book will help you perfect Yoga Off The Mat.

Find a longer preview of the book on www.yotmbook.com.

story:
We are students at the University of Tennessee, Knoxville, and we are helping to raise money for the Knoxville FISH Pantries, a local non-profit food pantry that helps feed over 8,000 families per month.

​We love the goal behind this organization and think they are shining a light on such an overlooked issue that is so close to home. 

With Thanksgiving right around the corner, many of the 57,000 people living below the poverty line in Knoxville will go without a dinner. However, through donations from people just like you, the four local FISH Pantries are able to offer a 5-4-3, where $5 feeds a family of 4 for 3 days. This simple donation can bring so many people so much gratification

Help us help the FISH Pantries and let your donations be heard. Give a donation to give a smile!

story:
Aloha & Mahalo for taking time to check out this exciting opportunity and play an essential role in making our dreams of becoming Certified AquaCranial Therapists a reality!

What is AquaCranial Therapy?

AquaCranial Therapy is a truly unique experience enjoyed whilst floating in the ocean and incorporates a synergy of modalities including but not limited to: Craniosacral Therapy (CST), Myofascial Release (MFR), meridian balancing and acupressure, as well as yogic stretches. CST is rooted in Osteopathy and focuses on balancing the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) around the brain and spinal cord, sending a calming message to the central nervous system, which facilitates an “unlocking” of restrictions and decompression of the cranium, bones along the spinal column, and sacrum.   

AquaCranial Therapy was developed over 20 years ago by Rebecca Goff combining gentle, yet powerful, non-invasive techniques, that are paired with rhythmic movements, made by observing wild dolphins and whales. The ocean simulates a womb-like feeling that creates a nurturing space and safe haven where the recipient can let go and fall into a blissful state of mind.  The combination results in an effective protocol that releases pain, pressure & tension, and increases range of motion and flexibility from head to toe.  After the treatment recipients are assisted out of the water (as they may be in an altered state) and encouraged to lay down and re-calibrate in stillness…embracing an overall state of well-being and ultimate relaxation!

AquaCranial Therapy Sessions Address & Reduce the Effects of the Following Ailments:

  • Chronic Neck/Back Pain & Inflammation of Joints & Soft Tissue
  • Headaches, Migraines, & Temporomandibular Joint Syndrome (TMJ)
  • Mood disorders ~ Depression, Bi-Polar, & Seasonal Affective Disorder (SAD)
  • Memory & Cognitive disorders
  • Chronic Fatigue & Fibromyalgia
  • Ailments from Musculoskeletal, Central Nervous System (CNS) & Auto-immune disorders
  • Learning & Behavioral Impairments such as ADD, ADHD, & Autism
  • Chronic Pain & Inflammation of Joints & Soft Tissues
  • Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
  • Pregnancy-related physical and/or emotional issues

 

TEAM ALOHA AQUACRANIAL - WHO ARE WE & WHY IS THIS IMPORTANT TO US?

Penny and Anabel met on the Garden Isle of Kauaʻi while attending basic AquaCranial training.   They realized there were like-minded goals between the two of them and decided to join forces in pursuit of  attaining AquaCranial certification.  Next phase of the process would consist of traveling to complete advanced training in deep seas of  Bimini, Bahamas and Tonga, Oceania ~ a unique element that allows the opportunity to treat clients alongside dolphins and whales while connecting with the healing energies of  sound and vibration.  

​

Here's a bit of information about us... 

Penny holds a PADI Advanced Open Water Certification and embraces the culture and richness of the islands as a student of Hawaiian Studies. Her love and respect for the ocean and itsʻ plethora of fascinating creatures also inspires her photography.  After traveling the world and studying various healing modalities, within 5 minutes of her first AquaCranial treatment Penny knew to look no further - this was the modality for her!

​Anabel is a Licensed Massage Therapist (LMT) with a background in Nursing, who has a passion for alternative modalities - bridging the gap and engaging elements of nature, our “teachers” if you will, to promote and restore balance and well-being.  In June of 2015 Anabel fractured several vertebrae, sprained her neck, and suffered spinal whiplash from a diving accident, forcing her to retreat inward and surrender to months of recovery in stillness, as surgery was not a viable option.  In February of 2016, intuition led her to attend an AquaCranial training on Maui with Rebecca Goff. She received her first AquaCranial Therapy treatment and was astounded by the results: Increased circulation and blood flow as well as flexibility, relief of pain & pressure, powerful emotional release & an altered state of relaxation ~  an overall euphoric experience! The results of her sessions changed her life so profoundly she decided to embark on a mission to follow her calling and new-found purpose, dedicating her efforts to heightening awareness on the modality and share it with the world.​

Anabel & Penny are passionate, dedicated & driven to share this modality with as many people as possible to help our community feel revitalized, inside and out!  They would like to pursue serving the ohana (community) up close and personal with compassion and enthusiasm, providing relief for adults and keiki (children) challenged with trauma-induced impairments ; mental, physical and emotional. As these two AquaCranial Therapists continue to step into their role & join forces with other organizations to heighten awareness & overall benefits of this therapy, a sense of peace, joy, unity & continued state of well-being is restored.

Knowledge is power so let's celebrate that we are sovereign beings & as we share our ideas and experiences​, our communities thrive and flourish, raising our natural vibration. Team Aloha AquaCranial are trailblazers and believe in building solid foundations on pillars of optimal wellness and promote a balanced mind, body, and spirit so we can spearhead a movement unlike any other and as Gandhi would so eloquently put it ~ Be the change you want to see in the world!. We are including some information on ​Dolphin Therapy which is recognized along with Animal Assisted Therapy (AAT) and is gaining increased recognition in the scientific field. We are quite excited to see more evidence-based research highlighting the the advantages of Dolphin Therapy; especially interacting with children challenged in the areas of speech, behaviors and motor skills. Follow the link for more Information on Dolphin Therapy

What Does it Take to Achieve Certification?

AquaCranial Therapist Certification requires a total of 350 hours of treatment(s), which includes Basic and Advanced courses, and specialty training in Bimini, Bahamas and Tonga, Oceania to experience giving deep water treatments alongside wild dolphins and whales.  We desire to become committed specialists in our field.

There are currently only a handful of Certified AquaCranial Therapists worldwide. Unfortunately costs deter many students from pursing certification although there is a strong desire. We are confident that launching this campaign will provide a successful model to share with others down the line to fund their certification.

 

AQUACRANIAL THERAPY FOUNDER REBECCA GOFF ~ HER STORY:

Rebecca treating a client off Maui (Lana'i island in the background)

Rebecca Goff, our teacher and the creator of AquaCranial therapy, began performing Occupational Therapy on patients with cerebral palsy in swimming pools in the 1970's and today is a pioneer in Cetacean Therapy Research and one of of the most experienced people today in the field of Aquatic Biomagnetic Healing. Rebecca gives very generously as a teacher and therapist and has been teaching AquaCranial for over 20 years. She has given thousands of free treatments to families, with an emphasis on pregnant woman, infants and toddlers and in 2015 traveled to Nepal to work with the Chetanalaya Institute to perform her amazing work on victims of the earthquake. Rebecca is a certified Marine Mammal Naturalist and is on the board of Reef Kids International which is dedicated to saving the local Hawaiian reef plants and wildlife. Read more about Rebecca on links below:

Conde Nast Traveller : 19 Super Therapists and Healers

No Ka' Oi Maui Magazine: More than Skin Deep

doTerra: Chetanalaya Institute: Nepal's earthquake in 2015

 

AquaCranial Therapy Treatments ~ Testimonials:

"It was almost like a life experience of memories that accumulated into the most calming state I can say I ever experienced before in my life. I am very clinical....But this experience opened me up to a whole new healing arena".  James Waslaski, Sports Medicine Educator

"Rebecca cradled the back of my head in her hands as she guided my body through alternating patterns of stillness and movement. During the stillness, her touch under my head, on my forehead, and around my jaw was almost imperceptible.  Integrated with gentle pulls through the water and wavelike rocking from head to toe and side to side, Rebecca facilitated a freedom of movement and a level of relaxation and stress release I had never experienced. It was a feeling of movement and sensation without any physical effort, like dancing while lying still. The therapy itself was so gentle and so non-intrusive I was quite shocked by the level of relaxation I felt afterwards."   Courtney Mather,  Healing Retreats and Spas Magazine

 

What Do We Need to Get to Bimini?

Our Bimini budget: training (which includes accommodation for the week), round trip flights, travel insurance, transfers, materials and equipment. 

BUDGET PER PERSON:

 BIMINI TRAINING: $3300

RETURN FLIGHTS KAUA'I TO BIMINI: $2000

TRAVEL INSURANCE: $150

TRANSFERS: $300

MATERIALS AND EQUIPMENT: $250

TOTAL :

$6000 per person, $12,000 for two

CAMPAIGN EXPENSES:

CROWDFUNDING FEES: $1000

MILEAGE: $150

MATERIALS: $400

TOTAL:

$1550

 GRAND TOTAL: 

$13,550 USD

 

What INCENTIVES can we offer you, our wonderful contributors!?

 

FREE AQUACRANIAL THERAPY CLINICS ON KAUA'I

AquaCranial clinics on Kauai are a fantastic opportunity for us to give back to the community that supports us!  Each session we complete helps us get closer to reaching our ultimate goal & and a step closer toward our certification. We invite all of the family to take advantage of this unique experience. Reservations are required.

Clinics are scheduled in advance at Anahola Beach on the following dates & times:

Saturday June 17th ~ 8am to 1pm (HST)

Sunday June 25th~ 8am to 1pm (HST)

Saturday July 1st~ 8am to 1pm (HST)

Saturday July 8th~ 8am to 1pm (HST)

Saturday July 15th~ 8am to 1pm (HST)

OFF TO MAUI FOR TRAINING JULY 16th (CHILDREN AND INFANT)

OFF TO BIMINI FOR TRAINING ~ JULY  20th (ADVANCED DEEP SEA)

Please RSVP us at   aloha.aquacranial@gmail.com

 

PRE-PURCHASE PRIVATE AQUACRANIAL THERAPY TREATMENTS ON KAUAI

$121 USD ~ PRIVATE "ONE ON ONE" AQUACRANIAL THERAPY TREATMENT

$202 USD ~  TREATMENT FOR TWO (ie "Couples or Bring a Friend")

$303 USD  ~ SERIES OF 3: PRIVATE AQUACRANIAL THERAPY TREATMENTS  

 

Please email us at   aloha.aquacranial@gmail.com  to book your session(s).

Gift Certificates Available.

Valid for 12 months.

 Mahalo ~Thank you

 

More Perks For You to Check Out...

 

Photography by Jack Davis

JACK “Wow” DAVIS is one of the world’s leading experts on digital imagery, as well being an award-winning photographer and designer himself. He is coauthor of a dozen titles on digital photography, art and design, including the bestselling (over two million copies in 12 languages) and award-wining guides to Photoshop: The Photoshop Wow! Book, and How to Wow: Photoshop for Photography. One of the first inductees into the Photoshop Hall of Fame, he is also one of the Dream Team instructors at Photoshop World and a Master Teacher at Adobe's MAX conferences. Jack has a MA and MFA in Digital Imagery, and when he’s not in his studio in San Diego, he’s usually somewhere in Polynesia, camera in hand, capturing the local color. A massive Mahalo to Jack for his generous contribution of beautiful images here!

 

$99 USD Canvas Wrap 12" x 18" Hand stretched plain-woven fabric around kiln dried fir wood frame (plus shipping - international shipping rates on request) B&W Mother Whale and Calf by Jack Davis. 

 

$99 USD Canvas Wrap 12" x 18" Hand stretched plain-woven fabric around kiln dried fir wood frame (plus shipping - international shipping rates on request) Whale Breach by Jack Davis.  

 

Original Paintings by Seamus

"Seamus" is a well-known, self-taught artist living in Kauai. He has been painting on Hawaii for 35 years and the last 22 years of those living on Kauai. Seamus was a Scuba Diver and underwater photographer and following a diving accident in which he ruptured his ear drum, he taught himself to paint. He is most famous for his images of fish but as you can see here.. he paints beautiful whales! Thank you very much to our anonymous donor for these two beautiful canvas works:

 

$777 (complimentary shipping) 10 x 8 acrylic print on canvas, Untitled by Seamus 

$1333 (complimentary shipping) - 14 x 11 acrylic print on canvas Untitled by Seamus
 

More Perks

More physical perks will be made available in the coming days and weeks.. please check back here soon!

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Sharing is Caring! You can also share this campaign with friends and loved ones you feel might be interested in our cause and that goes a long way, so Thank You :-) We appreciate You!

 

Wow...Still With Us?! HaHa! One last request... See list below for other ways you can help:

  • Contributing goods and/or services for us to offer as incentives to our donatees, OR
  • Donate gear for use in training and clinic treatments, including:
  1. Wetsuits,
  2. Inflatable Neck Pillows,
  3. Beach Towels,
  4. Blankets,
  5. Beach Umbrellas or Pop Up Canopy Tents,
  6. Waterproof Watches,
  7. Assistance with capturing footage via Underwater Cameras/GoPro or Drone

For questions or concerns please email us at

aloha.aquacranial@gmail.com

 

Mahalo Nui Loa for your Support!

(Thank You Very Much)

With Aloha~ Anabel & Penny
story_txt:
Aloha & Mahalo for taking time to check out this exciting opportunity and play an essential role in making our dreams of becoming Certified AquaCranial Therapists a reality!What is AquaCranial Therapy?AquaCranial Therapy is a truly unique experience enjoyed whilst floating in the ocean and incorporates a synergy of modalities including but not limited to: Craniosacral Therapy (CST), Myofascial Release (MFR), meridian balancing and acupressure, as well as yogic stretches. CST is rooted in Osteopathy and focuses on balancing the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) around the brain and spinal cord, sending a calming message to the central nervous system, which facilitates an “unlocking” of restrictions and decompression of the cranium, bones along the spinal column, and sacrum.   AquaCranial Therapy was developed over 20 years ago by Rebecca Goff combining gentle, yet powerful, non-invasive techniques, that are paired with rhythmic movements, made by observing wild dolphins and whales. The ocean simulates a womb-like feeling that creates a nurturing space and safe haven where the recipient can let go and fall into a blissful state of mind.  The combination results in an effective protocol that releases pain, pressure & tension, and increases range of motion and flexibility from head to toe.  After the treatment recipients are assisted out of the water (as they may be in an altered state) and encouraged to lay down and re-calibrate in stillness…embracing an overall state of well-being and ultimate relaxation!AquaCranial Therapy Sessions Address & Reduce the Effects of the Following Ailments:
Chronic Neck/Back Pain & Inflammation of Joints & Soft Tissue
Headaches, Migraines, & Temporomandibular Joint Syndrome (TMJ)
Mood disorders ~ Depression, Bi-Polar, & Seasonal Affective Disorder (SAD)
Memory & Cognitive disorders
Chronic Fatigue & Fibromyalgia
Ailments from Musculoskeletal, Central Nervous System (CNS) & Auto-immune disorders
Learning & Behavioral Impairments such as ADD, ADHD, & Autism
Chronic Pain & Inflammation of Joints & Soft Tissues
Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
Pregnancy-related physical and/or emotional issues

story:
Summary

Located on 270 acres in the upstate New York Adirondack Mountains, The Adsila Retreat is nonprofit retreat, incorporated in the state of New York, for human trafficking healing retreats and free leadership retreats for the leaders of high-impact charitable nonprofits nationwide.  We are funded by social enterprise, property and financial contributions from our founders and donors like you! 

All we need is 650 people to open our inaugural Healing Center for human trafficking survivors aged 12-24 next September 2015!

One of the organizations we provide this facility for, FREE OF CHARGE, is GEMS Girls, the leading service provider for the survivors of human trafficking in the United States.  

  • Financially Strong:  We are debt free & proactively funded through social enterprise. 
  • Ready to Grow: We are two-thirds there already!  With 270 developed acres already paid for in full, basic renovations are the last step to open our doors and get results immediately!
  • Visionary Results-Driven Leadership: Proactive leadership team and a stellar advisory board. 
  • Exclusive Use:  The motivation is love.  There is no other purpose.  The purpose of the retreat is to facilitate powerful humanitarian work.  Nothing more. 
  • Perks: Through our partnership with our social enterprise, the Home CEO Academy, we are able to gift you access to a comprehensive 30-Day Total Life makeover program.   


What We Need & What You Get

We need just 650 people to open our retreat!

  • $200,000 will complete the renovations our Phase One 6,000 square foot dorm, dining and meeting facility to house up to 15 attendees and staff for small group healing retreats.
  • This includes the tangible costs of surveying, civil engineering, blueprints, installment of a geothermal heating and cooling system, dorm furnishings & bedding, widening of hiking trails, maintenance improvements to the horse stable, and remaining construction budget.
  • The Founders of the retreat have already acquired the land (valued at over $700K) and are funding over half of the renovation construction ourselves but we need your help for the last bit.  
  • Construction crews are scheduled next May, June and July in faith - our first inaugural healing retreat is next September 2015!
Donors will receive the following (select perks):
  • Access to a 30-Day Total Life Makeover program, called the Home CEO Academy and the award-winning book The Home CEO's Guide to Life, winner of the Living Now Book Awards silver medal for outstanding nonfiction.


The Impact

We work exclusively with the best led, best visioned humanitarian organizations with a proven track record of success - we simply catapult them even further.   Our primary recipient is GEMS-Girls, which provides educational and mentoring services to over 350 survivors of human trafficking aged 12-24 and policy and human services training for over 100 organizations, shelters and police departments.  


Risks & Challenges

The risks of construction projects include weather constraints during winter months, availability and timing of contractors, and unforeseen costs.  However, we are working with an award winning, incredibly talented Amish builder (Sylvan Stolzfus Construction) that is known for the steadfastness, exceptional quality and decades of experience.  Additionally, our architect (Alison Spear, Arquitectonica) is very experienced and is recognized as a leader in her industry.  With the exceptional quality of the construction leadership team, our project will go as smoothly as one possibly could and any hurdles during build will be handled through creative solutions and redesign as needed. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, here are some other ways you can help!

  • Share our campaign with friends and family!  The simple act of spreading the word helps more than you know!
  • Like us on Facebook!
  • Follow us on Twitter!
  • Consider an in-kind donation!  We need bedding, accessories, kitchen accessories, etc to complete the interior of the retreat.  If your business can donate new materials such as these, please contact us at info@adsilaretreat.org!
  • If you know of anyone, particularly moms, looking for a total life change program, refer them to our partner The Home CEO Academy, a 30-Day Total Life Makeover program which directs ALL of it's proceeds to this effort.   

Thank you for stopping by!  Please contact us if you have any questions.

Donors will receive the following (select perks):

Access to a 30-Day Total Life Makeover program, called the Home CEO Academy and the award-winning book The Home CEO's Guide to Life, winner of the Living Now Book Awards silver medal for outstanding nonfiction.







  The Impact We work exclusively with the best led, best visioned humanitarian organizations with a proven track record of success - we simply catapult them even further.   Our primary recipient is GEMS-Girls, which provides educational and mentoring services to over 350 survivors of human trafficking aged 12-24 and policy and human services training for over 100 organizations, shelters and police departments.  
  



Risks & Challenges The risks of construction projects include weather constraints during winter months, availability and timing of contractors, and unforeseen costs.  However, we are working with an award winning, incredibly talented Amish builder (Sylvan Stolzfus Construction) that is known for the steadfastness, exceptional quality and decades of experience.  Additionally, our architect (Alison Spear, Arquitectonica) is very experienced and is recognized as a leader in her industry.  With the exceptional quality of the construction leadership team, our project will go as smoothly as one possibly could and any hurdles during build will be handled through creative solutions and redesign as needed. 
  
Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute financially, here are some other ways you can help! 
Share our campaign with friends and family!  The simple act of spreading the word helps more than you know!
Like us on Facebook!
Follow us on Twitter!
Consider an in-kind donation!  We need bedding, accessories, kitchen accessories, etc to complete the interior of the retreat.  If your business can donate new materials such as these, please contact us at info@adsilaretreat.org!
If you know of anyone, particularly moms, looking for a total life change program, refer them to our partner The Home CEO Academy, a 30-Day Total Life Makeover program which directs ALL of it's proceeds to this effort.    
 Thank you for stopping by!  Please contact us if you have any questions.

story:
Short Summary

 

Hello my name is Darren Redmond and I am the Executive Director of a non-profit organization called PAIN (Parents and Addicts In Need) since 2009 and we have been providing educational resources, support services and recommendations to anyone looking for help in the journey back from substance abuse.  

The "Don't Hide the Scars Project" was started after our "Don't Hide the Scars" podcast brought to light the magnitude and misconceptions many people have about substance abuse. 

A mother should never have to walk into her sons bedroom to find him dead with his Xbox head phones still on, from an accidental overdose caused by pressed pill filled with Fentanyl  

A college aged student, should never find himself impaled on a fence hanging from it alone because he slipped while trying to jump a fence

A young mother struggling with addiction, should never feel so out of control and desperate, they jumped off a roof with the hope of killing themselves.

All three of these tragedies happened just a few miles from each other   in the Fresno/Clovis area of California

These are just a few of the stories we will cover in our documentary that you will help us bring to life.

 

  •  

What We Need & What You Get

Our documentary is being created to bring to light the drug culture as it is in 2021. We want to offer insight and real world testimony about the world of addiction.

While we will need more to complete the project we are asking for $25,000 

Anyone making  a contribution of $100 will receive a PAIN Tee-shirt ( Red or Black)

Anyone making a contribution of $500 will receive a Don't Hide the Scars Project Tee-shirt

Anyone making a contribution of $1,000 will receive  a Don't Hide the Scars Project Hoodie

Anyone making a contribution of $5,000 will receive Executive Director credits on the film

Anyone making a contribution of $10,000 or more will receive Executive Director credits on the film and sponsorship for one year on the "Don't Hide the Scars" podcast.

If we fail to hit our goal, we will find a way to complete this project. We will use what we raise and continue the project some how. 

The Impact

This project is being created to save lives. Our belief is that every life is worth saving. No one should die because of a bad choice

Risks & Challenges

Some of the stories we will attempt to tell are very heartbreaking. We are committed to being factual and respectful to everyone involved

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this request with all your friends and on your social media.

story:
THE PASSION STORY

Sara is a longtime practitioner of Ashtanga Yoga and started Joy Is My Armor to create a space for her local community to practice. Joy Is My Armor also serves as a platform for raising funds for charities she's passionate about. The charity she’s supporting currently is the Wild Bird Fund on the Upper West Side of Manhattan. She's already made a 2017 donation to the fund out of her own pocket. Why? Because she wanted to be an ornithologist when she was little and loves birds!

About 

Sara has been practicing yoga for most of her life. She started with Hatha Yoga as a kid under the guidance of her father, who also taught her Yoga Nidra. She did competitive horse riding and bicycle racing for years and rediscovered yoga after college. She began Ashtanga in 2001 and has been a dedicated practitioner since. She studies under a KPJAYI authorized teacher, Karri Jinkins, as well as at Pure Yoga West under Scott Harig, and has completed RYT-200 hours of Ashtanga primary and intermediate series training at Pure Yoga. 

Why Now and What Next

Tired of commuting 45 minutes to NYC to practice Ashtanga, Sara took a leap of faith and opened her own studio in a local shared movement space. But with very little capital, she needs to kickstart it so that she can meet her charitable contribution goals of donating profits to charity, currently the Wild Bird Fund. With any donations she receives, she'll continue to support her current class offerings and bring in guest teachers to build the Ashtanga community in Hoboken. Eventually, she’d love to secure her own yoga studio and likes the idea of renting it as a community space in off hours. If we meet our goal, or meet our goal halfway, we'll donate 6 month or 3 months of membership fees to the Wild Bird Fund. 

What’s Ashtanga Yoga?

Ashtanga is unique because students memorize a set sequence of postures in an open studio format where they receive one-on-one instruction from a teacher. This is way of learning is called Mysore-style, and it allows the student to work at their own pace, gradually building stamina, concentration, flexibility and endurance. Students are also asked to take a class led by a teacher once a week to stay on point with their personal practice. Ashtanga is taught in a very specific order, starting with the Primary Series, followed by the Intermediate and Advanced A (the Third Series).

Once a student becomes accustomed to the Mysore-style way of learning, they’re able to develop a home practice, begin to excel in many postures that had formerly been elusive and some even experience personal transformation. 

Ashtanga is meant to be integrated into your regular life, so we practice early in the morning before work and other commitments. The community is so important because we encourage and support each other. It’s the energy and dedication of others and our teachers that motivates us. 

Why Birds?

Fun fact: Sara grew up on a farm and raised all sorts of birds — pigeons, doves, chickens, ducks, geese, quail and finches. She wanted to be an ornithologist but ended up working in advertising instead. But she never lost her love of birds and still owns one small finch, though is focusing her energy on supporting wild birds.

Recently she met the Wild Bird Fund on the Upper West Side, NYC, and in lieu of donating her time, which is challenging with her yoga and full-time work schedule, she decided to donate JoyIMA profits to them. 

The Wild Bird Fund supports wild, urban birds in the New York City area. They care for and rehabilitate, then return birds to the wild. You can read more about the organization here.

Sara is also passionate about other causes, but she’s kicking this off by supporting her all-time favorite creatures. Stay tuned for other efforts!

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

Breaking It Down

We're looking for $9,265 to fund the yoga studio space for 6 consecutive months. This goes to rent the space ($7,500), pay operational costs including marketing materials ($200), guest teachers ($800) and transactional fees from Stripe & IndieGoGo ($765). If we can meet this goal, we'll donate membership fees from drop-ins, monthly fees or class packs to the Wild Bird Fund (up to $1,500). If we meet this goal halfway, then we'll consider the studio funded for 3 months and donate up to $750 to the Wild Bird Fund.

  • For a small contribution, we’ll give you free classes and some complimentary swag including totes, T-shirts and coffee (because we get up so darn early!). 
  • If we don’t reach our goal completely or halfway, the funds will be dispersed evenly over the next year to help maintain the studio with any donations made on a discretionary basis.
  • If we exceed our goal, we’ll donate more to the Wild Bird Fund and will update you with how much additional.

Risks & Challenges

Sara is a dedicated practitioner of Ashtanga and has been for almost 17 years. She’s thrilled to bring this to Hoboken, but there are realities of high rent and the slow progress of attracting more Ashtanga students. She has a full-time job too, which does takes time away from JoyIMA. The challenges she faces are:

  • Continuing to fund the studio, which is currently being done on primarily a personal basis.
  • Maintaining healthy growth through marketing efforts by adding more students.
  • Thwarting the capitalist tendency to turn every business venture into a way to make profits. This why giving back to the Wild Bird Fund is so important.
  • Doing good for the community by keeping the Ashtanga space a positive place to be by focusing on the well-being of her students and the charities JoyIMA supports.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We know some of you can't contribute funds, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
  • Get the word out by sharing this in your social media. A share or re-post means a lot!
  • Come to the studio and take a class!
  • Donate to the Wild Bird Fund on your own, or make a contribution to a charity you’re passionate about.
  • Support other local, Hoboken businesses. 

P

Photo credit: Yellow-billed Cuckoo at the Wild Bird Fund © Antonio Sanchez

We know some of you can't contribute funds, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

story:
WHO ARE WE?

 

PHILOSOPHY 

You are one of us if you are a conscious consumer and believe in our ethos :

 

VISION

We've got the independent kick-arse women part down, but we would LOVE your contributions to scale both HALF HIPPY productions and our dreams.

YOUR contributions will help US with: 

 

Half Hippy Products 

We are very happy to announce the launch of our all natural line of beauty and body care products. Everything is vegan, eco-friendly, and cruelty-free! 

1. Pit Police™ - Creamy Deodorant Paste. available in a jar: Lemongrass-Mint OR push-up tube: Lemongrass-Mint or Rosemary-Cedar

2. Bae Brow™ - Tinted Brow Pomade. available in 3 shades: Sand (blonde), Cocoa (brunette), and Midnight (black)

3. Cosmic Dust™ - Skin Brightening Dry Mask (customizable to your skin type!)

4. New Skin, Who Dis?™ - Exfoliating Body Scrub

Click HERE for a detailed description of products.

Click HERE for a detailed list of ingredients.

 

Packaging & Sustainability

Being eco-conscious and supportive of mama earth is a big priority for us. We also believe that packaging is just as important as the product itself and put a good deal of thought into what we use. We choose recyclable and biodegradable options over plastic as much as we can.

Our 100% biodegradable boxes are handmade from lokta paper in Nepal. Lokta paper is made from the daphne shrub, a sustainably grown and harvested plant using a very special and traditional papermaking process. It also ethically supports the artisans that create our boxes and farmers that harvest the shrub. Under the right conditions, lokta paper has the ability to sprout!

Our deodorant push-up tubes are made from paperboard which is also 100% biodegradable. Our deodorant, mask, and brow pomade jars are packaged in glass for durability with recyclable plastic lids.

 

Half Hippy Perks Description

Click on the images below for a detailed PDF of our perks!

1. $15: Raffle & Half Hippy Love    2. $ 25: Drinking Hippy + Raffle  

                                                         

 

3. $25: 1 Product + Raffle         4. $50: Half Hippy Starter Pack + Raffle 

                                               

 

    5. $100: "Treat Yo Self"                     6. $250: "All About You, Boo" 

                                              

7. $500: Green Beauty Kaweeen                   8. $1000: Half Hippy Life 

                                             

 

Half Hippy Press

To read article click here. 

 

Thank you for your support. Spread the good vibes and reshare our campaign on your social media. All the love is much appreciated. 

Special Shout Out & Thanks to:

Kareem Atallah: Kareem Was Here Productions

Nico Behnzukeh: Photography 

Yala Mandala: Product Packaging

story:
The Connection Cure is a cross-country human engagement project that explores face-to-face connection as a catalyst for healing and wellness. 

 

Humans are wired to connect. I know this because I spent years doing the opposite—being social instead of soulful, isolating myself so people wouldn’t see my vulnerability and sickness. I retreated inward instead of asking for support until, one moment, something woke me up.

For most of my life I’ve suffered from dis-ease. From as far back as I can remember, I’ve bounced from doctor to doctor trying to discover the root of the problem. At the age of eight I was diagnosed with Lyme Disease and since that time my body has never felt at ease. My symptoms have come and gone over the years, worsening over time into something that doctors struggle to diagnose. Along with recurring Lyme, I’ve been diagnosed with fibromyalgia and myofascial pain disorder, but overall doctors say they can’t pinpoint why I’m unwell. It’s a mystery, they tell me.

What isn’t a mystery however is this: Chronic dis-ease has led me into a vicious cycle of isolation and loneliness.

It was during a Positive Psychology training program that someone said, “micro-moments of love contribute to our well-being”. In other words, connection doesn’t just feel good, it can change our bodies. This idea was revolutionary to me. As I began studying the science behind that quote, I learned how relationships and micro-moments can literally change our bodies—it spikes our DHEA levels, lowers cortisol, boosts our immune system, and increases longevity. Soon I began to realize that, by isolating myself and disengaging with life, I had aided in my own illness.

 

In that moment, an idea was born: the Connection Cure.

 

What is the Connection Cure Tour?

4 years, 50 states

The Connection Cure is a cross-country human engagement project that explores face-to-face connection as a catalyst for healing and wellness, and it aims to answer these questions:

One: If more people learn about how engagement changes our bodies, and begin to connect more—with friends, family, and total strangers—can we help heal ourselves and start to heal our country?

Two: As an experiment, can I help heal my own body by engaging in micro-moments of connection and deeper engagement with life?

Over the next four years, I hope to visit every state in the country, offering workshops about the science and practice of connection. The workshops are part discussion and part interactive activity, where we deepen our ability to listen and relate, learn the science behind the healing process, and create belonging with ourselves and one another.

On the personal side, I’m working with an internist and infectious disease specialist at Mt. Sinai Hospital to measure the impact of this experience on my body—she’ll regularly measure my blood levels of oxytocin, DHEA, cortisol, vasopressin, and gonadotropin to see if or how this engagement changes my body.

Finally, the Connection Cure tour practices what it preaches. Along the road, I will be engaging with strangers while listening and sharing their stories of connection, community, and belonging over various social media and blog platforms. This is not just my story, it’s everyone’s story. It’s about finding similarities and inspiration in places that might surprise us.

The Connection Cure is a social experiment and a way to bring more tools of connection to people in an increasingly disconnected world. To do this, I am drawing on 15 years of study and experience in the US and abroad, working with non-profits and NGOs, youth, and women; and I've done HIV/AIDS mitigation, community work, coaching and storytelling workshops. I've also studied mind body medicine, positive psychology and nonfiction writing. I've synthesized all of these pieces of my journey into a series of offerings that I hope will inspire people to step outside of their comfort zones, befriend each other, listen more deeply, and share their gifts. This project is an action step to bring tools of engagement out into the world, to challenge people, share stories, and highlight the positive connections that we make everyday. 


Uber Pool micro-moment with strangers, San Francisco

 

Why the Connection Cure Tour? And why now?

We’ve never needed connection more than we do right now. Our country is polarized and disconnected, which breeds misunderstanding, isolation, fear, even hatred. This disconnect is also making us sick, literally—over 60 million Americans feel so isolated that their health is damaged in ways that mirror the effects of high blood pressure, smoking and obesity.

We all get lonely and we all feel disconnected at times. But admitting this can feel taboo. I’m on a mission to kill that taboo, to talk openly about loneliness and disconnect, and to help others do the same—because connection is healing. When we engage, when we listen and tell our stories, we gift that person an immunity boost, quite literally.

 

What happens on the road?
 

Connection Cure Workshops

I will be offering Connection Cure workshops in as many locations as possible in each state, including free workshops for local non-profits when we adapt the activities for different populations. The workshops will be offered in different locations; for example, living rooms, schools, offices, community centers, churches, synagogues, yoga studios, and libraries. By offering these workshops in different settings, we hope to discover the common threads that bring us together. 

At these workshops, we’ll create a safe space to have discussions around loneliness and vulnerability, evolution and the body, and the courageous art of listening. We’ll talk about the science of connection. We’ll share our own stories about moments of engagement, and we’ll be challenged to step outside of our comfort zones, engaging more with ourselves, others, and the world. As we do, I hope we can spark a revolution of connection.

New Vista Ranch, Nevada – Non-profit for intellectually and developmentally disabled adults

Beverly Hills, California

 

Connection Cure Conversations

Storytelling and story-sharing are a big part of the Connection Cure tour. On the road, I stay open to meeting fascinating people and taking the time to listen to their stories of connection and disconnection, of belonging and community. These stories will be shared over social media and written blog format as I travel–– with the hope of one day becoming a book.

South Pass, Wyoming Micro-Moment 

Brooklyn, NY Micro-Moment 

 

How can you become part of the Connection Cure?

 

Donate

This is a lofty goal, and over the last year I’ve invested my own money, traveled to five states, and hosted 18 free workshops. I've stayed with strangers, reconnected with people from my past, and made new community along the way. All of me believes in this project, so before asking for support, I wanted to invest my time, energy, money, fear and excitement into it. 

I now believe in it even more. But, I also know I can’t do this alone. Four years visiting every state in America will take time and money. So I’m hoping that—if the idea gives you hope and gets you excited—you’ll invest to help make this project happen, in whatever way you can.

 

Host a workshop

You can also support the tour by hosting a workshop! Or hosting me on your floor, your couch, or air mattress. If you or anyone you know is interested in hosting a workshop, all you / they need to do is fill out this submission form and I’ll be in touch: Connection Cure Submission Form

 

Share your micro-moment stories

Social Psychologist, Barbara Fredrickson, defines micro-moments as, “a genuine positive exchange, not just with friends or loved ones, but with strangers.”

We all have a story about a time when we connected unexpectedly with someone; a time when we were moved by a stranger, someone different than us, someone just like us.

The Connection Cure is collecting micro-moment stories across the country, in written, video, and photo format to be displayed on the Connection Cure website (in development) and social media platforms. Share your own meaningful conversations, surprising interactions, and moments of connection and join our micro-moment movement! We hope that sharing these stories of connection, will empower others to do the same!

Share Your Stories Here

Waiting on line at AAA for three hours? Perfect time for a micro-moment.

 

Join the community

Or you can support just by following the journey! There are many ways to become part of the Connection Cure Community:

Instagram, Facebook, and sign up for the blog 

 

The Connection Cure has already begun!

I’ve already done 18 workshops in Salt Lake City; Lander and Jackson Hole, Wyoming; La Jolla, Los Angeles, and San Francisco, California; and Reno and Las Vegas, Nevada.


Salt Lake City, Utah

Lander, Wyoming 

Jackson Hole, Wyoming

Los Angeles, California

New Vista Ranch, Las Vegas NV

Highland Park, Los Angeles 

Larchmont, Los Angeles 

Las Vegas, Nevada

La Jolla, California

Oakland, Calirfornia 

Reno, Nevada

 

 

Where am I going next?  

 

February 19th - March 19th I’ll be traveling across Florida (West Palm, Jupiter, Boca Raton, Miami, Everglades City, Ft Meyers, Dunedin, Weeki Wachee, and Ft Lauderdale) hosting workshops and stopping along the way to meet and speak with strangers.

 

Ideal Locations for 2018: New Mexico, Arizona, Texas, Oregon, Washington, Idaho, Montana, South Dakota, Illinois, Michigan, Tennessee, Alabama, Louisiana

 

If I invest some $$ in this, where does my money go?

These funds are to help with the Connection Cure across the remaining 45 states over the span of four years (roughly $600 per state)

Workshops + Coaching sessions - The goal in each state is to host a minimum of four and a maximum of twelve workshops. 

Non-Profit events - In each state, the Connection Cure will host free workshops for local non-profits.

TraveI - I fly to a central destination for each region and then travel to specific workshop locations by car, bus, or train. 

Accommodations - On the rare occasion that I don’t have a local host, I’ll rent an AirBnb or hotel.

Food - Cause I gotta eat my spinach.

Materials/Marketing - Workshop materials and spreading the word. 

Production Costs - (media) - Filming / editing videos / part-time help. Short, simple videos to keep the ripple effect going, and share stories and micro-moments from the road. 

Micro-Moment Platform - The new website will host a media platform to share micro-moment stories.

 

 

What do past workshop participants have to say? 

 

Juanita Bell, Lead Member Service Coordinator, New Vista Ranch. Las Vegas, Nevada

“Lisa visited with staff and members of New Vista Ranch in Las Vegas in the Fall of 2017, during the Connection Cure tour of the West.  New Vista serves youth and adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities (IDD) by providing supportive living homes and programs which empower our members to live life to the fullest!  

Initially, Lisa was invited to speak with our staff and address the roles of caretakers, the importance of engaging in self-care and the need to connect with other staff members. Our members visited with Lisa prior to the workshop, and ended up participating in the workshop. There was a magical force that moved through the room as Lisa interacted with our members and staff, to the point that it moved those of us in attendance to tears, and Lisa openly wept with us. There is genuine love and unadulterated joy in working with individuals with IDD, something that Lisa, in her enlightened sensitivity, immediately connected with. Our members instantly fell in love with her."


Val, Director of Women’s Services - Supportive Housing for Homeless Women, West Palm, Florida 

“Lisa, I have to tell you that the women are still going on about how wonderful your time with them was. They sent me emails over the weekend stating how impactful the workshop was and how yours was the best presentation they had ever attended!

Thank you so much for impacting their lives as you had.” 
 

Matthew Steven Stucky, Los Angeles CA 

“Hosting The Connection Cure couldn’t have been easier or more rewarding. Lisa is a gifted speaker and master at creating a safe and welcoming space in which to explore new ideas. Thanks to her powerful message and approachable style it was fun and easy to learn about and explore the role micro-moments can play in healing and strengthening us in our journeys through this progressively complex world. Each and every member of our group left our workshop with Lisa buzzing with excitement and armed with new perspectives on healing, loneliness, friendship, illness, engagement and purpose - all the while having laughed and loved through the night. To all the micro-moments to come!!! Thanks Lisa.” 

 

Schneur Menaker, Reset To Love Event, New York City

"Lisa gave an incredible workshop on human connection! I’m still hearing feedback from attendees about how they felt uplifted and inspired! The importance of human connection is often unvalued in modern life. There were some people who were skeptical when Lisa said she was going to speak on the topic. But she impressed the scientists and the spiritual types alike by taking us to a logical place of understanding that we need human connection. She presented scientific evidence and shared her own personal story to illustrate that human connection is the salvation and cure in this digital era.  Lisa’s stories were personal and relatable and she created a safe space for people to not only listen but to share their stories as well. We can't wait to have her back!" 

 

Haleigh Hoff, Reno, Nevada 

"The connection cure workshop with Lisa was both intimate and expansive for me and the people who attended with me. It was powerful to see how we each became more open, honest and comfortable with each other and ourselves as we learned about connection and how it can heal. I walked away feeling genuinely moved, and also excited to take the knowledge Lisa shared with us and adapt it into my daily life.” 

 

About Me

I’m a practitioner of positive psychology and a life coach with an MFA in creative nonfiction writing. I truly believe that every experience in my life has led me to the Connection Cure. From living in Swaziland as a Peace Corps volunteer, working in documentary film, being a NYC tour guide, a professional team builder, a playwright's assistant, and then becoming a coach, there has always been a strong thread that has held it all together– I am most alive when I am connecting with others face-to-face, listening to their stories. I believe we are all storytellers. I believe we all have an innate desire to be seen in our truth and vulnerability. I believe that instead of seeking inspiration, we can BE the inspiration. The Connection Cure isn't just my story – it's everyone's story. 

 

Official Bio

Lisa Daron Grossman is a speaker, life coach, and practitioner of positive psychology. She received her training as a Certified Professional Life Coach from the Coaches Training Institute and the International Coaches Federation as well as a Positive Psychology certification from The Flourishing Center. She has her MFA in Creative Nonfiction writing from the New School, a BA in Cultural Anthropology, and a certificate in Mind-Body medicine from the Center for Mind-Body Medicine. 

Want to learn even more about the history of the Connection Cure?! Check out this interview
story_txt:
The Connection Cure is a cross-country human engagement project that explores face-to-face connection as a catalyst for healing and wellness.  Humans are wired to connect. I know this because I spent years doing the opposite—being social instead of soulful, isolating myself so people wouldn’t see my vulnerability and sickness. I retreated inward instead of asking for support until, one moment, something woke me up.For most of my life I’ve suffered from dis-ease. From as far back as I can remember, I’ve bounced from doctor to doctor trying to discover the root of the problem. At the age of eight I was diagnosed with Lyme Disease and since that time my body has never felt at ease. My symptoms have come and gone over the years, worsening over time into something that doctors struggle to diagnose. Along with recurring Lyme, I’ve been diagnosed with fibromyalgia and myofascial pain disorder, but overall doctors say they can’t pinpoint why I’m unwell. It’s a mystery, they tell me.What isn’t a mystery however is this: Chronic dis-ease has led me into a vicious cycle of isolation and loneliness.It was during a Positive Psychology training program that someone said, “micro-moments of love contribute to our well-being”. In other words, connection doesn’t just feel good, it can change our bodies. This idea was revolutionary to me. As I began studying the science behind that quote, I learned how relationships and micro-moments can literally change our bodies—it spikes our DHEA levels, lowers cortisol, boosts our immune system, and increases longevity. Soon I began to realize that, by isolating myself and disengaging with life, I had aided in my own illness. In that moment, an idea was born: the Connection Cure. What is the Connection Cure Tour?4 years, 50 statesThe Connection Cure is a cross-country human engagement project that explores face-to-face connection as a catalyst for healing and wellness, and it aims to answer these questions:One: If more people learn about how engagement changes our bodies, and begin to connect more—with friends, family, and total strangers—can we help heal ourselves and start to heal our country?Two: As an experiment, can I help heal my own body by engaging in micro-moments of connection and deeper engagement with life?Over the next four years, I hope to visit every state in the country, offering workshops about the science and practice of connection. The workshops are part discussion and part interactive activity, where we deepen our ability to listen and relate, learn the science behind the healing process, and create belonging with ourselves and one another.On the personal side, I’m working with an internist and infectious disease specialist at Mt. Sinai Hospital to measure the impact of this experience on my body—she’ll regularly measure my blood levels of oxytocin, DHEA, cortisol, vasopressin, and gonadotropin to see if or how this engagement changes my body.Finally, the Connection Cure tour practices what it preaches. Along the road, I will be engaging with strangers while listening and sharing their stories of connection, community, and belonging over various social media and blog platforms. This is not just my story, it’s everyone’s story. It’s about finding similarities and inspiration in places that might surprise us.The Connection Cure is a social experiment and a way to bring more tools of connection to people in an increasingly disconnected world. To do this, I am drawing on 15 years of study and experience in the US and abroad, working with non-profits and NGOs, youth, and women; and I've done HIV/AIDS mitigation, community work, coaching and storytelling workshops. I've also studied mind body medicine, positive psychology and nonfiction writing. I've synthesized all of these pieces of my journey into a series of offerings that I hope will inspire people to step outside of their comfort zones, befriend each other, listen more deeply, and share their gifts. This project is an action step to bring tools of engagement out into the world, to challenge people, share stories, and highlight the positive connections that we make everyday. Uber Pool micro-moment with strangers, San Francisco Why the Connection Cure Tour? And why now?We’ve never needed connection more than we do right now. Our country is polarized and disconnected, which breeds misunderstanding, isolation, fear, even hatred. This disconnect is also making us sick, literally—over 60 million Americans feel so isolated that their health is damaged in ways that mirror the effects of high blood pressure, smoking and obesity.We all get lonely and we all feel disconnected at times. But admitting this can feel taboo. I’m on a mission to kill that taboo, to talk openly about loneliness and disconnect, and to help others do the same—because connection is healing. When we engage, when we listen and tell our stories, we gift that person an immunity boost, quite literally. 
What happens on the road? Connection Cure WorkshopsI will be offering Connection Cure workshops in as many locations as possible in each state, including free workshops for local non-profits when we adapt the activities for different populations. The workshops will be offered in different locations; for example, living rooms, schools, offices, community centers, churches, synagogues, yoga studios, and libraries. By offering these workshops in different settings, we hope to discover the common threads that bring us together. At these workshops, we’ll create a safe space to have discussions around loneliness and vulnerability, evolution and the body, and the courageous art of listening. We’ll talk about the science of connection. We’ll share our own stories about moments of engagement, and we’ll be challenged to step outside of our comfort zones, engaging more with ourselves, others, and the world. As we do, I hope we can spark a revolution of connection.New Vista Ranch, Nevada – Non-profit for intellectually and developmentally disabled adultsBeverly Hills, California Connection Cure ConversationsStorytelling and story-sharing are a big part of the Connection Cure tour. On the road, I stay open to meeting fascinating people and taking the time to listen to their stories of connection and disconnection, of belonging and community. These stories will be shared over social media and written blog format as I travel–– with the hope of one day becoming a book.South Pass, Wyoming Micro-Moment Brooklyn, NY Micro-Moment  How can you become part of the Connection Cure? DonateThis is a lofty goal, and over the last year I’ve invested my own money, traveled to five states, and hosted 18 free workshops. I've stayed with strangers, reconnected with people from my past, and made new community along the way. All of me believes in this project, so before asking for support, I wanted to invest my time, energy, money, fear and excitement into it. I now believe in it even more. But, I also know I can’t do this alone. Four years visiting every state in America will take time and money. So I’m hoping that—if the idea gives you hope and gets you excited—you’ll invest to help make this project happen, in whatever way you can. Host a workshopYou can also support the tour by hosting a workshop! Or hosting me on your floor, your couch, or air mattress. If you or anyone you know is interested in hosting a workshop, all you / they need to do is fill out this submission form and I’ll be in touch: Connection Cure Submission Form Share your micro-moment storiesSocial Psychologist, Barbara Fredrickson, defines micro-moments as, “a genuine positive exchange, not just with friends or loved ones, but with strangers.”We all have a story about a time when we connected unexpectedly with someone; a time when we were moved by a stranger, someone different than us, someone just like us.The Connection Cure is collecting micro-moment stories across the country, in written, video, and photo format to be displayed on the Connection Cure website (in development) and social media platforms. Share your own meaningful conversations, surprising interactions, and moments of connection and join our micro-moment movement! We hope that sharing these stories of connection, will empower others to do the same!Share Your Stories HereWaiting on line at AAA for three hours? Perfect time for a micro-moment. Join the communityOr you can support just by following the journey!
